loans.name: Gul'chehra

texts.ru:
Гульчехре 56 лет. Она проживает вблизи города Душанбе. Гульчехра мать одиночка. У нее двое детей, сын и дочь. 
   Гульчехра 7 лет занимается продажей фруктов на рынке. Торговый бизнес достался ей от семьи, члены ее семьи тоже работали в торговой сфере. Она любит свою работу и старается дальше продвигать на новый уровень. На сегодняшний день Гульчехре нужна не большая сумма денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом и быть готовой к суровой зиме. Еще не поздно сделать ремонт, и совершенно нет времени для переноса ремонта. Она накопила денег, но ее не хватает и она надеется только на кредит.
texts.en:
Gul'chehra is 56. She lives near the city of Dushanbe. She is a single mother with two children, a son and a daughter. She has been selling fruit at the market for seven years, a business she learned from her family - members of her family also worked in retail. She loves her work and is trying to bring it to a new level. 

Gul'chehra currently needs a small amount of money to renovate her home and be ready for the harsh winter. It's not yet too late to do renovations but there's no time to postpone them. She has saved some money but doesn't have enough and so she is hoping for this loan.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Busazhida

texts.ru: Бусажида, 59 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У Бусажиды среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода, она занимается сельским хозяйством. На 0,21 Га собственной земельной доли она выращивает кукурузу. В хозяйстве также есть 1 корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Бусажиды составляет от 20,000 сом до 25,000 сом (KGS). Бусажида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит накопить средства на завершение строительства ее дома.
texts.en:
Busazhida is 59 years old, married, and has two children. Busazhida has a secondary education. As a main source of income, she is involved in agriculture. On 0.21 hectares of her own land, she grows corn. On her homestead, she has one cow and ten sheep. Busazhida monthly profit varies from 20,000 som to 25,000 som (KGS). Busazhida applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy one cow.

She plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, that will allow her so save money to complete the construction of her home.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Celia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos  mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es pescador.
Doña Celia es una ama de casa que para ayudarle  a su esposo realiza los créditos para que él lo emplee en su  trabajo, el se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da, ella por su parte asiste a las reuniones del banco porque su esposo la mayor parte del tiempo pasa ocupado en las faenas de la pesca, trabaja todos los días, su esposo y sus hijos que lo acompañan se van al mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro día por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus pangas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades, el lleva casi toda la vida realizando esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Lleva más de 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Crucita” meet in Crucita, a village in the Portoviejo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, popular with local and foreign tourists. The village is commonly called “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

This is where Celia lives. She is 54 year old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has five children who are adults now; two of them live with her. Her husband is a fisherman. Celia works as a housewife and requests these loans on behalf of her husband, so that he can use them to work. He sells the fish the sea gives him, and she comes to the communal bank’s meetings, since her husband is usually busy fishing. He works every day helped by some of their children. They leave in the afternoon and come back the next day in the morning, when those in charge of distributing the fish to the city markets come to his boat. He has been in this business almost his whole life.

With this loan, they will buy fuel, nets and other fishing supplies. Celia has been a member of this communal bank for more than eight years. She enjoys being a member because these loans help her a lot. Her dream is to give her family the best things.

loans.use: to buy fuel, nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna su actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is one of the members of the communal bank “Nueva Generación III,” located in the Cusco province. She is 30 years old and single. Besides her daily activities, she sells groceries such as rice, sugar, and milk to different customers. She would like to continue working in order to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy beverages, among other products. She appreciates the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy beverages, among other products.

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es:
Alcibiades tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Este es un caserío mediano, la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cual brinda este servicio. Cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que tiene clientela fija de la zona y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral como son gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. El crédito será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil que actualmente se encuentra deteriorada, con esto Alcibiades espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alcibiades is 40 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children in the district of Pomahuaca, Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru, It is a medium sized community and it's inhabitants work in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

He works offering public transport. He has his own motorcycle taxi to provide this service. He has 5 years of experience in the field so he has regular clients in the area and good personal and labor references in the zone. He also raises barnyard animals like chickens, ducks, turkeys, etc. The loan will be used to do some repairs and maintenance on his vehicle which currently is in poor condition. Doing this Alcibiades hopes to provide better service to his clients which will be reflected in his level of income and in the end in his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle that is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Toktorali

texts.ru: Токторали, 53 года, женат, 4 детей. У Токторали среднее образование, на протяжении 24 лет вместе с супругой активно занимаются животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Токторали есть 4 коровы, 14 овец. На участке мерою 1,8 Га он выращивает арбузы и кукурузу. Он очень трудолюбивый, ответственный и целеустремленный. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Токторали обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян капусты и арбузов.  Он является участником группы "Асема", в которой кроме Токторали состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Токторали планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса, он хочет построить большой сарай для скота и в будущем приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en:
Toktorali is 53 years old, married, and has four children. Toktorali has a secondary education. For the last 24 years together with his wife, he has been raising livestock. Currently on his homestead Toktorali has four cows and 14 sheep. On a plot of land measuring 1.8 hectares, he grows watermelons and corn. He is very hardworking, responsible and purposeful.

With the aim of further developing his homestead, Toktorali applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers and seeds for cabbages and watermelons. He is a member of the "Asema" loan group, in which besides Toktorali there are two other people.

Toktorali plans to invest income from the loan in further developing his business. He wants to build a large barn for livestock and in the future to purchase an automobile.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of cabbages and watermelons in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Modesta Andrea

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señorita Modesta, tiene 59 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Modesta es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre le ha tocado trabajar  para salir adelante, ella se  dedica al comercio, vende productos para el hogar como: (licuadoras, planchas, ventiladores, colchones, entre otros) a través de cartillas de la distribuidora La Gran Cadena, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, entrega los productos y va cobrando cada 8 días,  lleva en este negocio por más de 18 años con el cual ella ha podido salir adelante y así ayudar a sus padres ya que ellos están muy ancianos.
Este crédito es para comprar licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros productos y artefactos. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of Crucita communal bank meet in Crucita, a parish of the Portoviejo canton. This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it, popular with local and foreign tourists. It is also known as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

This is where Modesta lives. She is 59 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Modesta is a hardworking woman who has always had to work in order to get ahead. She is a businesswoman who sells home products, such as blenders, irons, fans, and mattresses. She uses a catalogue from a distributor called La Gran Cadena. She sells door-to-door. She delivers her products and collects the money every week. She has been in this business for more than eighteen years and has been able to make headway and help her parents, who are very old now.

With this loan, she will buy blenders, irons, mattresses and other home products. She is one of the founders of the communal bank and enjoys being a member because these loans help her a lot. Her dream is to be healthy and continue working.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, and other home products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for hired labor to make bricks

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a 58-year-old married woman with 12 children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She dreams of educating her children.

She has been concentrating on running a farming business for 25 years. Despite her progress over these years, she is challenged by limited capital as well as pests and diseases that affect her tomatoes.

She used her previous loan to buy herbicides to spray her gardens. Angella intends to use this loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Yusifa

texts.en:
Yusifa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusifa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to address his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusifa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Yusifa expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, ensure that his children, Ali, Basir and Mamud, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy necessary food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure on him to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулназ средне-специальное образование, работу в селе найти очень тяжело, однако надо содержать семью и воспитывать детей. Поэтому уже 12 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы. На участке мерою 0,4 Га она выращивает экологически чистые рис, помидоры, огурцы. Ежемесячный доход Гулназ составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулназ обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку клеенки для парника, удобрений и семян помидоров, перца и огурцов. Гулназ является лидером группы "Рустам", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Гулназ планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulnaz is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising 2 children. Gulnaz has a secondary-specialized education. Finding work in her village is very difficult, however she needed to in order to support her family and raise her children. This is why she has been practicing farming for the past 12 years. She currently has 3 cows on her farm. She also has a 0.4 hectare plot of land on which she grows organic rice, tomatoes and cucumbers. Gulnaz's average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Gulnaz turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy oilcloth for her greenhouse, fertilizer and tomato, pepper and cucumber seeds. Gulnaz is the leader of the borrowing group "Rustam," which has two other members besides herself. Gulnaz plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase oilcloth for her greenhouse, fertilizer, and tomato, pepper and cucumber seeds to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Ramona Fredifina

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 63 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive con ella y sus pequeños nietos que son su felicidad.
Doña Ramona  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante sin tener que depender de nadie, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas, ella espera utilizar el  crédito para comprar helados de una marca nacional y comenzar con la venta ya que esto le piden sus clientes con frecuencia y espera así obtener mejores ganancia que le sirvan para seguir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en la compra de helados. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus metas son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “Crucita” meet in Crucita, a village in the Portoviejo canton. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, popular with local and foreign tourists. The village is commonly called “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

This is where Ramona, 63, lives. Some years ago her husband died, but they had three children together. They are adults now. She lives with her daughter and grandchildren, who bring her joy. Ramona likes to work to get ahead and not depend on anyone. She is a businesswoman who has a grocery store at home, where she sells all kind of products, such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, detergent, bottled water, beverages, and juices.

She will use this loan to buy ice creams from a local brand and start selling them, since many of her customers ask for them. She hopes to increase her profits and continue to get ahead. She has been a member of the communal bank for more than ten years. She enjoys being a member because these loans are of great help. Her goal is to continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ice creams to sell.

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Azucena, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aún viven con ella una de sus hijas vive en su casa la cual es casada y vive con su familia. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Azucena se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas mientras sus esposo esta en alta mar ella sale a comprar pascado a las embarcaciones que llegan de alta mar hasta las playas de la localidad para  luego  llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad y también entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta la localidad para luego llevar el pescado a otros cantones, ella también en las tardes en una carretilla vende fritadas acompañabas de plátano asado y gaseosas lo cual es de mucho agrado de las personas que a diario pasan por el lugar con lo cual se gana algo extra, empezó con la venta de fritadas hace poco tiempo pero en la venta de pescado muchos años atrás. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva más de 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The Crucita community bank is located in Crucita, a parish in Portoviejo canton.  The area, called Crucita the Beautiful, is known for its beautiful beaches, much visited by local and foreign tourists alike.  
Sra. Azucena, 70, and her husband have six grown children.  Two of her children live with her, including a married daughter who lives there with her family.  Doña Azucena's husband is a fisherman and she herself buys and sells fish.  Every morning, while her husband is working far out at sea, she buys fish from the boats coming in.  She then resells the fish to local buyers and to merchants who come here from other cantons to supply their own buyers.  Doña Azucena has a separate business in the afternoons selling fritadas with grilled plantains and cold drinks, a popular combination for passers-by here.  She operates the fritadas business from a cart and says that it provides her with an extra income.  She has sold fish for many years now, but the fritadas business is more recent.
Doña Azucena will use this loan to buy fish.  She joined her community bank 8 years ago and likes that she can fund her business with bank loans. 
For the future, Doña Azucena hopes for a steady income and good health.

loans.use: to stock her fish sales business.

loans.name: Abdulazeez

texts.en: Abdulazeez is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abdulazeez joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mahammadu, Kadija and Zainab. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulazeez would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulazeez can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abdulazeez  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of maize to sell

loans.name: Coleta

texts.en:
Hello Lenders. Meet Coleta: she is a 57-year-old small-hold farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small rural town in Central Kenya. Coleta and her husband have been blessed with lovely children.

For 20 years Coleta has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity.

Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular yet least exclusive hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful.

Coleta, however, is taking this a step further. Coleta is seeking a loan to begin horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high, so income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses that she currently has.

In the long run, with the increased income, Coleta will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

Help an entrepreneur mother with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single woman who has 2 children. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She also sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as being lack of finances. So she will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells and also to buy stock of cereals to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells and also to buy stock of cereals to sell

loans.name: Shkelzen

texts.en: Shkelzen is married and the father of six children living in a small village. He works very hard and all day, from early morning until late at night, doing agricultural work in order to earn a living. His wife used to work as a cleaner until she lost her job, so he has been the main and only source of income ever since then. He plants wheat and corn to use for his family’s consumption and also to sell for a profit. Now, he needs a loan in order to purchase guano and seeds for planting his crops. He is optimistic that this loan will help him to generate more income and to provide everything his children need, including their education. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he would like to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase guano and seeds for planting his crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman, and she has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, bread, soda, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in rural area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, flour and other items she sells. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, flour and other items she sells.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence used the previous loan to buy a heifer for her farm. She is a married woman with six children who are adults, two of whom attend school. She deals in farming livestock and also earns income from a salary as a teacher.

She faces challenges of limited capital and issues paying school fees for her children, but she has hopes of educating her children to the university level. Now, she needs a loan to buy a heifer for rearing.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for rearing.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Lawal expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem is a widow with one child. After she lost her husband, they moved into a house that her family provided.

Her widow’s pension was insufficient, so she began selling Amway products. She has been doing this work for one year. Her customers are her friends and acquaintances.

She’ll use this loan to buy more products and increase her sales. Her only goal is to raise her daughter as well as she can and to put her through college. She wants to be able to provide for herself without depending on anyone. For this reason, she wants to continue working and become a leader.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff:

Meryem  Hanım dul ve bir çocuk annesi.  Eşini kaybettikden sonra ailesinin verdiği eve taşınmış.  Dul maaşı   yetmediğinden amway ürünlerinin satış işine girmiş.  Bir yıldır bu işi yapıyor.  Müşterileri arkadaşları ve çevresi.  Bir yıl olmasına rağmen satışları çok iyi.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün alıp satışını arttıracak.  Tek amacı kızını en iyi şekilde yetiştirip üniversiteyi okutmak.  Onun tüm ihtiyaçlarını kimseye muhtaç olmadan karşılamak.  Bu yüzden de bu işine devam etmek ve liderliğe yükselmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Amway products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda Marilu

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz.
Doña Yolanda es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz y también él en su local vende aceites, lubricantes, líquidos de frenos y varios otros repuestos para los automóviles, el trabaja todos los días dentro y fuera de su taller ya que hay varias personas que conocen de lo bueno de su trabajo que lo llevan  a otros lugares, con el trabaja un ayudante a quien le paga por su trabajo, lleva más de 6 años con este trabajo el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aceites, líquidos de frenos y repuestos que vende. Lleva más de más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Crucita community bank is located in Crucita, a parish in Portoviejo canton. The area, called Crucita the Beautiful, is known for its beautiful beaches, much visited by local and foreign tourists alike. 
Sra, Yoland, 31, and her husband have two children, 10- and 7-years old, both in school.  Her husband has an auto repair business.  Doña Yolanda is applying for a loan that she will use to support his business.  Her husband repairs cars and also sells auto supplies: motor oil, lubricants, brake fluid, auto parts and other merchandise for everyday auto repair and maintenance.  Her husband works every day, both in and away from his shop.  Away, because he is known for his excellent skills and often called on to work in other places.  He has operated the business for 6 years and has one paid helper.  
Doña Yolanda will use this loan to stock the business with products--motor oil, brake fluid, auto parts--that the couple will resell.  She joined the community bank 3 years and likes that she can borrow funds to support the family business.
For the future, Doña Yolanda hopes to provide for her children in the best possible way.

loans.use: to stock her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan lives under very hard conditions in a small village in the western part of Kosovo. He is very poor, and while his wife stays home to care for their children, Ramadan is involved in agricultural work to earn a living. The only income they have is from the wheat and corn that he harvests on the land that he owns. 

Ramadan has also been able to use the harvest for his family’s nutritional needs, but their family is very large and he needs more income. Unsuccessful in finding another job, he has decided to now request a loan in order to purchase seed and guano. He hopes that this will give him more produce and larger quantities to sell for more income. 

Ramadan's goal is to find an additional job or one for his wife so that they can improve their conditions and provide a better future for their children. He is very grateful for this loan opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase seed and guano for his land

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Salamatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ezikel, Danlami and Nama.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Salamatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Musa is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children: Zainab, Abubakar and Hafsat are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Hannah, married and blessed with three children 

Hannah does poultry farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan to buy feed that will help improve her egg production. This will ensure that she supplies more eggs to the local market, ensuring increased income. She will use the anticipated income to cater to her family's needs for things such as food and clothing.

Hannah is grateful to Kiva for helping her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed that will help improve her productivity.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos pero uno de ellos falleció, los tres hijos que aun tiene son mayores de edad  y aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. 
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el tiene una volqueta y se dedica a la  venta de arena, piedra, ripio y materiales de construcción, todos los  días el realiza sus viajes transportando estos materiales a lugares donde le pidan sus servicios. El lleva más de 20 años realizando esta labor la cual les ha dado lo necesario  sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar arena, piedra y otros materiales de construcción.  Lleva más de más de 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos. Sus sueños son comprar una volqueta nueva.
texts.en:
The Crucita community bank is located in Crucita, a parish in Portoviejo canton. The area, called Crucita the Beautiful, is known for its beautiful beaches, much visited by local and foreign tourists alike.
Sra. María, 54, and her husband have four children, one of whom is now dead.  The other three children are grown, but still live with their parents.  Doña María's husband has a construction materials supply business and she is applying for a loan to support his business.  He sells sand, gravel and other building materials and owns a dump truck that he uses to ferry the materials to construction sites.  He has operated the business for 20 years and his earnings from the business have covered the family's expenses all those years. 
Doña María will use this loan to stock the business with sand, gravel and other building materials.  She joined the community bank 12 years ago and likes that she can borrow funds to support the family business.
For the future, Doña María hopes to buy a new dump truck.

loans.use: to stock her husband's construction supplies business..

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Balarabe, Sadic and Morat.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve on his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, de 45 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijas de 10 y 15 años de edad.- Creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería. Tomas, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. junto a su esposa e hijas a trabajar en las actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas que poseen. 

Tomas,  trabaja en las parcelas que alquila durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde sus hijas van a estudiar y el realiza viajes en un viejo carrito que tiene, para ganar ingresos adicionales para el sustento de su familia

Tomas, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para arreglar su vehículo, ya que por el momento lo tiene dañado y es una de las principales herramientas para transportar su cosecha o realizar viajes.

Tomas desea en un futuro comprar un terreno donde cultivar y poder pastar sus animales, ya que actualmente alquila terrenos y eso hace que sus ingresos se vean afectados.
texts.en:
Tomas, 45, is married and has two daughters ages 10 and 15. He was raised by his parents, who taught him how to work in agriculture and livestock. Tomas gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his wife and daughters to do farming chores and to milk the cows he owns.

Tomas works on the parcels of land he rents in the mornings and his wife takes care of household chores. In the afternoons, his daughters go to school and he takes trips in his old car to earn additional income to support his family.

Tomas needs a loan to buy spare parts to fix his vehicle. Right now, it’s damaged and it’s one of his main tools for transporting his crops or making trips.

In the future, Tomas wants to buy some land that he can cultivate and where he can let animals graze. He is currently renting land and this affects his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Esther and Uwana. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kezzia

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Kezzia, married and blessed with two children.

Kezzia does charcoal selling to earn a living and also does vegetable farming. She is borrowing a loan to add stock to the charcoal business. This will ensure she meets customers' rising demands, thus improving her income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for her family's needs.

Kezzia is happy with Kiva for helping her expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock that will help increase sales volume.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Nancy, who is 40 years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. Her economic activity is vegetable and dairy farming, which she does to earn a living. She is married and blessed with four children, who are all attending school. She is borrowing to buy manure and dairy feeds to help improve crop yield and milk productivity respectively. She hopes to earn more income that will help her cater for family needs such as food.

Nancy  is grateful to Kiva and all lenders for continued support.

loans.use: To buy manure and dairy feeds that help improve on crop yield and milk production.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La joven Maria Eugenia,es madre soltera de dos hijos de los cuales estan bajo su responsabilidad, labora como comerciante en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desempeñando esta labor desde hace 16 años, inicia sus labores a las 06:00 am y finalizándolas a las 04:30 pm con este mismo horario de lunes a domingo,con lo que es la venta de gaseosas, jugos, agua, entre otros producto, ella  realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar y de su mamá.   

La joven Maria,  solicito un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizo para compra de zapatos, pantalones, camisas, perfumes, cremas corporales, lo cual le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus ganancias brindándole un mejor nivel de vida, a la vez le permitirá incursionar en una nueva actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Young Maria Eugenia is a single mother with 2 children in her care.  She works as a merchant in one of the markets in the city of Leon.  She's been doing this work for 16 years.  She starts working at 6am, and finishes at 4:30pm.  She works according to this same schedule every day.  In her business, she sells soft drinks, juices, water, and other products.  She does this work to support her household and her mother.

Maria is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy shoes, pants, shirts, perfumes, and body creams.  With this investment she can increase her working capital and her earnings, and thereby improve her living standard.  In addition, this investment will enable her to start up a new line of business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years. She is married and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children who are both school going.

Joyce has been running a boutique as well as a farming business for the last 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

Joyce has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy clothes to sell. With the anticipated profits, Joyce will be able to repay her loan as well as pay school fees

Joyce's hopes and dreams for the future are to live a good life and to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Vicenta De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es panadero. 
Doña Mercedes junto a su familia tiene una panadería en su casa desde hace mas de 12 años con el cual se ganan el sustento diario, ellos elaboran delicioso pan en varias formas y sabores, de madrugada ellos se levantan a hornear el pan para que ya a las cinco de la mañana lleguen sus clientes, allí ellos además de pan también venden café, leche, huevos entre otros productos necesarios para el desayuno diario.
Este crédito es para comprar huevos, café, leche, harina, azúcar y otros ingredientes para elaborar el pan. Lleva más de más de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así pueden financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Crucita community bank is located in Crucita, a parish in Portoviejo canton. The area, called Crucita the Beautiful, is known for its beautiful beaches, much visited by local and foreign tourists alike.
Sra. Mercedes, 40, and her husband have two children, 17- and 12-years old, both in school.  Her husband is a baker and the family has operated a bakery business for 12 years.  They make delicious breads of all kinds and flavors and their earnings from the business cover the family's expenses.  They have to start baking in the early morning to have bread for their customers who come as early as 5:00am.  Along with bread, they sell milk, coffee, eggs and other breakfast foods.  
Doña Mercedes will use this loan to buy eggs, coffee, milk, flour, sugar and other supplies for making bread.  She joined the community bank 6 years ago and likes that she can borrow funds to support the family business.
For the future, Doña Mercedes wants to provide for her family in the very best way that she can.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her husband's bakery business.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
A mother of 3, Emmy, 41, lives in an upland village called Koyo which is swallowed by the Nandi Hills jungle. The only activity to speak of for Koyo's constituents is livestock farming. 

Emmy keeps cattle and poultry on her farm; milk and eggs are her primary income sources. Her agribusiness has been profitable for 10 years, and she is very content with farming not only as an economic activity but also as a lifestyle. 

Today Emmy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry in order to expand her business. With your loan, Emmy will make enough income to both repay the loan and better her living conditions. 

However, the brood of hens she plans to acquire will not just produce more eggs for her to sell. They will also help aerate her farm's soil and break the vegetation since the hens scratch the earth trying to find bugs. And the additional income will be timely, as her children’s education expenses keep increasing. This loan will also help Emmy's family enjoy food security.

Support the enterprising dreams of a Kenyan mum with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a thirty-seven-year-old hardworking single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Betty used her previous loan to pay the school fees for her children. She is still dealing in poultry as her main source of income, though she also has other side businesses such as farming. She started her business to sustain herself and improve her family's standard of living. 

Betty faces the challenge of price fluctuations of poultry products. Nevertheless, she has the vision of becoming a model farmer in her area.

Betty is requesting a loan to help her pay for labor to improve the sanitation of her poultry house.

loans.use: to pay for labor to improve the sanitation of her poultry house.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, se ha dedicado por muchos años a la venta mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta, su idea de negocio surgió por que ella laboró en empresas, pero se retiró para iniciar su sueño de prosperidad, tener su propio negocio.  Ella comercializa ropa, calzado, artículos del hogar a los  habitantes del sector del barrio donde habita  en el municipio de Soledad; sus clientes  encuentran a la mano  todo tipo de detalles, productos de cuidado de la piel  y el cabello entre otros, alterno a esta actividad también vende cervezas. Este negoció inicio en el año 2004, el cual funciona desde su  casa y dedica ocho horas diarias a atenderlo. Una de las estrategia de su negocio, es la facilidad de pago  que brinda a sus clientes, así mismo el negocio se ha mantenido por la confianza que han depositado sus proveedores, al ofrecerle la mercancía a crédito aunque y al realizar  compras de contado, obtiene descuentos y respondiendo a la clientela con un precio ajustado a su bolsillo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa que le han encargado, productos para surtir la vitrina mostrador y canastas de cervezas, ajustando su oferta a la demanda que muy pronto, en temporada navideña y de año nuevo, se incrementará y esto generará un mayor volumen de ventas, pues sus inventarios están a la medida de las solicitudes de compras.
texts.en:
Mariela has earned her living for many years in sales via specialized product guides or catalogs, with which she promotes the articles that she offers. Her business idea arose because she worked in businesses, but she resigned in order to begin her dream of prosperity and having her own business. 

She sells clothing, footwear, and household goods to the residents of her section of the neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Soledad. Her customers have access to all kinds of gifts, skin and hair care products, and more. She divides her time between this activity and selling beer. 

She started this business in 2004 and operates it from her house, dedicating eight hours a day to tending it. One of her business strategies is the ease of payment that she offers her customers. Similarly, she has maintained her business through the trust her suppliers place in her when they offer her merchandise on credit; however, when she makes purchases in cash, she receives discounts and passes them on to her clientele with prices adjusted to their wallets. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothing that people have ordered from her, products to stock her display case, and crates of beer in order to quickly adjust her supply to the demand. During the Christmas and New Year season, demand will increase; that will generate a greater volume of sales, because her inventory will be in line with purchase requests.

loans.use: to buy clothing that people have ordered from her, products to stock her display case, and crates of beer

loans.name: Ahmed Danladi

texts.en:
Ahmed Danladi is a maize farmer from Burus village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed Danladi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed  Danladi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ahmed  Danladi, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kikaka Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Grace, 36 years old and a member of Kikaka Group. The group members joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management.

Grace's economic activity is poultry farming. She is borrowing money to buy quality feeds that will help improve her poultry production. She hopes this will increase productivity, thus, more income. She plan to use the anticipated income to cater for family needs such as food and clothing.

Grace is happy with Kiva and all lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds that will help improve productivity.

loans.name: Jose Miner

texts.es:
Jose tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo en la provincia de Callayuc, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la actividad de destilación de aguardiente (bebida tradicional de la zona), cuenta con 07 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para ampliar su plantación de caña de azúcar para la destilación de aguardiente, con esto Jose espera aumentar la producción de su negocio, mejorando su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 24 years old. He is married, and he lives with his spouse and his young son in the Callayuc province, which is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this community is peaceful, and the population works primarily in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

Jose makes a living distilling aguardiente (a traditional drink of the area). He has 7 years of experience in this business as well as very good personal and professional references in the region. He will use this loan to expand his sugarcane plantation and to distill aguardiente. In this way, Jose hopes to increase the production of his business, improving his income level and, therefore, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to expand his sugarcane plantation and to distill aguardiente.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
La Joven Angélica Maria, posee un negocio de condimentos y especie en  uno de los  mercados de la Ciudad de León desde hace un año, ella realiza esta labor para  ayudar a su esposo gastos del hogar, inicia  a exhibir sus productos desde las 5.30 am finalizando a la 3:00 pm todos los días de lunes a domingo en  este mismo horario.
  
La joven Angélica solicito un crédito a Ceprodel fue utilizado para compra de especias, consume, sopa maggi, esto le permitirá incrementar su capital de trabajo al igual que sus ganancias
texts.en:
Youthful Angélica Maria has owned a condiments and spices business in one of the markets of the city of León for one year. She carries out this work to help her husband with the household expenses. She starts to display her products at 5:30 a.m., finishing up at 3:00 p.m. every day, Monday through Sunday, on this same schedule. 

Angélica requested a loan from Ceprodel that was used to buy spices, boullion, and Maggi soups. This will allow her to increase her working capital along with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy spices, boullion, and Maggi soups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay registration and monthly tuition expenses

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 63-year-old married woman and a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari store business and sells different items to the people in her locality. Her business has existed for 30 years now. In addition to this, Phoebe also cooks dishes for her customers. She usually cooks lomi (Filipino-Chinese dish made with a thick variety of fresh egg noodles with vegetables), sopas (soup made of elbow macaroni), and batchoy (a noodle soup made with pork organs, crushed pork cracklings, chicken stock, beef loin and round noodles). 

Phoebe is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack food, coffee and beverages, toiletries, canned goods, and ingredients like soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil and seasoning. In the future, Phoebe dreams of making her business a success and saving money for the future. Her profit also helps a 16-year-old dependent.

loans.use: to buy snack food; coffee and beverages; toiletries; canned goods; and ingredients like soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil and seasoning

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Tijani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hannatu and Farida. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tijani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tijani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Tijani spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN JOSE”;  el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
 La socia es la Sra. Cirila, la socia tiene 68 años de edad es viuda y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de flores, la socia vende diferentes tipos de flores como calas, margaritas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de rosas entre otros.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características
texts.en:
Our members belong to the SAN JOSE community bank in Cusco.
Sra. Cirila, 68, is one member of the group.  She is a widow and has 5 children.  She sells flowers for a living and says that she sells all kinds of flowers: lilies, daisies, etc.  She has operated the business for many years and says that it is a success because of the effort that she has put in, day-in and day-out, to make it a success.  She hopes to carry on the business because it is her means of helping her family move ahead.
Sra. Cirila is applying for a loan that she will use, among other things, to buy roses.  
People older than 65-years old are excluded from formal avenues of borrowing here so Kiva lenders offer a rare alternative for funding businesses owned by older people.  Sra. Cirila is grateful for your help and committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.
This loan is part of a line of credit granted to Credi Yapa by Asociación Arariwa.  The line of credit is offered to borrowers with good credit records, a criteria that this group meets.

loans.use: to buy roses for her flower business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a fisherman from Carles, Iloilo. He is married with seven children between the ages of 9 and 17. He catches fresh fish and then sells them to the people in his community. He has operated his fishing business for 11 years now. He also own a small sari-sari store business to supplement his income. He sells items like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and soy sauce. 

Edwin is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy assorted merchandise, such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, seasoning, coffee and milk. With this, he will be able to increase his income and help to buy enough food for the whole family. In the future, Edwin would like to expand his fishing and sari-sari store businesses to reach a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, seasoning, coffee and milk, for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 56-year-old widowed father of 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who raises food crops such as tomatoes and bananas. 

Stephen faces the challenges of limited capital and unpredictable changes in weather. In spite of this, like any loving father, he has hopes of educating all of his children to higher levels of learning. 

Stephen requires a loan so he can prune his sugarcane plantation and plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to prune his sugarcane plantation and plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Itomboya Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Itomboya Self Help Group. She is a sixty-two year old widow blessed with five children who have all completed school.

Mary is a small-scale farmer who grows kale; she also practices dairy farming. She has been able to manage and expand her farming business after Hand in Hand Eastern Africa offered her training. She acquired skills such as savings mobilization, enterprise development, and prudent financial management.

Mary is requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy manure and certified seed which will help improve productivity. She looks forward to a bounty harvest and thus more income. Mary plans to use the anticipated income to provide for her everyday needs such as food and clothing. 

Mary is happy to be with Kiva and hopes her loan will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy manure and certified seed which will improve crop productivity.

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina is 40 years old. She is married to Daniel, and together with her spouse has been blessed with five children.

Rosina runs a mini-shop as well as livestock farming, a business she has done for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Rosina has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 30,000, which she will use to buy stock of retail goods as we near the festive season.

With the anticipated profits, Rosina will be able to educate her children. Her hope and dream for the future is to educate her children to advanced levels.

loans.use: to buy stock of retail goods.

loans.name: Lourdes Bernardita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 59 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, tres  mayores de edad y una de 17 años la cual estudia en colegio, con ella viven dos hijas la menor y la mayor la cual es especial.
Doña Lourdes es una muy buena madre que hace lo posible para darle lo mejor a sus hijos, ella en sociedad con uno de sus hijos se dedica a la venta  de pescado por libras y enteros si sus clientes así lo prefieren, todos los días en la madrugada se van hasta las playas de la localidad le comprar  a los pescadores que llegan hasta el lugar y luego se van por la localidad vendiendo el pescado a personas del lugar o comerciantes y turistas que llegan a la localidad, de esta forma ellos se ganan el sustento diario  de una forma honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños es darles lo necesario a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Crucita" meet in the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton. This nice area is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited often by local and foreign tourists. It is called "Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful]. This is where Lourdes lives. 

Lourdes, 59 years old, is a widow. Her husband died some years ago. She had four children from the relationship, three who are now adults and a 17-year-old who attends school. Two of her daughters live with her, her youngest one who is a minor and her oldest one with special needs. Lourdes is a very good mother who does all she can to give her children the best.

She has a business with one of her sons selling fish. She sells per pound or the whole fish, if that is the customer's preference. 

She and her son go to the beaches at dawn every day to buy from the fishermen's daily catch. They then go around selling to people in the neighborhoods, or to merchants and tourists in town. They make an honest living this way.

This loan is to buy fish. Lourdes has been with the communal bank for five years and she likes it, because the loans allow her to get ahead.

Her dream is to cover her daughters' needs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a fisherman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is 23 years old; a single man who helps his parents earn a living through fishing. He usually earns 7,000 PHP every month.

Victor is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and pay for the repair of his boat. With this, he can expand and improve his fishing ventures to increase his catch and his income.

In the future, Victor hopes to make his business a success so he can prepare for family life.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and pay for the repair of his boat.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a fifty-two-year-old married father of seven children. 

Peter has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, which has greatly helped him realize his strength in business. He is a small-scale farmer of vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, and potatoes; he also practices dairy farming.

Peter is acquiring a loan to boost his farming business. With his loan, he will purchase manure and certified seed. He looks forward to improved crop yields from an anticipated bountiful harvest. He believes this will increase his profits and allow him to provide both a better education for his children as well as the basic needs for his family.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and certified seed that will improve crop yield.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 47 years old and from the town of Carles in Iloilo. She is married with three children, ages 12, 16, and 19. She has owned a fishing business for seventeen years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy plywood for her fishing boat. She needs to make some repairs due to the damage caused by the typhoon.

Any income will be for healthy meals, tuition fees for her children, and grocery items for family consumption. In the future, she hopes to have a more successful livelihood.

loans.use: to buy plywood for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Yhimi Honan

texts.es:
Yhimi tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretera Olmos – Corral Quemado, su población en la mayoría se dedica al comercio y agricultura especialmente de frutales, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene un taller de carpintería metálica, ubicado en su domicilio en el cual elabora diferentes productos de metales como son puertas, ventanas, escaleras, con una experiencia de más de 07 años en el negocio, por su buen servicio y su experiencia cuenta con bastantes clientes de su zona, además se desempeña como maestro de construcción. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de materiales y herramientas como madera, fierros, clavos, entre otros, para su negocio y de esta manera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, mejorando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yhimi is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the San Felipe district, a community located along the Olmos-Corral Quemado highway where the people work primarily in commerce and agriculture, especially of fruits. It is located in the Jaen province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Yhimi has a metal carpentry workshop in his home, where he makes various metal products such as doors, windows, and stairs. He has more than 7 years of experience in this business. As a result of his great service and experience, he has many customers in the area. He also works as a master builder.

He has requested a loan to buy supplies and tools such as wood, iron, and nails, among other things, for his business in order to offer his customers a better service. This way, he will improve his income level and, therefore, his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools such as wood, iron, and nails, among other things, for his business.

loans.name: Lynet

texts.en:
Lynet, aged 42, operates a fishing business to earn a living. She catches fish and sells to members of her local community. She has been engaged in this business for 19 years. She and her husband live with their 5 children in Carles, Iloilo in the Philippines. 

Lynet is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP in order to buy fishing nets, crude oil, paint, floaters, fishing weights, and rope. These materials will help improve her daily catch. This is a great opportunity for her to manage her fishing business well, which brings comfort to the whole family. 

In the future, Lynet would like to expand her fishing business so she can save for the future and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, crude oil, paint, floaters, fishing weights, and rope.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Martha who is married and blessed with one child. 

Martha joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain knowledge of enterprise development. She is a poultry farmer who also raises maize, beans, and vegetables. 

Martha is requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy quality poultry feed which will improve her farm's productivity. She hopes this will help her supply more eggs, thus increasing her income. She plans to use the anticipated income to cover her family's needs such as food and clothing.

Martha is happy with Kiva for its lenders' help and support.

loans.use: to buy quality poultry feed which will improve productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 27-year-old married Palestinian man who started repairing cars 7 years ago in order to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Sami is an ambitious man and a hard worker, who is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus, today, he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy car batteries which will allow him to provide his customers with better and more efficient service. 

Sami hopes to further develop his business in the future so he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy car batteries in order to provide his customers with better service.

loans.name: Simproko 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7  membres du groupe  Simproko 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Tandio, un des villages de Yorosso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  laitues et banane avec Sali, assise vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koury, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group Simproko 3’s seven members are married women. They are on average 33 years old with four children, and all live in traditional families in Tandio, a village in the Yorosso area (in Mali’s third administrative region). They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow fruits and vegetables for the first time.

Sali, sitting on the left in the photo, has chosen to grow lettuce and bananas. With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds, intrants (e.g. fertilizers), and tools, in order to farm her half-acre lot. After the harvest, production will be sold at the village level and in Koury, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She forecasts an average profit of 115,000 XOF by the end of the cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural intrants and tools.

loans.name: Kenny Maribel

texts.es: Kenny es una mujer de 19 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y sus 2 hermanos de 15 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, apoyando con las ganancias de la misma los gastos económicos de su hogar. Kenny desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y soleras para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, sabiendo que logrará pagar las cuotas necesarias de este crédito con las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Kenny is a 19-year-old woman who resides in her own home along with her parents and her two siblings, ages 15 and 5. She is an enterprising young woman who earns her living through her business of selling basic products from her home. Kenny has been in this business for two years. The income she earns allows her to contribute to the household expenses.

Kenny wants to replace the roof of her house which is in a deteriorated state. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in galvanized metal sheets, beams, construction pins, and supports in order to replace the roof of her house. She knows that she can complete the payments for this loan with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, construction pins, and supports so that she can replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Jesinta

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jesinta. She is fifty-seven years old, married, and living with three of her children. She does vegetable and dairy farming to earn a living. She also farms maize, beans, and potatoes on a small scale.

She is borrowing a loan to buy dairy feed. She hopes this will help improve on milk production. Thus, she will earn more income from improved sales. She plans to use the anticipated profit in ensuring food security in her household.

Jesinta is much grateful to Kiva for assisting her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed that will help improve on milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.es:
Lauriana tiene 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad tranquila de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a vender pan y dulces en el mercado de abastos, realizando esta actividad desde hace un año. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de dulces y gaseosas y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lauriana is 39 years old. She lives in her own house built of rustic materials in the district of Pucará, a quiet community with a hot climate. The people here work in agriculture,commerce and raising livestock., It is located in Jaén province, part of Cajamarca region in the North Andes Of Peru.

She works selling bread and sweets in the wholesale market. She has been doing this for a year. She has good personal and labor references in the area. She has requested a loan to buy a greater quantity of sweets and soft drinks. In this way she can expand her business and increase her income. She will make more profit and in this manner improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sweets and soft drinks and in this way expand her business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Junto a su familia tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como leche, azúcar, arroz, aceite, entre otros. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Lorenzo ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su tienda como menestras, fideos, granos, gaseosas, golosinas y de esta manera abastecer su negocio para ofrecer más variedad de productos para sus clientes. Con esto Lorenzo espera satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 32 years old.  He lives together with his wife and his children in the Cañaris district, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.  The people there work mainly in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Together with his family he has a little grocery store where he offers basic staples such as milk, sugar, rice, and oil, among others.  He has experience in this business and has very good personal and professional references from the area.  Lorenzo has asked for a loan to buy a greater quantity of products for his store, such as vegetable soups, noodles, grains, soda, and snacks.  In this way he can stock up his business in order to offer a greater variety of products to his customers.  Lorenzo hopes to satisfy the tastes and preferences of his customers, which will be reflected in his level of income and, in the end, in the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products for his store, such as soups, noodles, grains, soda, and snacks.

loans.name: Sabaly 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Sabaly 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Zamblala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage pour la première fois. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote, piment et laitues avec Rachel, arrêtée 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter  sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group Sabaly 1’s ten members are married women. They are on average 38 years old with two children, and all live in traditional families in Zamblala, a village in the Koutialia area (in Mali’s third administrative region). They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow fruits and vegetables for the first time.

Rachel, sitting second from the left in the photo, has chosen to grow shallots, hot peppers, and lettuce.
