With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds, intrants (e.g. fertilizers), and tools, in order to farm her half-acre lot. After the harvest, production will be sold at the village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She forecasts an average profit of 110,000 XOF by the end of the cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and agricultural tools.

loans.name: Djiguifa 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Djiguifa 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Nematou, assise au bout vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group Djiguifa 1’s ten members are married women. They are on average 40 years old with three children, and all live in traditional families in Pala, a village in the Koutialia area (in Mali’s third administrative region). They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow fruits and vegetables. This is their second loan.

Nematou, sitting all the way to the left in the photo, has chosen to grow shallots. With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds, intrants (e.g. fertilizers), and tools, in order to farm her half-acre lot. After the harvest, production will be sold at the village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She forecasts an average profit of 120,000 XOF by the end of the cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and tools.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 12 y  de 6 años, dos  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña María es una gran madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y  para su marido, el en la época invernal siembra maíz, maní y verduras, es para esto el requiere de capital para compra semillas, insecticidas y para pagar la mano de obra para el desbrote y arreglos de los terrenos, ella por su parte tiene un pequeño galpón en el cual cría pollos, los mismos que una vez que tengan un peso adecuado los entrega a comerciantes o los vende a vecinos del lugar. Así ellos salen adelante tratando de darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar semillas, insecticidas, alimento para los pollos y pago de mano de obra. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque  los créditos son de mucha ayuda, sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24) meets in the canton of May 24. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 13, 12, and 6). Two of her children are in high school and the other one is in elementary school. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña María is a wonderful mother and wife who will use this loan for herself and her husband. In the winter, they plant corn, peanuts, and vegetables. To accomplish this, they need capital for buying seeds, insecticides, and to pay for the labor that is required to weed and prepare the land. For her part, María has a small coop where she raises chickens. When the animals reach an adequate weight, she delivers them to merchants or sells them to neighbors in the area. Both she and her husband are moving forward so that they can provide the best for their children.

This loan will be used to buy seeds, insecticides, poultry feed, and to pay for labor. María has been with the Communal Bank for two years and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, poultry feed, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Djiguifa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Djiguifa 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Ana, assise 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Group Djiguifa 2’s ten members are married women. They are on average 35 years old with five children, and all live in traditional families in Pala, a village in the Koutialia area (in Mali’s third administrative region). They collaborate with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to grow fruits and vegetables. This is their second loan.

Ana, sitting second from the left in the photo, has chosen to grow shallots. With her loan, she plans to purchase seeds, intrants (e.g. fertilizers), and tools, in order to farm her half-acre lot. After the harvest, production will be sold at the village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She forecasts an average profit of 170,000 XOF by the end of the cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to pay for her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and tools

loans.name: Azucena Beatriz

texts.es:
Azucena tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente. Su familia es unida, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus hijas en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable dedicada principalmente a la pesca artesanal, comercio y agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, niñas y damas, cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientela fija en su zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes desde hace 06 meses. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ropa para aumentar el stock de su negocio, con esto Azucena espera satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Azucena is 36 years old.  She is in a live-in relationship.  Her family is close-knit.  She lives in her own home with her partner and daughters.  They live in the Lagunas district, located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Perú.  She lives in a community populated with kind people who mainly work in commerce, agriculture, and artisanal fishing.

She works selling clothing for boys, girls, and ladies.  She has more than four years’ experience in this business and has an established client base in her neighborhood.  Additionally, she has been raising guinea pigs for the past six months.  Her loan will be used for the purchase of a larger quantity of clothing in order to expand the stock of her business.  In this way, Azucena hopes to satisfy the tastes and preferences of her customers, which will in turn generate a better  level of income and, in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of clothing to expand the stock in her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old. She is married to Joseph and together they have been blessed with three children of 18, 10 and 7 years respectively. Joseph runs an open air hawking business; hence providing additional income for the family.

Jane is a retail trader as well as a farmer, businesses she has done for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Jane has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000 which she will use to add stock of farm supplies like seeds for planting and fertilizers.

With the anticipated profits, Jane will be able to support her family as well as boost her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper.

loans.use: to add stock of farm supplies

loans.name: Geline

texts.en: Geline is 42 years old. She is married with two dependents age 14 and 17. She has invested in a fishing business for many years now. She is requesting 30,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets. It will improve her catch and eventually help to defray the family's daily expenses. In the future, Geline would like to expand her fishing business enough to support the education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia, de 29 años de edad, está acompañada y es madre de 2 hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura. 
Lucia, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias, mientras sus hijos van a la escuela.

Lucia, trabaja en la agricultura junto a su compañero de vida, durante la mañana; ambos caminan 3 Kilómetros para llegar hasta sus parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, y producir más leche en un futuro y poder así incrementar sus ingresos.

Anteriormente Lucia, solicito un crédito para comprar una novilla y le fue bien con la produccion de leche, es por eso que ahora está solicitando otro préstamo para comprar otra novilla.

Lucia, planea en un futuro comprar un terreno para poder pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Lucia is 29, lives with her common-law husband and has two children. She studied up to high school. 

Her husband makes his living in agriculture. Lucia gets up at 4:30 a.m. along with him to carry out their daily tasks, while the children go to school.
During the morning, she works in agriculture along with her husband. They both walk three kilometers to get to their fields and then in the afternoon, they milk the cows to sell the milk.

Lucia needs the loan to buy another heifer and to produce more milk in the future and be able to increase her income.  Some time ago, Lucia asked for a loan to buy a heifer and had good results from the production of milk and for that reason she is asking for another loan to buy another heifer. She plans in the future to buy a piece of land to pasture her animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, forty-seven years old, married and blessed with two children. He works hard to support them. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 and gained knowledge on group and savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He is borrowing a loan to boost his enterprise by buying more stock of beef to help meet his customers' rising demand. He hopes his business will thrive and he will earn more income that he projects to use in supporting his children's education.

Peter is grateful to Kiva for the great support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beef; thus a steady supply and more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals for her business, as well as the feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Agnes, thirty-four years old, married and living with her husband. She is the mother of two children and works hard to support them. She is a member of Upendo Kerwa Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain skills in entrepreneurial development and financial management.

Agnes operates a mini boutique, a business she has operated for over two years. She is borrowing a loan to purchase more stock of belts, school bags, socks and pullovers. She has gained consistent customers in her enterprise and hopes the additional stock will ensure maintenance of a steady supply and thus more income. Agnes hopes the business income will help support her children's education by buying school uniforms, writing materials and paying school fees and also afford a decent living.

Agnes is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the great support.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of  belts, school bags, socks and pullovers that will ensure a steady supply to customers.

loans.name: Jubwego Foundation Women Group

texts.en:
Beth, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Jubwego Foundation Women Group. She is a thirty-seven-year-old mother of four children who are all attending school. Beth is a mixed farmer of dairy and vegetable farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more about business management, record keeping, and financial management.

She is borrowing a loan to help boost her farming activities by buying quality seeds to enhance her vegetable farming. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest that will lead to improved income and put her in a position to cater for family needs such as school fees, food and clothing.

Beth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy quality planting seeds that will help improve on crop yield.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers; and by that, I mean people who make a living off of the land; and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Agnes, a 34-year-old mixed farmer based in Kiangombe, a remote village in the lush Kerugoya area of Kenya. Agnes has a husband, and at home they have one child.

For the last five years, Agnes has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and crops. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Agnes to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. Agnes is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production and thus increase sales volume. Agnes needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married with one child. She stopped working after she got married. She was bored sitting at home and began selling Tupperware on a friend’s advice. At first she sold to friends and relatives. With time her customers increased. With her loan she’ll buy promotional items and increase her sales. She likes this work as it has expanded her circle. She likes the gifts and trips. She wants to advance at work and educate her son.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Özlem Hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Evlendikden sonra işinden ayrılıyor. Evde boş durmakdan sıkıldığı için bir arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile tupperware satmaya başlamış. Önceleri çevresine akrabalarına satarak başlamış. Zamanla müşterileri artıyor. Aldığı kredi ile promosyonlu ürünler çekecek satışını ve kazancını arttıracak. Bu işi seviyor çevresi genişlemiş. Hediyeler ve gezileri seviyor. İşini seviyor. İşinde yükselmek ve oğlunu okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy promotional items and increase her sales

loans.name: Husaini

texts.en: Husaini is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Husaini joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his son Mussa. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Husaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Husaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Husaini spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his son, eventually hoping to ensure his son is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wendani Self Help Group

texts.en:
In 2012, Wendani Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to be trained in group dynamics, enterprise development and financial management.

The lady raising her hand in the photo is Loise, thirty-five years old, married and blessed with four children.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and pesticides to boost her vegetable farming. She hopes that her farming will expand, thus creating more income. The anticipated income will help meet her family's basic needs such as food and clothing.

Loise is grateful to Kiva and all the lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide that will help boost farming; thus creating more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel. He is 52 years old and a father of seven children, four of whom are in school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2012 to benefit from training on enterprise development.

He does mixed farming of dairy, poultry, and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and manure. This will help improve his crop yield and earn him more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs such as food and to pay school fees for his children.

Daniel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure that will help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Esther, forty years old and blessed with two children. She lives with her husband. She is a business lady operating a shop selling household items such as kale, spinach and cereals. She is applying for a loan to add more stock to her business. This will ensure she keeps up with customers' rising demand. She hopes her business will thrive, hence creating more income. Esther will plough back some of her profits to help expand her business.

She is very happy with Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals that will help meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sarah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ayuba, Tabitha and Maitala.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Sarah would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sarah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sarah spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en la parte rural del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería. Es una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y raspadillas, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Teofila se dedica a esta labor para apoyar con los gastos familiares. Cuenta con 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en el distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar arreglos en su vivienda, la cual se encuentra actualmente en mal estado, con esto Teofila espera tener mejores condiciones para vivir lo que aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teofila is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in a rural part of the district of Oyotún. It's inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. The community is known for it's hospitality. It is located in Chiclayo province on the North Coast of Peru.

She works selling soft drinks and shaved ice. Her business is located at her house. Teofila does this work to help with the household expenses. She has 5 year experience with this business and has very good personal and labor references in the district. The loan will be used to make improvements in her house which currently is in bad condition. By doing this Teofila hopes to have better living conditions to improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to make improvements on her house which is currently in poor condition.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yakubu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus siete hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas), cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para su negocio, así como para la compra de alimento para el engorde de sus animales. Con esto Salvador espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador is 35 years old. He lives in his own house with his spouse and 7 children in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The main business activities in this district are agriculture, raising cattle and commerce.

Salvador works raising cattle and has more than 10 years experience in the sector. He has very good personal and labor references in the area. The loan will be used to but a greater quantity of cattle for his business as well as buying feed to fatten the animals. By doing this Salvador hopes to improve the productivity of his business. This would be reflected in a higher level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of cattle for his business and to buy feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Joshua would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Joshua is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas Informáticos, trabaja en un canal de televisión, comenta que tiene previsto como meta poder abrir su local informático y así darle uso a su futura profesión, a través de todos los conocimientos que fue adquiriendo.
Es una persona que se esta esforzando por crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas de la carrera, y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a student in the Computer Systems Engineering Program. He works at a television channel.  He says that he plans as a goal to be able to open his local computer service and thus make use of his future profession through all of the knowledge that he is acquiring. 

He is a person who is striving to grow.

He is asking for this loan in order to cover the costs of his schooling and thus continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay University fees

loans.name: Khursanguli

texts.ru: Хурсангули 24-летняя молодая замужняя женщина, проживающая со своей семьей в районе Фархор. Ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь путем перевозки пассажиров на своем автомобиле. А Хурсангули занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. В течение 3 лет она занимается растениводством и выращивает на своей участке земли пшеницу и овощи. Муж тоже помогает ей в посеве и сборе урожая. Так как сейчас начался сезон зимнего посева, Хурсангули просит кредит, чтобы приобрести необходимые семена и топлива для проведения посева. Благодаря кредиту она сможет продолжить свою деятельность и надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Khursanguli is a 24-year-old married young woman. She lives with her family in the Farkhor District. Her husbands earns a living by transporting passengers in his car. Khursanguli practices farming. For the past three years, she has been practicing crop farming. On her own plot of land she grows wheat and vegetables. Her husband also helps her in the sowing and harvesting of crops. As the winter sowing season has just begun, Khursanguli is requesting a loan to buy the necessary seeds and fuel for the planting process. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to continue her business. She relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Lissy

texts.es:
Lissy  es estudiante de la carrera de odontología, comenta que sus padres son docentes y que siempre la apoyan.
La meta de Lissy es abrir un consultorio y trabajar ejerciendo su profesión, y así poder seguir abriéndose camino.
Es una persona que se esfuerza por sus metas, para poder conseguirlas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Lissy is a student studying dentistry. She says that her parents are teachers and they always support her. 
Lissy's aim is to open her own clinic and practise her profession and in this way, continue to get ahead in life. She is a person who exerts herself for her goals to be able to achieve them. 
She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Zakka

texts.en: Zakka is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Zakka joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his son: Yason.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakka would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakka can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Zakka spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to ensure he is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Мастуре из города Душанбе 47 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Сыновьям 24 и 21 год. Они с отцом работают в Российской Федерации. Мастура живет вместе с дочками. Им по 18, 13 и 10 лет. Старшая дочь помогает маме в работе. Мастура занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Она с юных лет увлеклась шитьем, и сейчас ее увлечение превратилось в профессию. 
   Задача, которая подтолкнула Мастуру к обращению за кредитом, является ремонт дома и подготовка жилища к суровой зиме. Их дом срочно нуждается обновлению. Мастура боится за своих дочерей и что дом может не перенести зимний период. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Она купит стройматериалы, и сразу приступит к ремонту жилища.
texts.en:
Mastura is from the city of Dushanbe. She is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. Her sons are 24 and 21 years old. They and their father work in the Russian Federation. Mastura lives with her daughters. They are 18, 13 and 10 years old. Her eldest daughter helps her with her work. Mastura sews custom women's clothing. From a young age, she had a passion for sewing and now her passion has turned into her profession.

The task which motivated Mastura to take out a loan is the renovation of her home and preparing it for the harsh winter. Their house urgently needs renovation. Mastura is afraid for her daughters and that the house might not survive the winter. For this reason, she applied for a loan. She will buy construction materials and immediately set about repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as compost and fertilizers, so that she can maintain her carrot crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 10m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ishaya is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto, labora como decente en un colegio  de la ciudad de León desde hace catorce años, donde inicia sus labores a las 06:40 am y finaliza a las 02:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.   

El señor Luis solicitó a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizó para la Compra de bloques, cemento. hierro, arena, piedrin, dichos materiales fueron implementados en la rehabilitación y remodelación de su humilde vivienda lo cual le permitirá mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto has worked as a teacher in a school in the city of Leon for fourteen years. He starts work at 6:40 am and finishes at 2:00 pm, Monday to Saturday. He does this work to provide for his household.
Luis requested a loan from Ceprodel which he used to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand, and stone. These materials were used to fix and remodel his humble home, which will allow him to improve his level and quality of living.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron, sand, and stone.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ubadiya, Timoty and Gidiyon.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as buying food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Dauda spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saminu

texts.en: Saminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Saminu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Saminu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Ezekiel, Zainab and Bilhatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gabriel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gabriel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Gabriel  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children,  hoping to eventually ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's  school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Erika Alida

texts.es:
Erika Alida tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, entre otros, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 25 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio, como ropa, perfumes, entre otros. Con esto Erika espera aumentar el stock de su tienda, ofreciendo variados productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo así sus gustos y necesidades, lo que le generará un nivel mayor de ingresos y tendrá una gran influencia en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erika Alida is a 50-year-old single mother. She lives with her son in a house that she owns and is made from basic materials. Her home is located in a rural section in the District of Pomahuaca in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The main business activities that are carried out in this district are agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Erika Alida sells clothing and beauty products such as perfumes, body crèmes, and other items. Her business is located in her home. Erika has more than 25 years of experience in this trade and she has good personal and work-related references who are from this area. This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of products for her business such as clothes, perfumes, and other items. With the money, Erika hopes to increase the inventory of her store. By offering various products to her customers, she will be able to satisfy their tastes and needs. This will lead to a higher level of income, which will have a great influence on her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products for her business such as clothes, perfumes, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition and graduation costs.

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Jummai, Dinatu and Gad.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bulus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to pay for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Bulus  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure they eventually have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marlen Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Marlen Evangelina, labora como arquitecta en una de las constructoras de la ciudad de León desde hace quince años, donde inicia sus labores a las 08:00 am y finaliza a las 05:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, es madre soltera de dos hijos de los cuales ambos estan bajo su tutela, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.   

Doña Marlen solicitó un crédito a Ceprodel el utilizó para solventar gastos escolares como son la promoción de uno de sus hijos y la matricula del nuevo año lectivo, lo cual en un futuro sera un profesional de bien para la sociedad y de esa forma se cumplirá el sueño de la señora Marlen al ver formados a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Marlen Evangelina has worked as an architect for one of the city of Leon's construction companies for 15 years. She starts work at 8 am and finishes at 5 pm, Monday to Saturday. She is a single mother of two, both of whom are under her care. She works in order to provide for her household.
Marlen requested a loan from Ceprodel and used it to pay school costs, including graduation costs for one of her children as well as the tuition for the new year. In the future, her child will be a professional and do good for society. This will accomplish Marlen's dream of seeing her little ones educated.

loans.use: to pay for graduation and tuition costs for the new year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school expenses (to register in college).

loans.name: Ahmed Adamu

texts.en:
Ahmed Adamu is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Muddibo, Amina and Ibrahim.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to pay for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ahmed Adamu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure his children eventually have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 60 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una zona rural donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa, la población del distrito se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de carpintería metálica en un local propio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de materiales para su taller, como soldaduras, planchas de fierro, herrería, entre otros. Con esto Jorge podrá brindar un mejor servicio ya que por falta de materiales algunas veces no puede atender a todos sus clientes, esto tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos, mejorando así su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 60 years old, single and lives in his own home in the district of Cayaltí,  located in Chiclayo province in Lambayeque region on Perú's north coast. He lives in a rural area where life is very quiet and harmonious. The people who live there mainly engage in agriculture, livestock-raising and run small businesses. 

He offers carpentry and metalworking services in his own shop. He has experience in the business, as well as  good work and personal references in the area. This loan will be used for the purchase of materials for his workshop such as solders, steel sheets, metalworking supplies, and other items. With this he will provide better service, since for lack of material sometimes he can't serve all his customers. This will have a great impact on his level of income, thereby improving his quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop such as solders, steel sheets, metalworking supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdullahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Abdullahi is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: school expenses (to pay to register for the next academic year).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with school costs: tuition for the new year/

loans.name: Julio Cesár

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar, es padre soltero de cuatro hijos de los cuales estan bajo su cargo, labora como obrero en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace ocho  años, inicia sus labores a las 07:00 am y finaliza a las 03:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, realiza esta laborar para el sustento de su hogar.

don Julio solicitó un crédito a Ceprodel el cual utilizó para la Compra de arena, cemento, bloques, hierro, piedrin, dichos materiales fueron utilizados para remodelación y mejora de su humilde vivienda, así tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is a single father with four children under his care. He has worked for eight years as a labourer in one of the markets of the city of Leon. He starts work at 7 am and finishes at 3 pm, Monday to Saturday. He does this work to support his household. Julio requested a loan from Ceprodel to purchase sand, cement, blocks, iron, and stone, which he used to remodel his humble home in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron, blocks, and stone.

loans.name: Abdulkadir

texts.en:
Abdulkadir is a maize farmer who joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Azima, Nafisa and Mansir.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulkadir would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to pay for necessities such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulkadir can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abdulkadir  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure they  eventually obtain professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Isah expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hassan Galadima

texts.en: Hassan Galadima is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hassan Galadima would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan Galadima can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Hassan Galadima is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохату 29 лет. Она замужняя женщина. У Малохат двое детей, сыну 3 года, дочке 10 лет. Ее муж является разнорабочий. Малохат дома с мамой занимаются шитьем женской одежды. Также они принимают заказы на шитье национальной одежды. Малохат умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она всегда работает во благо семьи. Сейчас Малохату необходимо купить новую машинку, потому что ее нынешняя машинка не пригодна для дальнейшего использования. Она лишилась источника дохода и старается по скорей собрать деньги и купить новую, но понимает, что за короткий срок она не сумеет совершить покупку. У нее вся надежда остается на кредит и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Malohat is a 29-year-old married woman. Malohat has two children: a 3-year-old son and a 10-year-old daughter. Her husband is a handy-man. Malohat and her mother sew women's clothing in their home. They also take orders for sewing ethnic Tajik-style clothing. Malohat is an intelligent and hardworking woman. She always works for the benefit of her family. Now Malohat needs to buy a new sewing machine as her current sewing machine is no longer working. She lost her source of income and is trying her best to quickly collect money and buy a new one. However, she knows that she will be unable to complete the purchase in the near future. All of her hopes rest upon this loan and your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and preserve her source of income.

loans.name: Elias Lucas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio tiene 59 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito  otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the NUEVA GENERACION III communal bank. The bank is located in the province of Cuzco. He is 59 years old, has 2 children and is single. He alternates between providing his taxi service and other daily activities. He has had his business for a long time and it is going well for him because of the effort he puts into his work every day. He wants to be able to continue working so he can keep supporting his family.  

He is asking for the loan to do maintenance on his car. He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo esta felizmente casado y tiene 3 hijos, el cliente vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico en una modesta casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene luz y agua y por el momento no presenta ningún defecto El oficio de Luis es ser productor lechero y para ganar dinero extra, trabaja de maestro albañil en Achacachi Bernardo quiere un credito para la compra de alimento para su ganado, ultimamente ha pasado por un periodo de sequia y necesita alimentar a sus vacas con urgencia Bernardo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud
texts.en: Bernardo is happily married with three children. He lives in the community of Chijipina Chico in a modest house made of adobe that he owns. The house has electricity and water and right now has no defects. Luis' trade is dairy farming. To make extra money, he works as a master bricklayer in Achacachi.  Bernardo wants a loan to buy feed for his cattle. Lately, he has gone through a drought and he needs to feed his cows urgently. Bernardo is the only source of income for his home but he is in good health.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Cotapampa en una casa de adobe que es propia y solo tiene luz y agua  Reina se dedica a la agricultura y quiere un credito para compra de alimento para su ganado, el esposo de Reina trabaja como albañil en la poblacion de Warisata pero eso no es suficiente para mantener el hogar, al menos Reina goza de buena salud
texts.en: Reina is in a common law marriage and she has 4 children. She lives in the community of  Cotapampa in an adobe house that she owns. It only has electricity and water. Reina works in agriculture and she wants a loan to buy feed for her cattle. Reina's husband works as a bricklayer in the town of Warisata, but that isn't enough to support the house. Reina is in good health.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase perfume, lotions, deodorants, creams, etc...

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization.  Anthony joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ashiru, Bilya and Inusa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Anthony would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.  

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Anthony can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  When asked, Anthony spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are fully educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, cuenta con unidad propia así como con clientela fija de la zona, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como también para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su unidad móvil. Con esto Celia espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en un aumento en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son in a home made out of rustic materials that they own in the rural area of the district of Pucará, which is in the Jaén province in the Catamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  The population of the district works primarily in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Celia works providing transportation services for people on her rickshaw.  She owns one rickshaw and she has a loyal customer base in the region.  She also works raising and selling small animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, etc.  The loan will be used to purchase a large amount go animals for her business as well as to perform repairs and maintenance on her vehicle.  With this, Celia hopes to provide better service to her customers, which will be reflected by an increase in her income and an improved quality go life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of animals for her business, as well as to pay for repairs and maintenance on her rickshaw.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es:
Él es Guillermo, alegre, extrovertido con un don para la venta, atrayendo al cliente haciéndolo sonreír convenciéndolo de que su producto vale la pena comprarlo.
Guillermo es un comerciante de Medellín dedicado a la venta de ropa, padre de tres hijos que sueña con poder ser suficiente para darles estudios a todos ellos.
Trabaja diariamente el tiempo que sea suficiente ya que busca mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad, ser más competitivo y diversificar sus productos por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar chaquetas, blue-jeans, camisas, blusas, y ropa para niño.
texts.en:
This is Guillermo, happy, outgoing and very good at sales, attracting clients, bringing out a smile, convincing them that the product is worth buying. Guillermo is a merchant in Medellín and he sells clothes.

He is the father of three children and he dreams of being able to offer them all a school education.

He works every day as many hours as needed, looking to improve sales, increase profits, gain competitive advantage, and diversify his product line. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy jackets, blue jeans, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy jackets, blue jeans, shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de mochilas y bolsones, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de sus productos, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 20 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells backpacks and book bags. She has many customers because of the quality of her products. She lives in her own home with her family. She is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale and thus be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and book bags at wholesale.

loans.name: Delmy Cecilia

texts.es: Delmy de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa desde hace varios años, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y repellando las paredes pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de laminas, polines, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Delmy is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her two children and her husband. She has been making clothing for many years. She wants to improve her home, changing the roof and plastering the walls but with what she earns she doesn't have enough to be able to make the improvements. Therefore she seeks a loan to buy laminate, wooden beams, cement, sand and pay for labor so that she and her family can live more safely.

loans.use: to buy laminate, wooden beams, cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization.  Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children:  Saminu, Silamis and Nasara.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing.  

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  When asked, Ibrahim spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are fully educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Cresenciano

texts.es:
Cresenciano tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz. Cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo así como para el pago de peones agrícolas para la época de cosecha. Con esto Cresenciano espera mejorar la calidad de su cultivo, ofreciendo un mejor producto a sus clientes y satisfaciendo sus necesidades, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cresenciano is 50 years old, married and lives with her wife and their two children in the Pucará district, which is located in the Jaén province in the Catamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  Agriculture, livestock and commerce are the main economic activities of the region.

Cresenciano works as a farmer, primarily growing corn.  He has 15 years of experience in this field, and he has many good personal and professional references.  The loan he is seeking will be used to purchase fertilizers and manure to care for his crops, as well as to pay for labor during the harvest season.  With this, Cresenciano hopes to improve the quality of his crops so that he can offer his customers a better product and satisfy their needs.  This will have a positive impact on his income as well as his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and manure to care for his crops, as well as to pay for labor during the harvest season.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state, Nigeria.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Nuhu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru:
Мавлюда швея из города Душанбе. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж как многие граждане Республики Таджикистан находиться на заработках за приделами страны. У нее двое детей. Мавлюда дома занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она шьет на заказ таджикские национальные платья. Мавлюда недавно начала эту деятельность, но за короткое время освоила все тонкости данной работы. 
   Мавлюда обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести мебель для домашнего использования. Она много лет чувствовала дискомфорт из-за отсутствия кондиционера и стиральной машинки. Она всегда стирала вручную. Зимой и летом температура в квартире была не комфортной. Мавлюда поставила себе цель купить эти 2 принадлежности и жить в удобстве, ведь всю жизнь она жила ради семьи и детей и не думала о себе. Столько времени она копила деньги, но ей не хватает еще не большой суммы. Она решилась обратиться за кредитом. Вы можете сейчас поддержать Мавлюду.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is a seamstress from the city of Dushanbe. She is 47 years old and married. Like many citizens of the Republic of Tajikistan, her husband works abroad in a neighboring country. She has two children. Mavlyuda offers seamstress services out of her home. She sews custom-made Tajik-style dresses. Mavlyuda started this business not too long ago, but in that short period of time, she has mastered all the intricacies of the business.

Mavlyuda requested a loan in order to buy appliances for home use. For many years, she has always been bothered by the lack of an air conditioner and washing machine. She always washes things by hand. In winter and summer, the temperature in her apartment was uncomfortable. Mavlyuda has made it her goal to buy these two pieces of equipment and live comfortably. She has truly lived her whole life for the benefit of her family and never thought about herself. She has been saving money for a long time, but she still not does have enough money by a long shot. She decided to apply for a loan. You can now help support Mavlyuda.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a washing machine.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Noemí, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive con ella y una nieta que esta pequeñita. Su esposo comerciante.
Doña Noemí es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para el bien de sus familia, ella se dedica junto a su esposo a l  venta de mariscos, ella y su marido  en las mañanas se van a las playas a comprar el mejor pescado para luego transportarlo en su carro hasta otras ciudades y campos a vender sus productos, ellos entregan al por mayor y también al menudeo, trabajan cuatro días a la semana durante cinco a seis horas al día. Son más de 15 años que llevan con este negocio con el cual se ganan la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otras variedades de mariscos para llevar a sus clientes lo mejor. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In the Crucita Parish of Portoviejo canton, the members of the Crucita communal bank meets every fortnight., This place is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it and receives many foreign and national visitors. It is known as "Crucita la Bella" (Crucita the Beautiful).

Noemi lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married and from this relationship has 5 adult children. One of her daughters lives with her and a young granddaughter. Her husband is a businessman.

Noemi is a hard-working woman who likes to earn her own money for the good of the family. She works with her husband selling seafood. Her and her husband go in the mornings to the beach to buy the best fish and later transport it in their vehicle to other cities and the country to sell their products. They distribute wholesale and retail. They work 4 days per week, for 5 to 6 hours per day. They have been earning their living for more than 15 years doing this business.

She will use this loan to buy fish, shrimp and other kinds of seafood to provide their clients with the best. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it as the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dream is to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp and other seafood.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Jose Daniel tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica principalmente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Jose Daniel espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes satisfaciendo así sus gustos y preferencias, lo que se verá reflejado en un aumento en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Daniel is 57 years old and is married. He lives with his family in a rural part of the district of Oyotún, located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The people of this district work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

He works selling groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, legumes etc. His business is located in his house. He has more than 10 years experience in the business and has good personal and labor references in the area. The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, amongst others to increase the stock in his business. Doing this Jose Daniel hopes to offer a greater variety of products to his clients to satisfy their tastes and preferences. It will be reflected in a increase in his level of income and in the end improve his quality of living as wells that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products like rice, sugar, pasta and milk amongst others to increase the stock of his store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en una casa donde paga mensualmente (en alquiler)la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundaria; tiene su Salon de Belleza donde atiende diariamente, ofreciendo los servicios de corte, permanente y peinados. El Salón está ubicado en la misma zona  en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ya que el sueño de Maria  es tener su salon con todas las comodidades para poder ofrecer a sus clientes   y tener mejores ingresos  mejor calidad de vida, Maria ha decidido pedir un prestamo para hacer una ampliacion en su salon. Maria goza de buena salud y no tiene a quien acudir
texts.en:
Maria is single and has two children. She lives in a house where she pays monthly rent. It is located in the Tahuantinsuyo area of the city of El Alto. She only studied up to the secondary school level.

She has a beauty salon where she works daily offering hair cuts, permanents and hairstyling. The salon is located in the same zone of the city of El Alto. Maria's dream is to have a salon with all the comforts to be able to offer her clients and make more income to improve her quality of living. Maria has decided to request a loan to expand her salon. Maria is in good health and has no one to turn to.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ulpat

texts.ru: Улпат успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Улпат составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 3 коровы, 7 овец, 1 лошадь и 1,10 ГА собственной земли, где Улпат выращивает клевер, кукурузу и арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Улпат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на свадьбу сына, а также сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ulpat successfully repaid her last loan, which she used for its intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and to all those who helped finance her loan. Currently, Ulpat's average monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she has a good farm: 3 cows, 7 sheep and 1 horse. She also has a 1.10 hectare plot of land on which she grows clover, corn and watermelons for personal consumption and sale. To further develop her business, Ulpat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 40,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business. She also intends to save money for her son's wedding and to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: Fausto es casado y tiene 5 hijos, el cliente y su familia viven en Tacamara en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Fausto se dedica a la agricultura y quiere un credito para compra de vaca lechera para aumentar su produccion Fausto es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero al menos goza de buena salud y esta motivado en su actividad
texts.en:
Fausto is married and has 5 children. He and his family live in Tacamara in an adobe house, which is his property. 

Fausto makes a living off of agriculture, and he wants a loan to buy a dairy cow to increase his production. Fausto is the only source of income in his household, but at least he has good health and is motivated in his job.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es soltera, vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos Ella y su familia residen en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Laura se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada Como ya se acerca la navidad Laura quiere un prestamo para abastecerse de ropa de varon y de mujer Laura recibe ayuda del padre, pero solamente le dan casa y comida, ademas, Laura busca independizarse, la clienta goza de buena salud y espera que puedan ayudarla
texts.en:
Laura is single, lives with her parents, and does not have children. She and her family live in El Alto in a brick and cement house which belongs to her family. 

Laura makes a living buying and selling used clothing. Since Christmas is getting closer, Laura wants a loan to stock up on men and women's clothing. Laura receives help from her father, but he only provides housing and food. In addition, Laura wants to become independent. She has good health and hopes that [you] can help her.

loans.use: To buy men and women's clothing

loans.name: Berioska

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el suñeo de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working at the business of selling shoes. By way of this business, the member wants to get ahead. The member's dream is to have a storefront where she can sell the shoes. The member is applying for the loan to buy shoes.

The member is happy because of the loan and she is committed to fulfilling the payment installments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jona, Timothy and Jamima.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Isiyaku spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay children's school fees and buy their uniforms, thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos raises cows and hogs, and lives from selling their meat in his small butcher shop around the corner. He enjoys his business, but the LP gas and other operating costs he is facing put important financial constraints on his activity.

He decided to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to take advantage of his cows' and hogs' manure and produce his own biogas and biofertilizer for his farm. 

This investment will enable him to transform waste into a productive resource, allowing Carlos to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizer, therefore saving a considerable amount of his revenue. 

In this process, his farm will become more environmentally friendly, as the waste will not contaminate anything and energy based on fossil fuel will be eliminated. Carlos is pictured here on the day his biodigester was installed.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 20m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Amalfi Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amalfi una mujer de 56 años de edad, propietaria de un cultivo de plátanos, un producto que de momento escasea por los diferentes inconvenientes climáticos y de orden social que han tenido los agricultores y por ello, los mismos plataneros son los llamados a  sacar adelante este inconveniente, entre ellas Amalfi que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos de sostenimiento de cultivos como lo son abonos, riegos y algunos exterminadores no nocivos para los cultivos.
Apoya a esta mujer que quiere apoyar el renacimiento de los plataneros además que es un producto que se exporta y de mucho consumo.
texts.en:
Amalfi is a 56-year-old woman, proprietor of a crop of bananas, a product that at the moment is scarce due to different climatic problems and the social conditions that the farmers have had.  Thus, the same banana farmers are those called upon to move forward of this problem.  

Among them is Amalfi, who is asking for a loan for the purchase of supplies for the support of the crop such as manure, irrigation, and some fumigants that are not harmful to the plants.  

Help this woman who wishes to support the revival of the banana growers.  Besides, it is a crop that is exported and consumed by many.

loans.use: to revive the cultivation of bananas by investing in manure, irrigation and crop-friendly fumigants

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Iliya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing now, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana , es separada tiene tres hijos, vive en casa de sus padres , la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la elaboracion y comercializacion del comida (sajta, biste , pollo dorado y otros.

Como se acerca la navidad y se preparan varios platillos especiales tanto en hogares como en restaurantes de toda clase Juana quiere un credito para comprar cantidades extra de arroz, aceite, azucar, fideo, para poder estar lista para la temporada y aprovechar lo mas que se pueda Juana mantiene su buena salud y espera recibir su ayuda
texts.en:
Juana is separated and has three children. She lives in the house of her parents, which is found located in the city of La Paz. She only studied until secondary school. She works making and selling food (sajta, beef, browned chicken and more).

Since Christmas is approaching and various special dishes are prepared both at home and in restaurants of all types, Juana wants a loan to buy extra quantities of rice, oil, sugar and pasta to be able to be ready for the season and take the greatest advantage of what she can. Juana maintains her good health and hopes to receive your help.

loans.use: to buy extra quantities of rice, oil sugar, pasta.

loans.name: Katwende Group

texts.en:
The Katwende group is found in a Trading Centre 3 kilometres away from Ibanda town. It is comprised mainly of men and women who are involved in small scale trade and simple agriculture.

Jelemina is a 42-year-old widow mother with 3 children. Two of her children are in school. With limited capital, Jelemina deals in selling groceries [roasted plantain, passion fruits and mangoes] whereby she earns income to cover her basic needs. 

Her business is displayed along the main road where she has the challenges of sunshine, dust and competition with others. She has applied for a loan of 700,000= to help her add more stock of the same items in her business such that she can maximize profits.

Jelemina is an honest and hardworking lady, and I hope if given support she will be in a position to keep her business growing andto  run the family as well. She and other group members are all hardworking and thank kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the good job.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Philibus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family now, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusufu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yahaya and Dauda.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusufu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.
