With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusufu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yusufu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Deyber

texts.es: Deyber trabaja en la Camara Nacional de Comercio. Vive en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propiead de sus padres en la  ciudad de El Alto. Deyber quiere un prestamo para pagar un curso de actualización. Deyber es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda para salir adelante, estudiar y trabajar es complicado pero Deyber sabe que vale la pena el riesgo
texts.en:
Deyber works for the national chamber of commerce.  He lives in his parents’ brick and cement house in the city of El Alto.

Deyber wants a loan to pay for a refresher course.  Deyber is the only source of income in his household, and he needs your help to get ahead.  Studying and working are complicated, but Deyber knows that the venture is worthwhile.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de pollos, la socia los pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los pollos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Yolanda continues at the business of raising chickens. The member fattens the chickens and lets them grow and sells them later in the different markets. The member already has various years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to have a storefront where she can sell the chickens. The member is applying for the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed.

The member is happy because of the loan and she commits to fulfilling her payment installments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Philibus

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Philibus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Steven, Lydia and Elkana.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Philibus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Philibus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees and buy their uniforms; thus eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yusuf expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ibrahim, Isiyaku and Godiya. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees and buy their uniforms now, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kosau

texts.en:
Kosau is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Kosau joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Saminu, Isa and Yahuza.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kosau would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kosau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Kosau spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's uniforms and pay their school fees, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Las Almendras. Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal las Almendras está conformada por nueve integrantes, madres solteras responsables de quince hijos, son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.se  caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Concepción y tiene por actividad económica una pulperia, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevo, aceite, detergente, jabón, etc . Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos,  y lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir en productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Las Almendra agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
“The Almonds” communal association is composed of nine members, all single mothers who are responsible for a total of 15 children. They are originally from El Sauce, located in the northern zone of the region. They can all be characterized as hard-working and responsible with a personal drive to get ahead. Lamentably, due to lack of economic resources, they could not study and they find themselves with a need to work to cover household expenses.

Thanks to her urge to get ahead, the coordinator is Concepcion. She has a general store. It's a small store that sells groceries in small quantities, including rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, detergent, soap, etc. Concepcion dedicates 12 hours a day to her store which is located in her own home. The object of this loan is to invest working capital in buying groceries for restocking, so that in the near future, Concepcion will be able to obtain better income.

“The Almonds” are grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer so that people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in a general store and purchase grocery products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,la socia vende faroles,parabrisas entre otros,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar faros,llantas y parabrisas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to work at her business selling auto parts for cars. She sells headlights, windshields, and other products. With this business, she wants to move forward. Her dream is to grow her auto parts business. She is requesting a loan to buy headlights, tires, and windshields.

She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: la socia solicita el credito para comprar faros,llantas y parabrisas.

loans.name: Quintina

texts.es:
Quintina es separada, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedida a la elaboracion y comercializacion del comida (sajta, biste , pollo dorado y otros platillos bolivianos) tiene su puesto de venta en  un mercado.
Quintina quiere otro crédito para comprar viveres (fideo , arroz, aceite y otros) Quintina sigue vendiendo papa Ya que en Bolivia se ha establecido el pago de un doble aguinaldo, mucha gente usa este dinero para comprar viveres por lo que es una buena oportunidad para Quintina que es la unica en su casa que obtiene ingresos
texts.en:
Quintina is separated, she has four children. She lives in the house of her parents located in the city of La Paz. She only studied until secondary school. She works making and selling food (sajta, beef, browned chicken, and other Bolivian dishes). She has her point of sale in a market.

Quintina wants another loan to buy groceries (noodles, rice, oil and others). Quintina continues selling potatoes. Since in Bolivia there has been a double Christmas bonus established, many people use the money to buy groceries. This is why it's a good opportunity for Quintina, who is the only one in her house who obtains income.

loans.use: to buy groceries (pasta, rice, oil and others).

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Silvia continues working at the business of selling clothing. The member sells pants, blouses and shirts. The member already has various years' experience in this business and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to have a bazar. The member is applying for the loan to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters and blouses.

The member is happy because of the loan and commits to fulfilling her payment installments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children. One of them is still in school and the other one is still small.  She has had a pharmacy store since 2004.  She works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asia's many loans from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the medicine stock, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy the fast-moving medicine in her pharmacy.  She dreams of building her own house.

Asia will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the fast-moving medicine in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Mauro Andres

texts.es: Mauro tiene 55 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 20 años de edad desde hace varios años por lo que es muy reconocido en su cantón como una persona amable y respetuosa. Él se desempeña como motorista del transporte colectivo actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años por lo que gracias a su experiencia no le hace falta el trabajo. Mauro desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda, ya que las láminas están corroídas y la madera tiene polilla por lo que está muy débil y el teme que en cualquier momento pueda desplomarse, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, hierro y pines para cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mauro is 55 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and their 20-year-old son. For many years, Mauro has been known in his canton for being a friendly and respectful person. He has been working as a driver for a transportation collective for 20 years. Thanks to his experience, he is not lacking anything on the job.

Mauro wants to replace the roof over the corridor of his house. The metal sheets have corroded and the wood is very weak since it has been eaten away by pests. He is afraid that the structure could collapse at any moment. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in galvanized metal sheets, beams, iron, and construction pins so that he can replace the roof over the corridor of his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, beams, iron, and construction pins so that he can replace the roof over the corridor of his home.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Bala is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: José Rogelio

texts.en:
José Rogelio is a Mexican farmer who raises and sells sheep for a living. When he found out about Sistema Biobolsa, he was very enthusiastic about the opportunity to protect the environment and produce his own energy from his sheep's waste. Indeed, the natural methanisation process taking place within the biodigester transforms manure into methane-rich biogas, which is connected to the stove and boiler in the kitchen and bathroom. In parallel, the bacteria inside the biodigester transform the remaining manure into a nutrient-rich, organic fertilizer that José Rogelio will spread on his small plot of land to increase his corn's yield in a natural way. His wife, who used to look for wood in the surrounding hills three times a week, will cook with biogas and not inhale the toxic smoke produced by the wood anymore. Her health and overall living conditions will improve, as well as the whole family's environment. With the savings José Rogelio will make by displacing the expensive and fossil fuel-based LP gas and chemical fertilizers, he plans to buy more sheep and expand their corral.

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Adamu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mary joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children Faith and Precious.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mary would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mary can now store her maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Mary spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thus reducing pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Gustavo Lorenzo

texts.en:
Gustavo lives on his farm with his family, where he raises hogs and cultivates corn. His biodigester was installed a few days go (as is shown I n the picture), and he is excited to see positive change happen in his home and farm. First of all, the biodigester will allow him to displace the expensive and fossil-fuel-based LP gas he used to buy to cook and heat water, as well as chemical fertilizers. Indeed, by inputting his hogs' manure in the biodigester, the methanisation process will produce biogas and the bacteria will transform the remaining waste into nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. Not only will Gustavo's farm become a cleaner, more sustainable farm, but he will save money and increase his crops' yield in a natural way. Further, his wife, who had to collect wood in the surroundings to cook and was exposed to the toxic smoke on a daily basis, will now cook with clean biogas, which does not threaten her health. Their children will grow up in a place where waste is considered as a resource and live in harmony with their environment.
This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 6 m3 waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to buy food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a maize farmer from Pegi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Amadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Amadu can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Amadu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Kabiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Dianah, Micah and Jeneth. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Kabiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Barnabas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Barnabas can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Barnabas expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from New York. She is single and is living with her dog, Taiga. Jennifer runs a services business providing a full range of facial skin care services, such as facials and laser hair removal. The business has been in operation for less than one year.

She says the main challenges faced are "finding the means to lease equipment when I have not been in business for a long time.” She says the greatest success is finding a location with heavy foot traffic at a reasonable monthly rent. Jennifer sends money to the Philippines every few months to support relatives living there.

Jennifer has requested a loan to renovate her salon space. She says this will help her business because "in my industry, it is important to be aesthetically pleasing."

Jennifer has a community-centered vision for her business: “My goal is ultimately to create an environment where my clients feel comfortable and have confidence in my skill. I envision a modern-day “Steel Magnolias”-type of high-tech salon where friends stay and get services to improve their appearance and their self-esteem. Personally, I envision self-sustainability for myself, my loved ones, and my community."

This is Jennifer's first loan with Accion.

loans.use: to pay for renovations to her salon space

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter used the previous loan to buy materials to make uniforms to sell. Alongside his agricultural practices, he offers tailoring services to schools, where he faces a challenge of seasonal customers, price fluctuations and inflation. Now that the term has ended, Peter needs the loan to buy herbicides for the tomatoes he is growing.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for the tomatoes he is growing.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest needs a loan to buy cows for fattening to sell during the peak season of Christmas. His business is cattle selling and milk production; this is how he gets income to support his family. He desires to give his family a gift of a good permanent house, though he is challenged by inadequate capital and the prolonged dry season, where animals die due to lack of water and pastures.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to sell during the peak season of Christmas

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, who deals in cattle fattening plus milk sales, is a hardworking married man with two children, and lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He started the businesses to meet his family’s increasing demands. John faces a hardship of the dry spell leading to lack of water and pastures for his animals, hence low yields. He dreams of building a permanent home. He will use the loan to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

The other person at the end of the right corner is his cattle keeper, who was at work when the photo was being taken.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Annamary

texts.en: Annamary is a 28-year-old married woman with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and has a bar, plus she sells fresh foods to supplement her income. She has a challenge of low capital, however, she possesses great hopes of having a well-stocked bar to increase her stock and income at large. Annamary needs a loan to buy beers, sodas, sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, sugar, rice and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy denim to make clothing

loans.name: Ana Marita

texts.es:
Ana Marita tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto sus hijos y esposo en el distrito de Zaña, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de raspadillas por la mañana y en las tardes prepara y vende champú (bebida tradicional de la región), cachangas y avena, su negocio está ubicado en la puerta de su domicilio, es conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza. El presente préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una refrigeradora para equipar su negocio. Con esto Ana Marita espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ofreciéndoles mejores productos, lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Marita is 42 years old and is in a common law marriage. She lives in her own home with her husband and children in the Zaña district located in the Chiclayo province which pertains to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants earn a living from farming, trade and raising cattle. 

She works selling snow cones in the morning and in the afternoon prepares and sells champu (a traditional drink in the area), cachangas (large mashed potato croquettes filled with a spicy ground beef and pepper filling) and oatmeal. Her business is located at the gate to her home. She is known in the area for the work that she does. The current loan will be used to buy a refrigerator to equip her business. Ana Marita hopes to provide better service to her customers with this, offering them better products. This will then be reflected in her level of income and will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to equip her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Angelina has a buy and sell condiments business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy onion, garlic, etc. to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy onion, garlic, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mugoma Farmers' Group

texts.en: Kevin is a member of Mugoma Farmers, where each member guarantees the other. He is 31 years old and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a bar and at the same time has a retail shop plus farmer. He faces a challenge of inadequate income, and besides that, he hopes to expand his shop to new areas. Kevin has asked for a loan to buy beers, sodas and waragi to sell during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas and waragi to sell during this festive season

loans.name: Iñilena

texts.en:
Iñilena is 58 years old and married with one child.

Iñilena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, charcoal, beverages, groceries, etc.

Iñilena has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Iñilena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, charcoal, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carmelita is 57 years old and has one child in school.

Carmelita has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for maintenance.

Carmelita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for maintainance

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 28 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Elisa has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, canned goods, dried fish, candies, bananas, soap, toiletries, and other groceries. 

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 62 years old and married with five children. Ermelinda works very hard to provide for them.

Ermelinda's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan, that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ermelinda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Ermelinda has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Ermelinda is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eutropia is 61 years old and has one child in school.

Eutropia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Eutropia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Eutropia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eutropia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ottavio

texts.en:
Ottavio is a proud son of Boston, Massachusetts. Ottavio runs a services business providing graphic design. The business has been in operation for 14 years. “I think of myself as an artist and get a great amount of satisfaction from a completed job.” He says the main challenge faced is having funds to grow the business. He says the greatest success has been painting the Boston Marathon "Finish" line.

Ottavio employs nine people. He is married with grown children; a grandson works part-time with him.

Ottavio has requested a loan to purchase another graphic arts machine. He says this loan will allow him to grow the business.

In the future, Ottavio plans to grow his business so that his grandchildren have a legacy and “to ensure my employees continue to have jobs with the family.”

You can see more of Ottavio’s work at his website: www.accurategraphics.us.com

loans.use: to purchase another printing machine.

loans.name: Lucia Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora  Xiomara de 40 años de edad,  tiene  casa propia y dos  hijas  que  dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de al Oriente de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de abarrotería como ser: arroz, frijoles, maseca, maíz, manteca, cal, café, azúcar, frescos, jugos, etc.  Siendo sus clientes amigos y vecinos que transitan por su casa.
Doña Xiomara está solicitando el préstamo para comprar frescos, manteca, arroz, maíz, papas, yuca, pollo, frijoles, aguas, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejore su negocio y tener mejores ganancias,  su sueño es engrandecer el negocio y brindar educación a sus hijas


 Trojes, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Xiomara is 40 years old and resides in her own home. She has two daughters who are dependent on her. Xiomara lives in a community in eastern Honduras. For the past five years, she has had a grocery business where she sell rice, beans, cornmeal, corn, lard, lime powder, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, juices, and other products. Her customers include friends and neighbors who come to her house.

Doña Xiomara is requesting a loan in order to buy soft drinks, lard, rice, corn, potatoes, cassava, chicken, beans, water, and other items. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her business and have more income. Her dream is to expand her business and provide an education for her daughters.

Trojes, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, lard, rice, corn, potatoes, cassava, chicken, beans, water, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 37 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

Janet has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as noodles, pampers, soap, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, fabric conditioner and other groceries. 

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 46 years old and married with two children.

Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jenny has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jenny aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 63 years old now.

Leonora has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Leonora requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy vegetables for her business to restart her business activities.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Letecia is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Letecia requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Letecia has been in this business for three years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, beer and refrigerator. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She has one buffalo and has a very simple house. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, beer and refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cheese, cream, coffee, milk, eggs, and other supplies for her business of selling breakfasts.

loans.name: Maria Felonila

texts.en:
Maria Felonila is 54 years old and widowed with four children. With two children in school, Maria Felonila works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Felonila runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Maria Felonila has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, junk foods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Maria Felonila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Monaliza works very hard to provide for them.

Monaliza runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Monaliza has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items such as vegetables, straw, charcoal, etc.

In the future, Monaliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.en:
Nemecia is 57 years old and has eleven children. Nemecia is married and has three children who are in school.

Nemecia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Nemecia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business. Nemecia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nemecia has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Nemecia is committed to rebuild her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as flour, pepper, sugar, eggs and bread. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $150. Juliana is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy flour, pepper, sugar, eggs and bread

loans.name: Caminemos Al Futuro  Ii Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS AL FUTURO II, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia María Antonieta tiene 42 años de edad  y tiene 02 hijos , la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, la socia lleva años  dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende clavos, cemento, vidones,pinturas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas entre otros. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la ferretería, agencia de viajes, venta de chocolates y comida, internet. 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Antonieta belongs to the 'Caminemos al futuro II' communal bank. The bank is located in the province and department of Cusco.

María Antonieta is 42 years old and has 2 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and running her hardware store. She has been in business for years and it going well thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday. María sells nails, cement, large cans, and paint, among other things for her customers that request them. She hopes to keep working in this manner to continue supporting her family.

María is requesting a loan to buy paint, among other things. The rest of the borrowers work at a hardware store, a travel agency, sell chocolates and food, and provide internet service.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity given and are committed to paying their installment payments on time. The members that appear in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy paint, among other things.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela, 62, is a widow with five children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 24 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already requested loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is reapplying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is from Alegria, Pagadian. He and his wife have a cornfield and earn a living doing farming activities. Recently, Arnold requested a loan to purchase a carabao (water buffalo) to plow and harrow their land, to plant corn seedlings, in hopes to yield more harvest. Arnold deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase carabao to plow and harrow their land

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 40 years old and married with two children in school. Pamela works very hard to provide for them.

Pamela's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Pamela is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Pamela has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to regain her business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Pamela is committed to rebuild, and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Through her membership with PMPC Emelita obtained the necessary capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Emelita has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune so she recently took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items including canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, focusing especially on the land and seed beds. She has applied for a loan from the cooperative to ensure she has enough corn fertilizer. In the future, Marissa hopes to save enough to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en: Fortunato is a farmer and has supported his family this way for 40 years. Now he hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing, supported by his loan of PHP 47,000. He hopes to maintain his membership of PMPC in good standing by having a good repayment record. Fortunato is very thankful that his financing needs are being supported by PMPC. Someday, he deeply wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some cooking utensils such as a pot and to buy ingredients such as chicken, flour, and cheese, among other things, to continue making her recipes.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en: Constantina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as wheat, sugar, salt and eggs. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $500. Constantina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, sugar, salt and eggs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has always been an enthusiastic farmer. She has cultivated her land in Pagadian to produce rice and has received good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seed bed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Teresita knows that she has to do things right to earn more income during this cropping season. 

In the future, Teresita hopes to buy a hauling truck to more easily transport her produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparations.

loans.name: Nazareno

texts.en:
Nazareno is driven by a passion to sell. He is married and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. He runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of his family. Every day he patiently fronts his store until 10 o'clock in the evening and he never gets tired. 

Nazareno wants to expand his business; he recently joined Paglaum MPC to access insurance and financial assistance. Now, he has borrowed PHP 20,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean more opportunities to earn income. 

In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, Julieta availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pigpens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito has always been enthusiastic about farming. He has cultivated his rice land in Aloran and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, he applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Paquito knows that he has to get things right to yield more income this cropping season. In the future, Paquito hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marcelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through two past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia is 63 years old and widowed with five children. Pacencia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Pacencia has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and groceries. 

In the future, Pacencia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She is 53 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (convenience) store and earns a small income that adequately supports her family. Rowena is a fully-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Rowena has now applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Rowena continues to look for better business opportunities, demonstrating that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to take care of medical expenses, such as completing specialized exams and purchasing medicine.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is married and from Aloran, Philippines. Remedios has a snack vending business. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month, and has been doing this type of activity for 10 years. This is how she helped her husband in sustaining their needs. Remedios wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. Remedios recently became an active member of PMPC. Now she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is 52 years old and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for two years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 60 years old and married with one child. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through three past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of six children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through 13 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley is 31 years old and has one child in school.

Shirley has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Shirley has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shirley would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 40 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling lechon (roasted pig).

Riza has taken out and repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 61 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children who are now at their adult age. 
Miguela earns a living from her little sari-sari store business. She is also supported by her husband, who is an elected barangay official in their community. She’s been engaged in this business for three years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity.  That amount is so helpful to support their family needs. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase two sacks of rice and five cases of drinks for retail. 
Miguela has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Miguela hopes to expand her sari-sari store by displaying additional line of products business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice and five cases of drinks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 47 years old and lives in Tanza, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Cesar, a draftsman, and has one child who is in school. Fe manages their household as well as operating her business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily household needs and to send her child to school.

Fe operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue her business she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal and soda. She expects her sales to increase as Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that it will be give her. It will surely help cover her family's daily needs and the education of her child.

Fe hopes to maintain and grow her business so her family can have a better life. She hopes for her child to finish college in order for her to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Fratty

texts.en:
Her name is Fratty. She is 62, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jolly and they have four children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school. 

Fratty operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 2,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, sugar, oil, beverages and other grocery stuff. She expects a higher demand for her groceries, as Christmas is fast approaching. Her store earnings  are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.  She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Fratty hopes to maintain and grow her business so they could have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, toiletries and other grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 52 years old and a married woman with eight children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelita has a business making and selling hollow blocks in the Philippines. Angelita requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks.

Angelita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Elsa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 28 years old and married with four children who are in school.

Renalyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap and shampoo. Renalyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell including canned goods, eggs, milk, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a 44-year old woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Angie has a used clothes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to by sacks of used clothes to resell. Angie has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Angie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a feed retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Marites is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more feed to sell to customers.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more feed to sell to customers.

loans.name: Geovanny Fredy

texts.es:
Geovanny, con 35 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Medellin; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Geovanny manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Geovanny, who is 35 years old, has made a living for many years by selling groceries in a store in the Medellin municipality. In this way, he supplements the income with which he has helped his children get ahead.

His persistence and perseverance have allowed him to fight tirelessly, always seeking a way to get ahead. This motivates him to request this loan to buy stock on wholesale (snacks, soft drinks, candies, and baking products, among others). This will allow him to continue his work and he will have a greater variety of products to offer his customers. This will improve his sales and income. 

Geovanny says that his greatest wish is to be able to obtain his own store located in the center of the city, to establish his business and make it a lot more profitable. This will guarantee him favorable economic stability to provide a better quality of life to his family.

He has faith in the support of the Interactuar corporation and in the Kiva lenders to succeed in this objective.

loans.use: to buy stock on wholesale including snacks, soft drinks, candies, and baking products, among others.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has started a small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari (convenience) store. She has so far managed to have enough stock and has reinvested her capital to earn more profit. Every day she makes good sales as hers in the only store in her barangay (district). 

Recently Carmelita approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by pig raising in the Philippines. Lucena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of feed for her pigs.

Lucena has been pig raising for five years, and also earns additional income from buy and sell goods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 52 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three adult children. Leonida earns income from her little sari-sari store and from a parcel of cocoland. She’s been engaged in this business for five years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. That amount is so helpful in supporting the income her husband earns as a farmer, in order to meet their needs. She had requested a loan which would be used to acquire a parcel of cocoland pawned to them.

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leonida hopes to acquire more parcels of cocoland to add to their family income.

loans.use: To acquire a  parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Elaine Monserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Horizontes De 24 de Mayo, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elaine, tiene 39 años de edad está casada y de esa relación tienen tres  hijos de 19, 18  y 14 años  de  edad, los tres estudian, dos en universidad y el menor en colegio. su marido es agricultor. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad
Doña Elaine es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en  su casa donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, ella  elabora ropa a personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa para que les elabore sus prendas, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido para que lo utilice en los cultivos, el siembra maíz y maní en la época invernal y necesita trabajar los terrenos donde va a sembrar.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas, cierres y preparar los terrenos para los cultivos. Lleva 8 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le están ayudando mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Horizontes de 24 de Mayo” (New Horizons of May 24) meets in the canton of May 24. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and its hardworking people who engage in agriculture and raising animals.

Sra. Elaine lives in this place. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children (ages 19, 18, and 14). All three of them are studying, two at a university and the youngest one in high school. Her husband is a farmer. Several years ago, Elaine learned sewing and dressmaking at a local academy.

Doña Elaine is an industrious woman who enjoys working in order to help her family with the household expenses. She has a small sewing workshop in her house where she produces clothing of all types. Elaine makes clothes for specific people who come to her house who need garments made. She will also share part of the loan with her husband, who will use the money for his crops. He plants corn and peanuts during the winter season. He needs to work the land so that it is ready for planting.

This loan will be used to buy thread, fabrics, and zippers, as well as to pay for the preparation of farmland for planting crops. Elaine has participated in eight loan cycles with her Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help. Her dreams include seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabrics, and zippers, as well as to pay for the preparation of her husband's farmland.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.en:
Bernardina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernardina is 56 years.

Bernardina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Bernardina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Bernardina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Christian Ann

texts.en:
Christian Ann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Christian Ann is 30 years old and two of her children are in school.

Christian Ann has a personal products business in the Philippines. Christian Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like shoes, bags, umbrellas and other personal products.

Christian Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Christian Ann would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like shoes, bags, umbrellas and other personal products.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 71 years old and married with seven children. Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Estelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 62 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four adult children. Alejandra is now engaged in the hog fattening business. She is earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase four piglets, three sacks of feed, and injections and vitamins, for her hog fattening business. Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Alejandra hopes to construct a bigger pig fence for her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing four piglets, three sacks of feed, injections and vitamins

loans.name: Bồi

texts.en:
Mrs. Bồi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Bồi is 23 years old and she is married with no children.
Bồi has her business in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bồi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bồi has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not a having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bồi hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
Rosejean is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosejean is 36 years old and two of her children are in school.

Rosejean has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines. Rosejean requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Rosejean has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosejean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a peanut butter making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Delia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ester is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ester has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from rice selling.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Janet has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old now.

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy chicken, pork and ingredients.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork and ingredients

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad.
Nelly vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Nelly tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal para aumentar su inventario y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, sabe que de la mano de Interactuar podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking individual. Thanks to her daily efforts, she has been able to help her children get ahead by providing them with a good-quality education. Nelly and her partner are in a common-law relationship. Some time ago, she began selling personal use products through catalogs. With great effort, she has been able to overcome many problems that she has encountered.

Nelly currently has quite a few orders from her customers, but she does not have a large amount of capital. She is seeking a loan in order to buy personal use products so that she can increase her inventory and fulfill these large outstanding orders from her customers.

Her greatest wish is to get ahead in her business so that she can offer her children a good quality of life and better financial stability. She knows that she can achieve this with help from Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to sell.

loans.name: July Grace

texts.en: July Grace thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can request financial assistance for her chosen business. July Grace has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. July Grace wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of groceries such as pasta, instant noodles, beverages, coffee, frozen foods and other grocery items which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand for groceries now that Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment. The financial help that will be given her will surely help cover their daily household needs and her children's education. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Angeline dreams of having a grocery store someday to attract more customers. She aims to give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elvira is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.
