loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 13 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sensible, sincera, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una área rural que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo crespo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, prendas como; pantalones, cinturones, poleras manga corta, bermudas, y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día en un puesto de venta en la calle al aire libre. “Nuestro trabajo empieza en la clasificación de la ropa, zapatos, complementos bolsos, cinturones, juguetes, etc, para ofrecer a nuestro clientes” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una tienda. Ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes por la demanda de la época. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de temporada.
texts.en:
Juana is a 32-year-old woman who is single and has two children, ages 7 and 13. Her business involves selling secondhand clothing. She is a good mother who has a positive attitude. She is also enterprising, sensible, sincere, optimistic, cheerful, responsible, and hardworking. Juana conducts her business in the town of El Torno, a rural area where agricultural producers of meat, milk, vegetables, grains, and other products gather. They sell to wholesale merchants and distributors who take these products and deliver them to different markets in the city. This tropical area has a warm and humid climate. The air temperature varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade throughout the entire year.

Juana has a dark complexion, long black curly hair, and a short stature. Her native language is Guaraní and speaks Spanish in order to integrate herself into the general culture and to conduct business. She shares her life with her children who are in school. Juana lives in a rented brick house that receives electricity, running water, and sewage services. Her business involves selling secondhand clothes. These garments include trousers, belts, short-sleeved shirts, Bermuda shorts, and other items. Juana works every day of the week by managing her retail stand at the open air market. “My work begins by grouping together all of the clothes, shoes, accessory bags, belts, toys, and other items so that I can offer them to my customers,” she says. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and open a store.

Juana wants to buy secondhand clothes in bulk so that she can meet the demand from her customers this season. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender and she has been in this business for three years. For the reasons mentioned, Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy secondhand clothes in bulk so that she can supply her seasonal customers.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes in bulk so that she can supply her seasonal customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline Carolina

texts.es: Jacqueline es una joven de 25 años de edad que se gana la vida con su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas, además posee una tienda de productos básicos actividad que le ha permitido apoyar a su familia con los gastos económicos de su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su padre, su hermana y su grupo familiar. Jacqueline sabe que se acerca la temporada navideña en la cual espera que sus ventas se incrementen, por lo que desea comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para su tienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cereales, lácteos, embutidos, pan dulce, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a young woman who is 25 years of age. She earns her living through her business of making and selling tortillas. In addition, she has a basic products store that allows her to contribute to her family’s expenses. Jacqueline resides in her own home along with her father, her sister, and the rest of her family. She knows that with the Christmas season approaching, she can expect to increase her sales.

Jacqueline wants to buy a larger quantity and a wider variety products for her store. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in cereals, dairy products, sausages, sweet bread, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cereals, dairy products, sausages, sweet bread, sugar, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and has four children. She is married, and two of her children are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dairo Enrique

texts.es:
Dairo es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 30 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de mango y naranja, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 3 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Dairo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Dairo Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Dairo is 30 years old, and is a humble and hard-working farmer. From an early age, he learned all about farm work, thanks to the teachings of his father.

Currently, he grows mangoes and oranges, which are picked and then sold in the market of the town where he lives. This generates the necessary income for him to feed his household and pay for the basic necessities of his wife and 3 children.

His purpose for requesting the loan is to purchase agricultural supplies at wholesale (organic fertilizers, pesticides, other fertilizers). This will enable him to continue to take care of his crops, and improve the yield of his next harvest, which will increase his income from sales.

Dairo shares that his biggest desire is to continue to fight for the economic stability of his family, and to give them better living conditions and improve their well-being.

Dairo's crops will enable him to support himself and get ahead with your help!

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (organic fertilizers, pesticides, other fertilizers).

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling sack bags in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her sack bag-making business.

Johna has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her sack bag-making.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jinky is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Jinky has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Jinky requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmen works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Carmen is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Carmen hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a restaurant at the public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is thankful that she was granted an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney unit. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 8000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney. It is very important that her jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous efficient service to her passengers. Part of the loan she will use to buy direct selling products to sell, which is her other business. She thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will greatly help in sending her children to college. 

Alicia hopes to buy another unit in the future and grow her direct selling business. She prays for good health and a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma Wilma is 62 years old and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is a married woman with two children. Wilma has a food production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Wilma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 61 years old and has one child who is still in school. Juliana has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Juliana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Gennie

texts.en:
Gennie is 46 years old and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She is married. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gennie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Gennie has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gennie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married mother of twelve children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Virginia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable business. She has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Virginia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en:
Ilda is  taking a loan of $600 to improve her business.

She is married and running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, salt, milks, oils and fish. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $200  

She is a hard working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, cigarettes, coffee, salt, milks, oils and fish.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
Jose, con 64 años de edad, es un hombre muy familiar. 
Nació y se crió en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas al lado de su padre; gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene cultivos de café, cuya cosecha es vendida y de esta manera obtiene los recursos para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 
El prestatario es un hombre pujante, luchador, dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, eso lo motiva para trabajar largas jornadas y tratar de salir adelante; día a día lucha para sobrepasar los obstáculos que se le presentan, ha pasado por situaciones económicas difíciles debido al bajo precio del café en el mercado, lo que afecta el precio de su producto. 

Jose solicita su crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y preparar sus cultivos para cosechar un producto de muy buena calidad.

Jose sueña con mejorar sus cultivos, ampliarlos para obtener de estos una buena renta mensual.
texts.en:
Jose, 64 years old, is a very warm man. He was born and raised in the country, where he learned agricultural work alongside his father. Thanks to that, today he has coffee crops that he harvests and sells. In this way he obtains the resources to bring food to his home. 

The borrower is a thriving, determined man who is dedicated to his family and his work. That is what motivates him to work long days and to try to get ahead. Day by day he fights to overcome the obstacles that come his way. He has gone through difficult economic situations due to the low price of coffee in the market, which affects the price of his product.

Jose requests the loan from Corporación Interactuar to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticide), with the goal to keep his business going and to prepare his crops in order to harvest a product of very good quality.

Jose dreams of improving and increasing his crops in order to obtain a good monthly income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticide).

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a married woman with ten children, eight of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norberta is 45 years old. 

Norberta has a buy and sell rug business in the Philippines. Norberta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of rugs to sell. Norberta has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Norberta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rugs to sell.

loans.name: Julie Mae

texts.en:
Julie Mae is 24 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julie Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, candies, etc. to sell.

Julie Mae has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, candies, etc. 

In the future, Julie Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, and candies to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Espelita

texts.en:
Espelita is 44 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Espelita works very hard to provide for her family.

Espelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, etc. Espelita has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vilma has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: June Marie

texts.en:
June Marie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. June Marie is 26 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

June Marie has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. June Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business.

June Marie has been in this business for seven years. June Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit of bicycle for her business

loans.name: Ledi Hope

texts.en:
Ledi Hope is single, and has a  business buying and selling fertilized duck embryo in the Philippines.  Ledi Hope requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional trays of fertilized duck embryo to sell to her customers.  Ledi Hope has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ledi Hope would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of fertilized duck embryo to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Mercedita is borrowing a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to her customers.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 36 years old and married with one child in school. Adelina works very hard to provide for her family.

Adelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc. Adelina has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Adelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia is 54 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leocadia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Leocadia is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a meat vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall for her meat vending business.  Lolita has been in this business for three years.  Lolita earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell in her meat stall.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 47 years old and widowed with four children. Lucresia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucresia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.  Lucresia has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, soft drinks, juice, noodles, etc. 

Lucresia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 41 years old and married with one child in school. Melody works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Melody has been in this business for 13 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Godilla

texts.en:
Godilla is 53 years old and has five children. She is a married woman with simple dreams in life.

Godilla is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Godilla requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Godilla has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Godilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and cellular phone loads which she sells at retail. She expects a higher demand for groceries as Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. It will surely help meet their household, personal, and school needs of her child.

Amelia dreams of having a bigger general store to attract more customers and improve her income. She wishes for her child to finish college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es: jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y tambien se dedica  a la crianza de ganado,cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego  comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas semillas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: 42 year old Jose lives in his own home with his spouse, he earns a living growing corn and also raising livestock. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the barn shown in the picture, to later sell in various markets. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc to continue with his job.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 48 years old and both of her children are in school.

Rosalina has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like bags, school uniform, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like bags, school uniform, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 46 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Luz has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luz has been in this business for five years. In the future, Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 64 years old and a widow with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Luz aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Socorro is now 55-years-old. 

Ma. Socorro has a buy-and-sell cosmetic products business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion and soap. 

Ma. Socorro has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, soap, etc.

loans.name: Dania

texts.en: Dania was born in Puerto Rico. At an early age, she found joy in helping people look their best. When she arrived in the U.S. she began providing manicure services at the homes of her clients. It was then that she decided to open her own nail salon. A loan of $1,150 will allow her to pay for one month of rent and security to start her business.

loans.use: to open her manicure business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 53 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Marilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years. Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, and spices for her food production business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, con hijos independientes de 28 y 22 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es independiente, trabajadora, fuerte, luchadora y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘batallas’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, los habitantes del lugar se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y producción de derivados de la leche. De clima frío y seco, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados, y a una altura aproximada de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Benita es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja con ella, viven en una casa construida de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y compran agua de camión cisterna. Su negocio es la pesca, las variedades del lugar son; el surubí, pacú, sábalo, qarachi y el mauri. Labor que realiza 2 veces al día adentrándose a diferentes lugares del lago por varias horas. Una herramienta importante en su trabajo es el motor de su bote, este se encuentra averiado y necesita cambiarlo para poder recorrer distancias más largas. “la pesca de qarachi es muy demandada, porque con este pez se preparan muchas comidas ricas…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos mediante la pesca. Ella desea realizar la compra de un motor para bote para recorrer distancias más profundas en el lago y mejorar su pesca. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Benita solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor para su bote de pesca para pescar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Benita is 50 years old, married, with independent children,ages 28 and 22. Her business is fishing. She is independent, hard-working, strong, determined and responsible. 

She works in the community of the Batallas, in an area known for being located near the sacred lake Titicaca. 

The area's inhabitants engage in agriculture, livestock-raising and the production of milk products. It has a cold and dry climate, a temperature that varies between 2 and 12°C and an altitude of approximately 3800 meters above sea level. Benita  has dark skin, long, braided hair, and is of slight stature. Her clothing is traditional,(hat, shawl and pollera skirt. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which is spoken in the area, and she also speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business she does. 

She shares her life with her husband, who works with her. They live in a house constructed of adobe which has electricity. They buy water from a water truck. Her business is fishing, and the varieties  in the area are surubí, pacú, sábalo, qarachi and mauri. She works two days a week, going into various areas of the Lake for several hours. 

An important tool in her work is the motor of her fishing boat.  It is currently broken down and she needs to replace it so that she can travel greater distances. garachi fish is much in demand, because many tasty dishes can be prepared with this fish. Her dream is to improve her income through fishing. She wishes to purchase an engine for her boat so that she can travel greater distances on the lake and improve her fishing. This is her first  loan with the institution in the 25 years she has been doing this work. That is why Benita is requesting a loan to buy an engine for her fishing boat so that she can catch more fish.

loans.use: To buy an engine for her fishing boat so that she can catch more fish.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Don Rosalio es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable, un poco serio, pero amable. Él tiene 40 años de edad y está casado con la señora María del Rosario , juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos pequeños de los cuales dos asisten a la primaria y el más pequeño al preescolar. 

Don Rosalio tiene una refaccionaria desde hace 14 años, la inició porque estudió mecánica y tenía todos los conocimientos para montar su propio negocio, pero le hacía falta capital. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos y reunieron dinero para comprar toda la mercancía necesaria. Actualmente, los hermanos de Rosalio trabajan para él, haciéndose cargo de tareas pequeñas en la ferretería.

Los préstamos de VisionFund han sido de gran ayuda porque ha podido mantener suficiente mercancía en la refaccionaria. Esta vez necesita comprar más aceites y lubricantes que le hacen falta. Con sus ingresos puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos con mayor facilidad. 

Don Rosalio esta muy agradecido con Vision Fund y KIVA porque su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, el número de clientes sigue en aumento e incluso ahora tiene en mente abrir otro local en algún punto del municipio, esta vez también quiere reparar autos aprovechando su preparación. "Hace algunos meses tomé otros cursos de mecánica los cuales han ayudado para mejorar mi servicio en el negocio actual".

*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Don Rosalio.
texts.en:
Rosalío is a very hardworking, responsible man who is a little serious, but kind. He is 40 years old and married to María de Rosario. Together they have formed a family of three small children, two attend elementary school and the youngest attends preschool. 

Rosalío has owned an auto repair shop for 14 years, he opened it because he studied mechanics and had the knowledge to start his own business, but he is missing capital. Fortunately, he has the support of his siblings and they collected money to all the necessary merchandise. Now, Rosalío's siblings work for him, taking care of small assignments in the shop.

The loans from Vision Fund have been a great help because they have allowed him to maintain enough merchandise in the repair shop. This time he needs to buy more oils and lubricants that are needed. With his income he can pay living costs and for his children's education with more ease.  

Rosalío is very grateful for Vision Fund and KIVA because his business has grown bit by bit, his number of clients continues growing and he is now considering opening another location in a different part of the municipal. This time he also wants to repair autos, taking advantage of his training. He says, "A few months ago I took more mechanic's courses which have helped to better my services in my current business." 

*The photo was taken in Rosalío's business.

loans.use: to buy oils and lubricants.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support her family. Josefina is widowed and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Josefina has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Josefina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stablity of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Don Emiliano es muy alegre, siempre esta de muy buen humor, pero sobretodo es muy amable. Él tiene 43 años de edad y está casado con la señora Azucena, juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos los cuales estudian la universidad, preparatoria y primaria, respectivamente.

Don Emiliano platica que durante 16 años trabajó como empleado en una imprenta donde adquirió mucha experiencia, sin embargo ya no le gustaban las condiciones laborales "Me canse de trabajar como empleado, sabía que yo podía emprender una imprenta aunque fuera difícil" comentó Don Emiliano. Hace 9 años inició su propio negocio diseñando solo algunos logotipos porque no contaba con la maquinaria adecuada, pero a poco con sus ganancias pudo comprar su primera máquina para serigrafía. Y así, comenzó a hacer reales candelarios, recetas medicas, invitaciones, propagandas, estampados en playeras, etc.

Navidad y principio de año siempre son la mejor época para el negocio porque todos los comerciantes mandan a hacer calendarios. Para aprovechar la temporada, necesita un préstamo para comprar calendarios con los meses impresos, después él solo hace el acabado con el nombre del negocio, direcciones y agradecimientos.

Emiliano está muy agradecido con los préstamos que le han ayudado ha adquirir maquinaria más sofisticada como plotters, un nuevo equipo de computo y equipo de sublimación, lo que le permite dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Aunque aún se puede mejorar "Si yo pudiera tener un equipo más grande, podría abarcar el trabajo de dos municipios más" y no pierde las esperanzas de lograrlo algún día. 

Además, gracias a sus ganancias Emiliano ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida en cuanto alimentación, calzado, su vivienda ha tenido cambios y lo mas importante, sus hijos continúan estudiando. Don Emiliano y Azucena quieren que sus hijos tengan una carrera profesional

*La foto fue tomada en el negocio Don Emiliano y aparece un calendario que él regala a sus mejores clientes*
texts.en:
Emiliano is very cheerful, always in good spirits, and most of all is very friendly. He is 43 years old and is married to Azucena. Together they have a family with three children who are studying at college, high school and primary, respectively.

Emiliano describes how for 16 years he worked as an employee at a print shop where he acquired a lot of experience, however,  he did not enjoy the working conditions "I got tired of working as an employee, I knew that I could start a printing business but it would be difficult," said Emiliano. 9 years ago he set up his own business just designing logos because he did not yet have the right equipment, but soon after he used his earnings to buy his first screen printing machine. And so he began to make calendars, medical prescriptions, invitations, advertisements, screen-printed t-shirts, etc.

Christmas and the new year are always the best time for business because all business order calendars. To take advantage of the season, he needs a loan to buy calendars with months already printed on them, then he only has to finish them off with the name of the business, its address and acknowledgments.

Emiliano is very grateful for the loans that have helped him acquire more sophisticated equipment such as plotters, a new computer and dye sublimation equipment, allowing him to better serve his customers. Although he believes he can still improve: "If I had a larger team, I could cover the work of two more districts". He hopes to achieve that someday.

Additionally, thanks to his earnings Emiliano has improved his quality of life, in terms of food, shoes, his housing has undergone changes and most importantly, his children continue their studies. Emiliano and Azucena want their children to have a professional career.

* This photo was taken at Emiliano's shop and he is shown holding a calendar that he gives to his best customers. *

loans.use: to buy calendars

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is thankful that she was granted a 19,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy materials needed in her tailoring business. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She would like to apply again for another 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her tailoring business. She earns a minimum of 6,000 PHP a month for sewing pillows, curtains and offcice and school uniforms. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help in their daily household needs and for the education of her child. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Adelaida wishes to acquire a bigger space to accommodate more custom orders from her customers. She dreams to give her family a better life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana started her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $250. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy enough items according to what people needed. After three years, she got the information about Tuba Rai Metin. She came to get the information and she is very interested in it.

She is requesting a loan of $800.00 to buy more needed items to keep in her store. She has also seven children. She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that. She wants to improve her management because she wants to make her kiosk into a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, candies, cooking oils, sugar, noodles, biscuits and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis un humilde agricultor que cada mañana sale a trabajar en su campo, dedicado en pleno a su trabajo, este hombre solo piensa en progresar y entregar un buen producto pues sabe que muchas personas lo consumen y por ello cada gota de sudor que sale de su frente es el empeño que pone para que su productos salgan puros y de calidad.
Como todo buen agricultor, quiere siempre implementar arreglos y mejoras para a sus cultivos pero sabe que estos arreglos o implementaciones son muy costosos por esta razón solicita un crédito para adecuar sus campos y comprar insumos como fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas, entre otros con el único propósito de mejorar su manera de cultivar, hacer más fácil su trabajo y darle al cliente final un producto de calidad
texts.en:
Luis is a humble farmer who goes to his field every morning to do work that he is fully dedicated to.  He only thinks of making progress and delivering a good final product since he knows that many people will consume it and he realizes that every drop of sweat on his forehead is an investment in a pure and good-quality product.

As a good farmer, he always wants to maintain and improve his crops but he knows that such maintenance and improvements are very costly, so he is asking for a loan to fix up his fields and buy inputs such as fertilizer, manure, and pesticides, among other things, with the sole intention of improving his methods of cultivation, make his work easier, and giving his customers a quality final product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, manure, and pesticides, among other products

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 44 years old and a married woman with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teodora has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Teodora requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and separated with one child. With her child currently in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Mary Ann has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, bath soap, hair conditioner, noodles, canned goods, candies, juice, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is a married woman with six children. She is 49 years old and four of her children are currently in school. Melania is a very hard working entrepreneur and she has a banana vending business in the Philippines. Melania has requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

Melania has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda works hard to support her family. She  is married and has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years now. Merlinda has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 32 years old and married with one child.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juanita has been raising pigs for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF 7 times in the past and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
His name is Alberto, 59, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Perly and has four children. He manages their household while operating a business. They work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Alberto owns and oversees operation of his jeepney service. He has one 14-16 person capacity jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common form of public transport throughout the many islands of the Philippines. Most of the time, jeepneys are packed with passengers. They are one of the remnants of the American military presence in the Philippines during the second World War and are still to be seen throughout the Philippines in many colors and all over the place. Originally, jeepneys were old American jeeps. They were used in the war against the Japanese army, who occupied the Philippines for several years. After the Japanese army was defeated and the American military mission was completed, the jeeps were left by the tens of thousands on the islands of the Philippines.The Filipinos saw possibilities to make out of these jeeps. They saw a real transportation means by making these jeeps about two meters longer and putting two long seats in them: one on each side from the front to the back. Since then, jeepneys have been used as small buses for cheap transport of people, goods, and even sometimes, little animals. Jeepney transport service is one of the stable businesses in the Philippines. 

To help him continue operations of his business, Alberto is requesting a 16,000 Philippine peso loan, which he will use for repairs and maintenance of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. His earnings from its service is their means of living. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Alberto hopes that their transport service will continue to be successful. He dreams for his children to get the best education. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old and both her children are in school. Mylen is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. Mylen has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business such as fabric, thread, needles, etc. In the future, Mylen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Myrna has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Myrna has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

Myrna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Nena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Nena has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marivic has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marivic has been in this business for sixteen years. Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mahrambi

texts.ru:
Махрамби трудолюбивая сельская женщина в возрасте 45 лет. Она наряду с другими односельчанами своего района Фархор занимается типичной сельской деятельностью - животноводством. При дворе дома Махрамби имеет коровник, в котором держит скот. Вот уже 5 лет как она занимается разведением коров и быков при поддержке своих сыновей. Махрамби многодетная мать. У нее шестеро детей. Четверо старших детей уже окончили школу и стали настоящими помощниками матери в ее сельском хозяйстве.
В настоящий момент Махрамби хочет увеличить поголовье своих скотов, так как цена их на рынке сейчас низкая. На всю сумму кредита в размере 2500 долларов она хочет закупить несколько голов коров и бычков. Таким обрзом она сможет увеличить доходность своей животноводческой деятельнольности. Махрамби верит в вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Marhambi is a hardworking 45-year-old woman from the countryside.  Like many residents of her own district, the Farkhor district, she is involved in a typical rural activity - animal husbandry.  She has a barn at home, in which she keeps cattle.  With her sons' help, she has been raising cows and bulls for five years already.  Marhambi has a large family (she is the mother of six children).  The oldest four have already left school and essentially help their mother with the farming business.  At the moment, Marhambi plans to increase her cattle headcount, because the market price of cattle is currently quite low.  She will use the whole amount of the loan ($ 2,500) to buy a few cows and young bulls.  This will allow her to make more profits out of her animal husbandry activity.  Marhambi believes in your support.

loans.use: to buy a few cows and young bulls in order to increase her cattle headcount.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and a married woman with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a buying and selling livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenea is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Irenea runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Irenea would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betty Nelia

texts.es:
Nelia es una mujer de 31 años, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino y porcino.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada porque se encuentra en la parte oeste del lago sagrado ‘Titicaca’ a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. 
Nelia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que se dedican  a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida con paredes de adobe y techo de paja, cuenta con electricidad y recoge agua del lago. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino y porcino, el cual debe alimentar hasta su engorde para el comercio y reproducción; para las nuevas generaciones. “el forraje es escaso en invierno porque se seca el pasto y compramos totora para el alimento, en esta época de verano los pajonales crecen y es la oportunidad para el engorde…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un establo grande y en buenas condiciones para que su ganado crezca más grande. Ella desea realizar la compra de cerdos de cabaña para su engorde y venta en las siguientes fiestas patronales del lugar. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nelia solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos de cabaña para su engorde y venta en las próximas fiestas patronales del lugar.
texts.en:
Nelia is 31 years old and single, with no children, and she is in the business of selling livestock sheep and pigs.  She is entrepreneurial, optimistic,  and happy.  She has a good attitude and is responsible and hard-working.  She carries out her business in Batallas, an area characterized by it's location on the Western part of the sacred Like Titicaca at an altitude close to 3,900 meters above sea level.  It has a pronounced diurnal climate where there are marked variations in daytime temperatures according to the time of year.  

Nelia has a dark complexion and long, braided black hair.  She wears traditional garments (hat, shawl, and skirt), and her mother tongue is Aymará which is spoken in the area.  She speaks Spanish with the general population and when she does business.  She shares her life with her parents who make a living in agriculture.  They live in their own home made of adobe walls with a straw roof that has electricity, and they get water from the lake.  

She is in the livestock pig and sheep business, and she has to feed the animals until they fatten enough to be sold or to reproduce new generations.  She notes that fodder is scarce in the winter because the pasture dries out and so they buy large reeds as fodder.  In this summer season, the scrublands grow and they have the opportunity to fatten the animals.

Her dream is to have a large stable and good conditions so that her livestock grow bigger.  She is asking for a loan to buy livestock pigs to fatten and sell at the next patronage festival of the area.  This is her first sequence of loans from this institution in the 10 years that she has been doing business independently.

loans.use: to buy livestock pigs to fatten and sell at the next patronage festival of the area

loans.name: Temy

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Temy, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su casa.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Temy ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas, además de comprar sillas y mesas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio dando un mejor servicio a su clientes para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Temy is humble and hard-working, a warrior woman who has dedicated most of her life to taking cake of her children.  She lives in the city of Sincelejo, where she makes a living preparing various dishes such as lunches and breakfasts at a small restaurant located in her home.  Her cooking is well-known among her neighbors, who come to her restaurant because they know that they can eat delicious food there.  

Temy has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, so she has turned to taking out a loan to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes, as well as tables and chairs.  This loan will allow her to push her business forwards by providing better service to her customers and make enough income to give her the opportunity to continue supporting her family and her business.  

Please support Temy with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes, as well as tables and chairs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married with two children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Gina aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Procora requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Procora has been in this business for 12 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Procora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el noven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man with the blurred face is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He makes a living by farming and his main crop is corn. He sells his products in the surrounding areas of the zone where he lives. 

The young man lives in his own house with his wife and son. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc. – to thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: G.s. La Bendicion El Sauce Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. BENDICIÓN EL SAUCE ESTA CONFORMADO POR CINCO INTEGRANTES   MADRES SOLTERAS  RESPONSABLES  CON DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD. SON ORIGINARIAS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER UNA ZONA PRODUCTORA DE LECHE Y QUESO,   LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. 
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES ANA Y  TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO: BLUSAS, FALDAS, PANTALONES, SHORES, CAPRI, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO, ROPA INTERIOR, TOALLAS ETC LO TIENE UBICADO  EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, ELLA DEDICA  A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIES HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTOS A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO  DE ANA ES RECORRER LAS CALLES DE SU COMUNIDAD  CON UN PESO DE UNOS 20 KG OFRECIENDO SU MERCADERÍA  A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES  EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR DE ROPA NUEVA PAR LA TEMPORADA NAVIDEÑA, EL G.S. BENDICIÓN EL SAUCE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The 'G.S. Bendicion El Sauce' group is made up of 5 responsible single mothers who have 10 children in their care.  They are from El Sauce, a place that is characterized by its milk and cheese production.  Unfortunately, they weren't able to study because of scarce economic resources, and it was necessary for them to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.  

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Ana became the coordinator of this group and she is in the business of selling new clothing such as blouses, skirts, pants, shorts, capri pants, bedding, children's clothing, underwear, and towels, among other things.  She sells from her home and is also a traveling salesman.  She works 10 hours a day, traveling though the streets of her community carrying 20 kilograms of merchandise that she offers to fixed and occasional clients.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and a supply of new clothing for the Christmas season.  

The 'G.S. Bendicion El Sauce' group thanks Kiva lenders for providing people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua with help so that they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to buy and sell new clothing such as dresses, pants, shorts, blouses, shirts, children's clothing, towels, and bedding

loans.name: Djiguifa 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Djiguifa 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Ramatou, arrêtée 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Djigufa 3 group are married women averaging 36 years of age, with two children. They all live in traditional families in Pala, a village in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their vegetable-growing businesses. They are on their second loan.

They grow shallots, which is what Ramatou does, for example. She is the second one standing from right to left in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy seeds, agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and supplies in order to work her -0.25 ha [0.6 acres] land plot.
After harvesting, she sells her produce in the village and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an approximate revenue of 100,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and cover everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel es cliente de la institución de 26 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijas de las edades de 4 y 2 años, su negocio es el comercio de venta de lubricantes, aceite y aditivos para vehículos.
Él es un buen hombre,  padre, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Kalajahuira’ lugar de donde salen las movilidades a los yungas, y también lugar estratégico donde Noel pueda ofrecer sus productos, la zona es de clima frio por estar en  cercanías de la cumbre.
Noel es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana,  su lengua es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza con su pareja que le ayuda en el comercio con la cual también se encuentra en la foto, “Gracias al trabajo duro con mi pareja logramos tener mucho clientes a los cuales realizamos la venta lubricantes …” comenta. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijas que estudien y sean personas de bien,  Esta es la primera  secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Noel solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite por mayor  y comercializar su producto ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en:
Noel is a 26-year-old client of the institution. He is married and has two daughters who are 4 and 2 years old. His business is the sale of lubricants, oil, and additives for vehicles.

He is a good man and father, responsible and hardworking. He runs his business in the "Kalaiahuira" zone, a place where vehicles leave for the tropical valleys, and also a strategic place where Noel can sell his products. The region has a cold climate, because it is in the vicinity of the summit.

Noel has brown skin, short black hair, and medium stature. His language is Aymará, and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for the business that he runs. He lives his life with his wife, who helps him in the business, and who appears with him in the photo. "Thanks to my wife's and my hard work, we have managed to have lots of customers we sell lubricants to," he says. 

His dream is to see his daughters grow, and for them to study and become good people. That's why Noel is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil at wholesale, so he can sell his product, as he has a lot of demand for this product at the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy oil at wholesale

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
LAS SRA. LUZ MARINA DE 36 ANOS DE EDAD, MADRE SOLTERA CON UN HIJO MENOR DE EDAD,  ES ORIGINARIA DEL SAUCE, LUGAR  QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER  PRODUCTOR DE LECHE, QUESO, CUAJADA, TRABAJADORA  RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR, PERO LE HUBIERA GUSTADO ESTUDIAR ENFERMERÍA PROFESIONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA DÍA A DÍA PARA BRINDARLE A SUS HIJOS MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA  LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE COMO: VESTIDOS, FALDAS, SHORT, JENS, BLUSAS, CAMISETAS, ROPA INTERIOR, ROPA DE CAMA, TOALLLAS ETC. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA APROVECHAR LA TEMPORADA NAVIDEÑA Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LUZ MARINA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 36-year-old single mother of one child, who is a minor. She is from El Sauce, a place that is characterized by its milk and cheese production. She is responsible and hard-working, with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study because of scarce economic resources, but she would have liked to study to become a professional nurse.  Presently, she fights day after day to give her children better opportunities in life.  

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she started selling new clothing from her home and as a traveling salesman.  She sells dresses, skirts, jeans, blouses, shirts, underwear, bedding, and towels, among other things.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and a supply of new clothing so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season, and to be able to bring in more income in the not-so-distant future. 

Luz Marina thanks Kiva lenders for providing people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua with help so that they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as dresses, skirts, shorts, jeans, blouses, shirts, underwear, bedding, and towels, among other things

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 49 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, eggs, noodles, etc.

Diana has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and earns additional income from dressmaking.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, bread, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Noemi works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Noemi is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Noemi has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling natural medicines in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling firewood. Merlita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of natural medicines to sell.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 54 years old and married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Anna has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Anna requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Anna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Anna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es: Santos de 51 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de jocotes desde hace varios años,comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, vive en casa propia con su hijo  su nieta, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno nuevamente que es el que muestra en la fotografia para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos, 51 years old, has made a living growing “jocotes” (a Central American fruit) for several years. She sells her products in various markets, and she lives in her own home with her son and granddaughter. 

She is asking for another loan to buy more fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, etc. to improve her land again (shown in the picture) – in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, etc. and improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to repair the walls of one bedroom and the bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SI SE PUEDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angela ella es soltera y tiene 18 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the lending group "Si Se Puede" [Yes You Can]. The group is located in the district, province and state of Cusco. One of the members, Angela, is 18 years old and is single. She works in her grocery store selling basic goods like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8am to 6pm. She's been doing this for a year already and it's going well. Her dream is to increase the size of her grocery store. Angela asks for a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members of the lending group have businesses including food sales, clothing sales, groceries, and selling artisan goods.

Angela thanks those who are a part of her dream through this process and promises to comply with the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her dress-making business. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through this assistance.

Alma wants for her business to thrive. She hopes that she and her family are always safe and in good health. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her dress-making business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 49, lives in Puntod, Plaridel. She is married and was gifted with five children. Linda and her husband are both farmers. They raised their family doing this type of activity. 

This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodity to continue putting bread on the table in their home. In need of additional working capital, Linda decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 20,000 to pay for labor cost and land preparation on her rice farm and to buy fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield on her growing crops. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Linda is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a land tractor someday for fast and easy farm operation.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost and land preparation on her rice farm and to buy fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield on her growing crops

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
LA SRA. KARLA DE 42 ANOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIA DEL SAUCE,  CASADA CON TRES HIJOS  MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO,  ESTA JOVEN MUJER SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL.
