LAMENTABLEMENTE ELLA NO PUDO ESTUDIAR POR LAS DIFICULTADES ECONÓMICA QUE VIVIÓ EN SU NIÑEZ Y ADOLESCENCIA, POR TAL MOTIVO ELLA EN LA ACTUALIDAD COMO MADRES QUIERE BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA, PARA AYUDARLOS A FORMARLOS COMO PERSONAS DE BIEN, INTEGRA COMO SE LO MERECEN. EN L A ACTUALIDAD LUCHA DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO  OBTENER MAS  CLIENTES Y MEJORES GANANCIAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE COSMÉTICOS COMO: RUBOR, SOMBRAS DE OJOS, DELINEADORES, MARBELLINES, CREMA ANTI OJERAS, BODY, PERFUMES, CORRECTOR ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. KARLA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS  Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Karla, 42, is originally from Sauce. She is married and has three children who are in school. Karla is hardworking and responsible with a great desire to overcome personal challenges. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to go to school because of financial difficulties growing up. For that reason, as a mother she now wants to give her children better opportunities in life and help them become good people like they deserve.

She works every day to make her business better, getting more clients and more profits. Thanks to her desire to improve, she works in cosmetic sales, selling things like rouge, eye shadow, eye liner, eye cream, body cream, perfumes, concealer, etc. She works out of her home and also door to door.

The goal of this loan is to invest in business capital and stock her business so that in the near future she can make more money. Karla is thankful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to low-resource people and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale like rouge, eye shadow, eye liner, eye cream, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en:
Thùy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 26 years old and  married with two children.

She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thùy has been involved in this business for six years.

The main hardship that Thùy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 46 years old and  married with two  children.

Ninh lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ninh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Ninh has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Ninh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Ninh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her boarding house.

Violeta has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase materiala for the repair of her boarding house

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Mrs  Nam works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Nam is 28 years old and she is married with two children. Nam lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Nam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nam has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nam has been involved in this business for nine years.

The main hardship that Nam faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga works in agriculture farming food.

She is 56 years old and she is married with three children.

She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Nga has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Amelita is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Ngà

texts.en:
Ngà has a retail business selling dry food.

Ngà is 52 years old and she is married with two children.

Ngà lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

Ngà has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Ngà hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10.000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from coconut grinding and pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana lives in Ermera and is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $ 1.200 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a business shop in the center of the market, so many people come to buy it. 

Marciana has been involved in business activities since in 2004. She started with her own working capital of $3000. She is earning a good income from selling shoes so she is still happy to do her business. She is selling clothes. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more goods such as shoes, clothes, bags, and other things to sell. She also has animals like cows, pigs, and dogs

loans.use: To buy trousers, jackets, shirts, long sleeves, short sleeves, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José vive en un recinto de la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es un recinto muy productivo y ganadero, se dan van frutas por temporada y su mayor producción es de plátano de exportación.
José tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa, una hija y su pequeño nieto, quien le da alegría todos los días. Cuenta con una pequeña finca en el sector donde tiene producción de plátano, todos los días en compañía de su esposa sale a dar mantenimiento a los cultivos, resiembra y abona. Gracias a este negocio él ha podido tener lo que ahora tiene, algo pequeño pero vive muy feliz con su familia.
Don José es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, comenta que acudió a Fundación Alternativa por que los créditos que dan son acorde a lo que ellos necesariamente necesitan, ya que fue a un banco y lo querían sobreendeduar, le daban mucho dinero, pero el quería lo necesario. Ahora con este pequeño crédito podrá sembrar dos hectáreas de cacao, ya que desea diversificarse en los productos que ofrece.
Don José se siente muy agradeció ya que la institución escucha y entiende al microempresario, con ello podrá mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Jose lives the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas in the coastal region with a pleasant climate. It's a productive region known for cattle, seasonal fruits, and most of all plantains grown for export. Jose is 54 years old and lives with his wife, one daughter and his young grandson who brings him happiness every day. He has a small farm in the area where he produces plantains. Every day, he and his wife go out to maintain the crops, replant and fertilize. Thanks to this business he has been able to get where he is; while he doesn't have much he lives very happily with his family.

Jose is a hardworking and responsible man, and says he joined Fundacion Alternativa because the loans that they give out are according to what people really need. He went to a bank and they wanted to over-extend his credit - they gave him a lot of money, but he only wanted what he needed. Now with this small loan he will be able to plant two hectares of cacao so that he can diversify the products that he offers. Jose is very grateful that the institution listens and understands the small business, with which he will be able to improve his production.

loans.use: to plant cacao and diversify his crop so that he can be a great small businessman.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: Jose de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hija, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ganado bovino para continuar con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 42-year-old Jose lives in his own house with his mother and his daughter. He has made a living for several years by raising cattle. He sells his products in the areas surrounding the area where he lives. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle so he can continue with his business and thereby have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Yenny Sorlay

texts.es: Yenny, es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su salón de belleza, arte que estudio en una academia con el propósito de dedicarse a esta actividad,  ella ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio y tiene once años en él,  ofreciendo los servicios de tinturación de cabello, blower, cortes de cabello, masajes capilares y todo lo relacionado con el cuidado del cabello.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos del barrio en el que reside en Cartagena de Indias, pero también tiene otros clientes fuera de esta localidad que solicitan de sus servicios por su buena atención y calidad en su mano de obra.  Sus insumos de peluquería los compra a proveedores especializados y sus pagos son en efectivo, pero en ocasiones le brindan facilidad de pago.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará insumos como shampoo, masajes, tintes y otros productos para atender la demanda de clientes la cual incrementa por la temporada que se avecina.  Ella ha tenido que enfrentarse a desafíos en su negocio, sin embargo su meta es incorporar empleados para generar empleo, Yenny desea expandirse a largo plazo ella quiere montar otro salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Yenny is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her beauty salon. She studied the art at an academy with the goal of going into the profession. She has been working in her business for 11 years now, offering services including hair dye, blow outs, hair cuts, head massage, and all types of things related to hair care. Her main customers are people from her neighborhood in Cartagena, but she also has customers outside the area who come to her for her good customer service and the quality of her work.

Yenny buys her salon products at specialized distributors and pays in cash, but occasionally they give her some flexibility of payment. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy things like shampoo, massage oil, hair dye and other products she needs to meet customer demand, which increases during the coming season. She has had to face challenges in her business, but her goal is to generate jobs and employ others. In the long term she wants to expand and open another beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, massage oil, hair dye and other products to meet customer demand which will increase in the coming season.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Iloilo, Philippines. Laila runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for more than two years now.

Laila is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil and condiments, rice, biscuits and snack foods. With a loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.
 
In the future, Laila hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil and condiments, rice, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Cesar Moises

texts.es: Cesar se dedica desde hace varios años ala crianza de pollos de engorde, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes fijos, Cesar vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para poder seguir con la crianza y asi tener menores ingresos.
texts.en: Cesar has made a living for several years by raising broiler chickens. He sells his products at the different markets and he already has regular clients. Cesar lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more chickens and chicken feed so he can continue with his business and thereby have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bread and quesadillas in bulk

loans.name: Ihsan**. Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ihsan**. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Ihsan is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is living with them in their own house, which is very old and needs a lot of renovation. Ihsan's husband is the sole breadwinner with a very limited income which is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of the family and to make the renovation of the house. Ihsan decided to help him with that. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to make the necessary renovation for the house.

Ihsan hopes to complete all the renovation of the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make the necessary renovation for the house.

loans.name: Batchiba

texts.en:
Batchiba is 45 years old and married with five children.

Batchiba is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Batchiba requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Batchiba has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain the business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Martina

texts.es:
Gloria es una señora de 19 años, vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Gloria vive en unión libre con su esposo Ronald, tienen un hijito aun pequeño que pasa con ellos todo el día, juntos viven en casa de un familiar.
Gloria hace un año decidió empezar con su propio negocio, actualmente recorre vendiendo cosméticos, cuenta ya con clientela fija y se siente feliz porque ha crecido poco a poco. Su esposo también trabaja, él da sus servicios como pintor, elabora lindas obras.
Ambos son personas muy jóvenes y trabajadoras, dedicadas a su familia y a su trabajo. Acudieron a la institución para sacar un crédito, con este pequeño crédito ella podrá comprar más perfumes, , se sienten agradecidos por darle las oportunidad de obtener un crédito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria, 19, lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas in the coastal region with a warm, humid climate. It is a very commercial area since it's where the coast meets the mountains. Gloria is married to Ronald and they have a young son who stays home with them all day. They live in the home of a relative.

A year ago, Gloria decided to start her own business. She sells cosmetics to regular customers and is happy because her business has grown little by little. Her husband also works as a painter, making beautiful work. They are both young and hardworking, dedicated to their family and to their jobs. They went to the institution to ask for a loan which Gloria will use to buy more perfumes. They are grateful for the opportunity to get a loan they can use to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more perfume.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Nhung is 54 years old and she is married with two children. Nhung lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhung has been involved in this business for six years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Lerna

texts.en: Lerna is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Lerna is asking for a loan to buy new stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Lerna hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy new stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand and iron, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nohemi Ana

texts.es: Nohemi de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal ella quier me mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografia, pero con lo que gana en sus ventas no le alcanza por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, hierros, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos y seguros.
texts.en: Nohemi, 45, lives in her own house with her husband and four children.  She sells personal care products and wants to improve her home by building a wall around the area shown in the photograph.  But she does not earn enough from sales to cover the cost so she is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, iron and sand, and to pay labor costs.  This will allow her and her family to live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, iron and sand, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es: Jhon un hombre soltero de 38 años de edad, dedicado a la cría de ganado bovino, para las personas que no están relacionadas con el termino son en pocas palabras productos de leche, en la foto están su grandes amores, sus vacas que ama y trata de tenerlas siempre bien cuidadas y por la preocupación que le genera su vacas quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de su alimento en grandes cantidades para tener almacenado para un futuro.
texts.en: Jhon, 38, is single and raises dairy cattle.  In the picture are the cows he adores and cares for.  Because of his concern for his cattle he is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of animal feed to store it for the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena has a second-hand business where many people come to buy every day. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013, and feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day. A 600 USD is offered to improve Milena's business. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, trousers and shorts.

Running a business has made Milena independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers and shorts.

loans.name: Crismen

texts.en:
Crismen is 38 years old and married with three children who are all in school. Crismen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Crismen has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from clothing sales. Crismen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 33 years old, married and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Gina has requested a 3,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed. Gina has been in business for one year now and has borrowed from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Marilyn has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed at times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Amily

texts.en:
Amily is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Iloilo, Philippines. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Amily is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, salt and sugar, coffee and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. This loan will help her improve her stocks, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Amily hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, rice, canned goods, salt and sugar, coffee and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to fix the porch roof of her house.

loans.name: Milo Group

texts.en:
Juma, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. He has been running several projects, a barber shop, M-pesa and Tigo Pesa for two years now. He works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Juma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of building his own house.

Juma will share this loan with his loan group "Milo" which consist of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL ARCA DE NOE ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES  SIETE MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE DIES HIJOS, TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, Y ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO, ESTAS PERSONAS SE CONOCEN ENTRE SI SON DE LA MISMA COMUNIDAD, TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES ES DEYANIRA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO: PANTALONES, SHORT, BLUSAS, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, ROPA INTERIOR, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO, TOALLAS, ETC.  ELLA DEDICA  A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTOS,  LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES RECORRER LAS SU COMUNIDAD CON UN PESO DE UNOS 20 KG OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES Y POR ENCARGO, CON RECUPERACIONES QUINCENALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN MERCADERÍA Y SURTIR DE ROPA EN ESTA TEMPORADA NAVIDEÑA Y PODER LA SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. ARCA DE NOE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A  PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Arca De Noé [Noah's Ark] communal bank is made up of eight members, seven women and a man, who are the mothers and fathers responsible for ten children who are all still young and in school. These people know each other because they are from the same community. They work in different businesses. Unfortunately they were not able to go to school and found themselves needing to work from a young age to help with the costs of the home.

Thanks to their desire to get through, the coordinator of the group is Deyanira who sells new clothing such as: trousers, shorts, blouses, skirts, dresses, underwear, children's clothing, towels, etc.

She works in her business around ten hours a day, selling her products on foot and from the house where she lives, it is a job that she does with much pleasure. Her work routine is to go to the community with a weight of around 20kgs [of clothing], offering her products to her fixed and new customers and on commission, charging fortnightly. The aim of the loan is to stock up on merchandise in this Christmas season and be able to satisfy the needs of her customers and in the near future, she will be able to get a better income.

The Arca De Noé group is thankful for all the help from the Kiva lenders, who support low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a way of getting decent work.

loans.use: stock her business with new clothing: pants, shorts, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Bivolida

texts.en: Bivolida was born in 1970. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. She is the main feed keeper of her children because the money which her husband sends from Russia is not enough to provide the children with all necessary things. Bivolida has her own business deal. She has been busy with farming. Bivolida grows rice and sells in a local market. She manages the business alone and she works hard every day. Bivolida has worked in this field more than 16 years and has great experience. She is going to make a new sowing of rice but she doesn't have money to buy seeds. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy seeds. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds for sowing.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An works in agriculture farming food.

An is 54 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. An has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that An faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Samrong

texts.en:
Samrong (in photo) is 28 years old and lives in the Chroychangva district along the Mekong River. Samrong has been married since 2013 and has no child.

She has been a weaver for 10 years, while her husband does the same work. She would like to apply for a loan to buy silk and sell silk.

She hopes and wants to earn more money and can get much money and then can pay back Maxima.

loans.use: to buy silk and sell silk.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and a sign for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Enelyn Joy

texts.en:
Enelyn Joy works hard to support her family. Enelyn Joy is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Enelyn Joy has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Kenia Sugey

texts.es:
LA SRA. KENIA DE 32 ANOS DE EDAD, MADRE  SOLTERA CON TRES HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DE  NAGAROTE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAÍS, Y SE CARACTERIZA POR SUS COMIDAS  TÍPICA Y SU ARTESANÍA, COMO QUESILLOS, ARTESANÍA DE BARRO FLOREROS,  JARRONES, CENICEROS ETC.  SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADORA, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SACAR  ADELANTE  A SUS HIJOS.
GRACIAS  A SUS GANAS DE SALIR  ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD LA VENTA DE COMIDA CASERA  TODOS LOS DÍAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA VENDE NATACATAMALES  ( ES UNA COMIDA TÓPICA DEL PAÍS) LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA JOVEN MUJER ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS PARA PODER BRINDAR SUS SERVICIOS A SU CLIENTELA FIJA Y EVENTUALES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLE  PARA PREPARAR SUS ALIEMIENTOS COMO; ARROZ, CARNE, POLLO, VERDURAS, ACEITE, JABÓN, PLATOS, VASOS, CONDIMENTOS, SERVILLETAS ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS, Y DE ESA FORMA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES YA QUE ES  UNO DE SUS SUEÑOS FORMAR A SUS HIJOS. KENIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Kenia, 32, is a single mother with three minor children.  She is from Nagarote, which is located in the western part of the country and known for its typical foods, such as quesillos, and its crafts, including clay flower pots, jars, ashtrays, etc.  Kenia is known as a very hard worker with a desire for self development.  She works hard to provide for her children.

Thanks to her determination to get ahead she runs a business selling home-cooked food.  Working from home, every day and on weekends she sells natacatamales (a typical food).  Her routine is to work 12 hours a day to serve both her steady and intermittent customers.

The loan will be used to buy food products such as rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, oil and other supplies such as soap, plates, cups, condiments, knapkins, etc.  This is so she can earn more profit in a not-too-distant future to support her children and give them better opportunities.  One of her dreams is to educate her children.

Kenia is grateful to Kiva lenders who help people with low incomes in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients such as rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, and supplies such as oil, soap, plates, cups, condimentos, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: A woman by the name of Nargiza is very hardworking and smart. She is married and has two children. Her children are adults. Nargiza works hard to earn a living. She has been busy buying and selling flats for five years. Nargiza usually buys flats, repairs them and sells them. In this way she gets income. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy building materials such as paints, wallpaper, etc. to repair a flat and sell it for a more expensive price. She awaits your support and needs your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing a flat

loans.name: Judid

texts.es:
Judid es una modesta, juiciosa,  y colaborativa mujer del campo, básicamente toda su vida se ha dedicado a ayudar a su pareja con los cultivos, y estar en el hogar, pero es una actividad muy monótona en donde no puede lucrarse y es muy dependiente de lo que produzca su esposo es por esta razón y ese sentimiento de independencia que quiere iniciar ella misma su negocio de cría de ganado porcino, una actividad complementaria a la de su esposo pero que le permitirá tener su propio capital.
Con el monto solicitado adecuara ese terreno y esa chaza que se ven en la foto que está en malas condiciones e invertirá la mayor parte del monto en cerdos y así iniciar esperando con éxito su negocio.
texts.en:
Judid is a modest, sensible and collaborative woman who has always helped her partner with their plantations and at home. This is however a monotonous activity where she can't earn money and is very dependent on her husband. Looking for that independence feeling, she wants to start her business of pig breeding, a supplementary activity to that of her husband that would help her to have her own capital. 

She plans to use the loan to prepare the land and the hut on the picture, which are in bad condition. She will use most of the money to purchase pigs and and to start the hopefully successful business.

loans.use: to start her own business of pig breeding, getting everything ready and buying animals.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is a 34-year-old woman living in Agsu. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a master and repairs broken things (furniture, household utensils, etc.). The family is very kind and the parents do everything in order to provide their children with a happy childhood and bright future.

Gunay rents a small shop and sells clothes for men, women and children there. She has worked in this business for 14 years. She loves her job very much and does all her best for her customers.

Gunay's monthly income is 150 AZN and unfortunately this doesn't cover the family's demands. She applied for a 500 AZN loan and will use it to supply new kinds of modern clothes. She plans to vary the assortment in order to increase sales and income. She hopes that this will help her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and vary the assortment of her shop.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina was born in 1994. She is married and has a little child. She is a student of the third course at Tajikistan State University Commerce. Zarrina is learning accounting. She is one of the best students. She tries to get good knowledge and in the future will be a high quality specialist. She is asking for a loan because she must pay for tuition. She is asking for a loan of 600 USD to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Elida,  es una mujer de 60 años, residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, está dedicada a su taller de confecciones, el cual aperturó en el año 1984, es una apasionada de las manualidades, ella disfruta de su trabajo porque es lo que mas le gusta hacer.  Su familia es numerosa tiene en total cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro son mujeres y tan solo un hombre, ella trabaja nueve horas diarias en su taller de lunes a domingo, es una mujer muy dedicada que desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Además de la confección de ropa, también presta servicios de arreglos de vestidos a sus clientes, que en su gran mayoría se encuentran ubicados en el barrio en el que reside, todos los servicios que sus clientes adquieren son cancelados de contado.  Las compras de insumos como hilos, tela, pellón, botones, cremalleras, las realiza en almacenes especializados del centro de contado.  Esta temporada decembrina su producción se ha incrementado por lo que ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de insumos como hilos, tela, pellón, botones, cremalleras, para la entrega de sus pedidos. Esta inversión es muy oportuna, ya que es la temporada del año mas concurrida por sus clientes.  Elida tiene como meta para su negocio mejorar la imagen, así como mantener fuentes para la financiación.
texts.en:
Elida is a 60-year-old woman who resides in a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad. She manages a sewing workshop that she opened in 1984. Elida is passionate about making things by hand and enjoys her work because it is what she likes to do. She has a large family, which includes five children, four daughters and one son. Elida works nine hours a day, Monday through Sunday, at her workshop. She is a devoted woman who wants to have a better quality of life.

In addition to making clothes, Elida also provides mending services to her customers, most of whom live in the same neighborhood as her. All of the services that she provides to her customers are done on a cash basis. She purchases supplies for cash such as thread, fabric, batting, buttons, and zippers from specialty stores located in the central part of town. Her production increases in December, so she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Elida will use this capital to buy supplies such as thread, fabric, batting, buttons, and zippers so that she can deliver her orders. This investment is timely since it is the busiest time of the year for her customers.

Elida’s goal is to improve the image of her business and to maintain her sources of financing.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, batting, buttons, and zippers so that she can complete her orders.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa is 27 years old. She is married and has a child. She has wanted to organize her own business deal for many years and in this way to get ahead in life. She decided to start a business now in animal husbandry. With this aim she took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and got a certificate. Nafisa’s husband will help her managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 6500 Somoni to buy cattle to organize the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle to organize a new business.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende ropa para dama. Inicio el negocio hace 11 años y ha tenido buena acogida en el sector donde opera.

El desea ampliar su oferta de prendas de vestir y mejorar sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser mas prospero y tener un mejor inventario. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de mercancía con la que actualmente no cuenta como ropa de otras marcas y zapatos.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de entidades como Interactuar que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Juan is a man who keeps everything in order so that he can face the world and have a full life, thanks to his efforts. He has a shop where he sells women’s clothes. Juan started this business 11 years ago and it has been well-received in the area where he operates.

He wants to increase his inventory of clothes and improve his sales by injecting capital into his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will give him the opportunity to become prosperous and improve his inventory. The money will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, such as clothing and shoes from brands that he does not carry at the moment.

Juan has great expectations for his business. He believes his future can improve considerably thanks to the support of organizations, such as Interactuar, that make it possible for people to dream of having a better and more stable life.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes from brands that he does not carry at the moment.

loans.name: Pracedes

texts.es: Don Pracedes de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, se dedica  ala crianza de ganado desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Pracedes, 48, lives in his own house with his family.  For several years he has been raising cattle and earning enough to cover household expenses.  The loan he is requesting is to buy more cattle so he can continue his work.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Martin Samuel

texts.es: Marvin se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de platanos vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, Marvin vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito apara la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Marvin has been growing bananas for several years and selling them in neighboring villages.  He lives in his own house with his two children.  The loan he is requesting is to buy ferilizers, insecticides and herbicides, and to improve the land shown in the photograph so he can continue his work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and to improve his land.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Mery, madre dos hijos, preocupada, trabajadora, casera criada bajo los buenos valores de la familia campesina, los bajos ingreso que hay en su cada la llevaron a tomar la decisión de iniciar formalmente su empresa, donde criara ganado porcino, y pollos, dicha actividad la conoce muy bien puesto que desde niña ha estado en este círculo. 
Luz Mery se enfrenta a diferentes adversidades como lo son la fuerte competencia en el sector, las fuertes lluvias, el costo de insumos y por ello es prudente al solicitar un monto con el que pueda realizar adecuaciones a sus cocheras para hacerlos resistente a los clientes, comprar pollos y cerdos y su respectivo cuido para alimentarlos.
texts.en:
This is Luz Mery, the mother of two children who is a concerned, hard-working homemaker who was raised with good family values.  The low income of her household is what made her decide to start her own business raising pigs and chickens.  She is very familiar with the activity because she grew up in this environment.

Luz Mery faces different challenges like the strong competition in the sector, heavy rainfall and the cost of supplies; and therefore, she is being careful to request an amount that will allow her to make her sheds more resistent, and to buy chickens, pigs and animal feed.

loans.use: To start a chicken and pig business, and to fix up a shed and buy animals.

loans.name: Chantheourn

texts.en:
Chantheourn (pictured here) is 43 years old. She lives at Chroychangva district, Phnom Penh Cambodia. She had been married since 1990 and has two daughters. One is married and other one is still young.

Chantheourn is cleaner for private company for two years, while her husband is a steel welder also for two years. She would like to apply for a loan to make the toilet and the floor in her house.

loans.use: to make the toilet and floor in her house.

location.town: Chroy Changva district Phnom Penh city

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 43-year-old married man with four children. The oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old, all of them are students in the school. Mohammed lives with his family in a humble house in Hodiedah city, Yemen. He works as a teacher with a very small salary. In truth, that salary is not enough to cover the necessary expenses of his family. It is very difficult for him to meet the demands of his family, especially since his children are still very small and none of them work.

Mohammed strives strongly to provide his children with a suitable living conditions, but he found himself incapable of providing the same living standards for them. Mohammed didn’t like this situation and decided to find a source of income for himself. He believes that the best thing he can do is to purchase a taxi for him to work as a driver. This taxi will cover some of the necessary expenses of the family. The only problem that faces Mohammed is the capital to buy the taxi, so he applied for a loan of 1,400,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Later, Mohammed looks forward to purchasing a piece of land and building a house on it.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more repair parts for his electrical workshop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. She is a married woman.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.en: Alimardon is a young and successful man. He is 21 years old. Alimardon is married and his wife is a student. She studies at the Medical College. Alimardon is also a student. He studies economics at the Tajikistan State University Commerce. Alimardon studies well and successfully takes part in many university competitions. He must pay for his tuition but he has not money. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Ol (Shown in photo) is 45 years old and lives in the Khsach Kandal district of the Kandal province in Cambodia.

Ol had been married since 1985 with two sons and four daughters. One is a hairdresser and five are attending school.

Ol has been selling desserts for 4 years, while her husband has 20 years experience as a pig farmer. She wants to apply for a loan to buy pigs to raise.

She wants to increase her profit to support her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer, de 24 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de té y café.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Chilluni’ ubicada en cercanías al lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-12 grados centígrados y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Antonia es de tez morena, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, también habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican a la agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es el servicio de té; ella se encarga de servir el desayuno a sus clientes, ofreciéndoles té, café, mates, sultana, leche y otros, acompañado de pan con generalmente con queso o mantequilla. Sus clientes en la mayoría son transportistas que descansan en el lugar y pasajeros que desayunan mientras esperan la próxima salida de los buses. “todo el mundo desayuna aquí, chóferes, pasajeros, visitantes; siempre se les antoja comer algo…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina freidora de pollo, para tener una segunda actividad y vender pollo frito a medio día y por las noches. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Antonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina freidora de pollo para vender pollo frito en el almuerzo y la cena.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 24-year-old woman who is single and has no children. Her business involves serving tea and coffee. Antonia is independent, enterprising, steadfast, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business in the community of Chilluni, which is located near the sacred lake of Titicaca. The weather is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 2 and 12 degrees centigrade. This area is at an altitude of 3,800 meters above sea level.

Antonia has a dark complexion and short stature. Her attire is traditional, which includes a hat, shawl, and native skirt. Antonia’s first language is Aymará, which is spoken locally, but she also speaks Spanish so that she can integrate into the general culture and conduct business. She lives at home with her parents, who work in agriculture. They have an adobe house that has running water and electricity. Her business is a tea service where she also serves breakfast to her customers. She offers tea, coffee, “mate” (a warm herbal beverage), “sultana” (tea made from dried coffee berries), milk, and other beverages. The beverages are generally served with bread and either cheese or butter. Her customers are mostly drivers who need a place to rest and passengers who have breakfast while they are waiting for their buses to depart. “Everyone has breakfast here – drivers, passengers, visitors; they always feel like eating something,” says Antonia.

Her dream is to expand her business and open a restaurant. She wants to accomplish this by purchasing a chicken fryer so that she can have a second business of selling fried chicken at lunchtime and in the evenings. Antonia has participated in three loan cycles with Emprender and has been in business for three years.

For the reasons mentioned, Antonia is requesting a loan in order to buy a chicken fryer. This will allow her to sell fried chicken for lunch and dinner.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer so that she can sell fried chicken for lunch and dinner.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Rosela works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rosela is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Rosela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ismael Arnulfo

texts.es: Ismael de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografia pero con lo que obtiene e de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, hierro, arena, laminas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos.
texts.en: Ismael is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their 2 children. He works as a pick-up driver and he wishes to carry out improvement works on his home by building a new room in the space which can be seen in the photo. He is unable to achieve this aim with only the wage that he earns as a driver so, consequently, he is applying for a loan to buy cement, bricks, iron rods, sand and corrugated sheeting as well as to pay for the labour costs so that he and his family can live in greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron rods, sand, corrugated sheeting and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is the careful mother of three children. She dreams of seeing her children become well-educated people. With this aim, she is going to start a new business and pay for the educational expenses of her children. Muborak is going to start an animal husbandry business because she lives in a village and has good conditions for feeding cattle. 

With her aim in mind, Muborak took part in a course "To Get Ahead" through a women's organization, and got a certificate. She will manage her business alone. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Muborak is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy cattle to establish her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to establish her new business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 17, 7 y 5 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan casero.
Ella es sensible, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada por ser el barrio más poblado de la ciudad, y por el comercio que realizan los descendientes de inmigrantes de etnias del lugar como los ‘Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados de occidente, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Roxana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún se encuentra a su cuidado, su casa está construida de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan casero, como; Mollete - Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca, Pan de Arroz – pan con harina de arroz, Pan dulce - Cuya preparación se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar, Rosca de maíz – a base de harina de maíz, Tortilla - Es la masa de pan, que primeramente se aplana, se espolvorea con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente en un cuarto habilitado para hornear en su casa. "la necesidad de tener mi negocio propio me llevó a abrir mi panadería, esto me deja tiempo libre para ocuparme de mis hijos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una panadería grnade en un lugar céntrico.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de materiales de panadería, como; Cuchara plástica, Bowls de acero inoxidable, Raspador de masa, Balanza de precisión y variedades de harinas por quintal. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de panadería y variedades de harinas por quintal.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 33-year-old woman. She is single and has has three children who are 17, 7, and 5 years old. She has a business making and selling homemade bread. She is sensitive, sincere, generous, understanding, responsible and hardworking. Her business is in the "Plan 3000" area, known for being the most populated neighbourhood of the city. It is also known for commerce, conducted by the descendants of immigrants from different ethnic groups of the region such as the "Ayoreos" and miners who relocated from the east. It has a warm, tropical and humid climate with a constant temperature of 30 degrees centigrade throughout the year. 

Roxana is of short stature and has a dark complexion. She keeps her long black hair tied back. Her first language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business activities. She lives in her parents home with her children. The eldest two children go to school and the youngest still stays home. She lives in a brick home and they have potable water, electricity and sewerage.

Roxana's business is making and selling homemade breads, including "mollete" (an everyday bread made with flour, granulated sugar and butter), rice bread (bread made with rice flour), sweet bread (one uses raisins, eggs, milk and sugar to prepare it), corn doughnuts (made with corn), tortilla (this is bread dough which is rolled out, sprinkled with sugar and flour, then folded, and the process is repeated many times, yielding a sort of puff pastry after baking). Roxana makes the bread in a specially-equipped room for baking at her home. "The need to have my own business led me to open my bakery, which leaves me with free time to look after my children," says Roxana. Her dream is to have a large bakery in a central location. 

Roxana wants to expand her business by purchasing materials for it such as plastic spoons, stainless steel bowls, a dough scraper, and a precision scale. She will also buy a variety of flours by quintals. This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the five years that she has been doing this activity. It is for these reasons that Roxana is requesting a loan to purchase bread making supplies and quintals of different flours.

loans.use: to purchase materials for bread-making and different varieties of flour by quintals.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 23-year-old single lady from a village near the city of Jenin. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her mother works as a teacher in a public school, where she earns a low income. This is the family's only source of income. 

Sarah is a student at a local university where she studies accounting. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to improve her family's living conditions.

Sarah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Sarah will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

Sarah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 3, 5 y 12 años de edad que son su mayor alegría y la razón de su esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de productos básicos el cual realiza en su vivienda, además vende pupusas de queso con loroco, chicharrón con queso, queso con frijoles, de mora y ayote entre otras las que elabora desde hace 3 años en su vivienda. Yesenia siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia ha decidido construir una galera en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para construir una galera en su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo recibido en el pasado para la mejora de su cocina.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 18 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their 3 sons who are 3, 5 and 12. They are her source of happiness and her motivation to work hard. 

She is a hard-working woman who makes a living selling basic groceries from her house. For the past 3 years she has also been preparing and selling maize tortillas with a variety of fillings such as: cheese and loroco (a vine flower bud), fried pork rind and cheese, cheese and beans, blackberry and squash and various others.

Yesenia always wants the best for her family and she has decided to build a galley in her house which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: corrugated iron, wood and nails. 

She is thankful for the support she previously received to improve her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron, wood and nails to build a galley in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to spend partially for his family's use and to maintain his car in preparation for the winter

loans.name: Edenilson Adonay

texts.es: Edenilson de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un panaderia ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y repellando las paredes, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de laminas, cemento, arena, polines y pago de mano de obra para poder vivir mas comodos y seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
Edenilson is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. For several years now, he has had a bakery located inside his place of residence.

He wants to change the roof and plaster the walls of his house to make it a more comfortable and safer place for his family to live in. That is why he is requesting a loan of INTEGRAL. He will use it to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand and poles and also to pay the workers.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand and poles and also to pay the workers

loans.name: Leodisa

texts.en:
Leodisa is a 41-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leodisa has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her seaweed plantation.

Leodisa has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her seaweed plantation

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 43 years old. She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, candies, detergent, soap, noodles, etc. She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 2 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, soft-drinks, beers, candies, detergent, soap, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a married woman with three children. She is 52 years old and all of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gleceria has a coco lumber "buy and sell" business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coco lumber to sell.

Gleceria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Six of her kids are still aged 4-18 and need her support. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for eight years now. They usually fish in a manner that is locally called "bobo fishing" (with the use of a small and rounded fish cage). They also farm seaweeds. This is the source of their income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan from CEVI, a microfinance partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to buy seaweed seedlings and a bobo (fish cage). This will enable her and her husband to improve their business and income. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. She also wants to save enough money for the school expenses of her child.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and a bobo (fish cage)

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy more meat, fish and other products needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she will be able to improve her business even more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to purchase additional processed meat products like embutido (enchido) and longganisa, which she also sells. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Lilia wants her children to be able to finish their studies and to acquire right-fit jobs someday. She meets every week with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional processed meat products like embutido, longganisa and more.

loans.name: Miguel  Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel  radica en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, zona cálida húmeda y conocida en el país por la etnia Tsachila que habita en el sector.  Con 55 años, él  vive con su esposa, sus dos hijas y una sobrina que la ha criado desde pequeña, todas se encuentran estudiando. Son una familia humilde, sencilla y muy trabajadora, todas apoyan en el hogar.
Don Miguel desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a la cerrajería, poco a poco ha podido adquirir su maquinaria necesaria para su negocio, cuenta con un ayudante a quien también le está enseñando para que algún momento él pueda también ponerse su negocio. Don Miguel trabaja todos los días, es muy dedicado a su trabajo, realiza puertas, ventanas, escaleras, protectores en hierro, muy conocido por sus buenos trabajos.
Cuenta con un terreno y una pequeña casa de madera, por ello acudió a la Fundación para acceder a un crédito y con ello hacer el cerramiento de su casa, pudo sacar el dinero necesario para hacer posible lo que necesitaba, se siente muy feliz por el apoyo de la institución. Comenta que siempre va a trabajar con la Fundación.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel settled in Santo Domingo del los Colorados, a hot and humid area well-known around the country for the Tsachila ethnic group who live there. He is 55 and lives with his wife, their two daughters and a niece who they have brought up since she was little. The three girls are all students. They are a humble, modest and hard-working family and everyone helps out at home.  

For more than 15 years, Don Miguel have been making a living as a locksmith and little by little he has been able to acquire the necessary machinery for his business. He has an assistant who he is teaching so that one day he can also set up his own business. 

Don Miguel works every day and is very dedicated to his work. He makes doors, windows, stairs, metal protectors and is very well-known for doing a good job. 

He has some land and a small wooden house and he turned to the Foundation to access a loan so he can finish the roof of his house. He was able to get enough money to make this possible and he feels very happy to be supported by the institution. He says that he is always going to work with the Foundation.

loans.use: to finish the roof of his house and develop his locksmith's business.

loans.name: Vireak

texts.en:
Vireak (pictured) is 41 years old. He lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal Province, Cambodia. He has been married since 1992, has three sons and three daughters. One is married, two are attending school, others are still young.

Vireak is a farmer and has experience of being a construction worker for 5 years. His wife is a cleaner at a factory and has been doing this for 6 months.

He is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to go to work.

loans.name: Ateyeh

texts.en:
Ateyeh is a 19-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His mother works as an employee in a local firm with a low income. Ateyeh is a student in a local university where he studies computer engineering. He want to complete his studies and find a job to improve his family's living conditions.

Ateyeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ateyeh will be able to do his home work and write the reports easily.

Ateyeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Djiguifa 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  Djiguifa 4 sont tous mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Pala, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et tomate avec Sidiki, arrêté 2ème de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguifa 4 group are all married, average 32 years of age with two children each and live in traditional families in Pala, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their market-gardening activities successfully, and they are on their second loan.

Sidiki, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows shallots and tomatoes. With his loan he is planning to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to farm his 0.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a diverse customer base. He expects to make an average profit of 150,000FCFA at the end of the season, and this profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs and equipment.

loans.name: Arjwan Al- Safia Group

texts.en:
Arjwan Al-Safia is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Jamila is the leader of the group. She is a 29-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in an old house which lacks of a lot of home appliances and furniture. Her husband is an employee with a small salary which is not enough to make the necessary improvements to the house. 

Jamila decided to help him in that responsibility but she doesn't have money. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to furnish the house.

She looks forward to opening a saving account in a bank to help him to renovate the house.

loans.use: To furnish her house.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 7 years, two of them go to school. She has been farming for 8 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her workers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize to resell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old. He is married to Leah and together they have been blessed with 5 children aged between 16 and 7 years respectively. Leah is a farmer, hence provides additional income for her family.

Joseph is a farmer as well, a business he has done for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Joseph has requested for his 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 70,000 which he will use to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and pay his laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Joseph will be able to buy more land as well as educate his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in everything he does.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seedlings and pay laborers.

loans.name: Gnogodemeton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Gnogodemeton 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Mina, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et tomate avec Diara, assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Gnogodemeton 1 group are all married women, who average 35 years of age with three children each and live in traditional families in Mina, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their market gardening activities successfully, and they are on their second loan.

Diara, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, grows shallots and tomatoes. With her loan she is planning to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to farm her 0.5 hectares plot of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average profit of 140,000FCFA at the end of the season, and this profit will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs and equipment.

loans.name: Gnogodemeton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Gnogodemeton 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Mina, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et tomate avec Chata, assise 2ème de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Gnogodemeton 2 group are all married women, who average 40 years of age with four children each and live in traditional families in Mina, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their market gardening activities successfully, and they are on their second loan.

Chata, who is sitting second from the left in the photo, grows shallots and tomatoes. With her loan she is planning to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to farm her 0.5 hectares plot of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average profit of 170,000FCFA at the end of the season, and this profit will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs and equipment.

loans.name: Soleil A Group

texts.fr: Mahoro est commerçante, trésorière de la banque communautaire Soleil A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 44 ans, mère de 4 enfants et  tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son salaire quand elle travaillait. Elle est vendeuse des friperies  dans un magasin du quartier de la ville depuis 19 ans. Elle va acheter des ballons de cartables, sacs à main, valises etc. Son conjoint est un nutritionniste. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mahoro is a businesswoman and treasurer of the Soleil A community bank. A customer of IMF Hekima, she is 44 years old, married and mother to four children, all of whom attend school. She began her business with funds from the salary she earned when she was working.
