She has been selling second hand goods in a shop in one of the town's districts for the past 19 years and she is going to buy bales of satchels, handbags, cases, etc. Her husband is a nutritionist. She would like to be able to get more loans, build a house and educate and feed her children. Finally she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy bundles of satchels, handbags, suitcases, etc.

loans.name: Gnogodemeton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  Gnogodemeton 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Mina, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote et tomate avec Karia, assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Gnogodemeton 3 group are all married women, who average 35 years of age with three children each and live in traditional families in Mina, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their market gardening activities successfully, and they are on their second loan.

Karia, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, grows shallots and tomatoes. With her loan she is planning to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to farm her 0.25 hectares plot of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a diverse customer base. She expects to make an average profit of 95,000FCFA at the end of the season, and this profit will enable her to repay her loan and cover her daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs and equipment.

loans.name: Gnogodemeton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  Gnogodemeton 4 sont tous mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Mina, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de maraîchage. Ils sont à leur 2ème  prêt. 
La spéculation cultivée est  l’échalote avec Brama, arrêté au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des Semences, intrants et matériels en vu d’exploiter sa partielle de 0, 5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000FCFA en fin de période.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Gnogodemeton 4 group are all married, averaging 45 years of age with six children each and living in traditional families in Mina, one of the villages in Koutiala, Mali's third administrative region. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can run their market gardening activities successfully, and they are on their second loan.

Brama, who is standing in the middle of the photo, grows shallots. With his loan he is planning to buy seeds, inputs and equipment to farm his 0.5 hectares plot of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a diverse customer base. He expects to make an average profit of 170,000FCFA at the end of the season, and this profit will enable him to repay his loan and cover his daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, inputs and equipment.

loans.name: Soleil B Group

texts.fr: Mupenda est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Soleil B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 7 enfants  dont 6 vont à l’école et 1 est déjà marié. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers et matelas  au marché secondaire de la ville depuis 31 ans. Elle va acheter 120 paires de souliers et 2 matelas. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Elle souhaite obtenir plus de crédits, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mupenda is a businesswoman and president of the Soleil B community bank. A customer of Hekima, she is 48 years old, married and mother to seven children, six of whom go to school while one is already married. She began her business with funds from her husband and she has been selling shoes and mattresses in the town's secondary market for the past 31 years. She is going to buy 120 pairs of shoes and two mattresses. Her husband is a driver. She would like to get more loans, be able to build a house and educate and feed her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who cannot access bank funding.

loans.use: to buy 120 pairs of shoes and two mattresses.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is a twenty-year-old university student. He is a second-year student studying agriculture. He lives in Battambang province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers and they earn an additional income from selling Khmer noodles at a market. Beside this, they also set traps to catch crickets to sell.

Phea is hard working and always spends his free time helping his parents. He would like to request a loan because he does not have enough finances to pay all three years of his university fees. This loan will help him graduate successfully. After graduation, Phea hopes to have a proper job and then he will be able to save enough money to renovate his house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Vandy

texts.en:
Vandy (photo here) is forty-five years old and lives at Khsach kandal district Kandal province, Cambodia. He had been married since 1993 and has two sons and four daughters. They all attend school.

He has been working in a fishery for twenty years. His wife is a housewife. He would like to apply for a loan to make a toilet. He says that his existing toilet is not good and he wants to replace it, to improve the comfort and good health of his family.

loans.use: To make a toilet.

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KANOU ont en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KANOU sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. DJENEBA, 1ère femme assise à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Kgs d’oignon, 30Kgs de beure de karité,25Kgs de Sel et 5 paquets de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Kanou group average 41 years of age with six children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family links, and have small businesses buying and selling cereals and condiments. The women of the Kanou group are on their seventh group loan, having repaid all their previous loans in full.

Djeneba, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 50 kilos of onions, 30 kilos of shea butter, 25 kilos of salt and five packets of Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and sells to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will be used to cover health expenses, buy food and clothing and pay school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay (pictured) is 45 years old, and lives at Angsnoul district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He had been married since 1980, and has one son and one daughter. One is married, and other one is attending school.

Lay has been selling ice-cream, and has 10 years of experience, while his wife has been a farmer for 10 years. 

He would like to apply for a loan to buy a cow to raise. He hopes that next year he will get other one cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud has a motorcycle transport business, and has been in the business for three years now. He is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to service his motorcycle by buying new spare parts, and ensuring that the motorcycle is in good condition. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in future he hopes to have a prosperous business and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 60 years. She is married to Joseph, and together they have been blessed with five children of ages between 39 and 2 years.

She is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 10 years.

Eva has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 50,000, which she will use as working capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay her laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Eva will be able to buy more land for farming, and plots to build houses.

Her hope and dream for the future is to keep on upgrading her living standards.

loans.use: as working capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a twenty-one-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as a construction worker where he earns a low and unstable income due to the low demand in the winter. Taha is a student in a local university where he studies Health management. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve his family's living conditions.

Taha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Taha will be able to do his homework and write reports more easily. 

Taha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola has a maize mill business in Kapsabet town, and has been running this business for three years. She is 27 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of maize and wheat for use in her business. This will enable her to sell more maize and wheat flour. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to have a successful business, and be able to educate her children and provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize cereals for use in her business.

loans.name: Iidephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is 27 years old.  He is married without children. He is a farmer, and has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize, and then sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize and then sell maize.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 32, is a brilliant and resilient smallholder mixed-farmer from Siongiroi, located in the Rift valley of Kenya. Even in young age, he is still the caring family man who is committed to his loving wife. For the past five years, the couple's primary income sources have been milk, eggs, crops and transportation services. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase a high-yielding dairy cow. The cow he wants may be pricier than dominant breeds, but he will get real value for his money when it comes to milk production. 

Joseph will also be able to get more cow dung for manure and fuel. With your loan, he will kill two birds with one stone: increased milk production and reduced costs. This will greatly boost his profit margin and thus his income. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Joseph replied, "My family will get food and more income and thus better living”

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 34 years old. He is married with three children, aged between 2 and 7 years. One of them goes to school. 

He has farmed for 11 years, and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase amount of retail items as accessories, perfumes, and incense

loans.name: Naden Group

texts.en:
This group is called Naden. It consists of five women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Halima is the leader of the group. She is a fifty-five-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She lives with them in their own house in Sana'a. Her husband is an immigrant worker outside of the country. He sends a small amount of money to his family in Yemen every month. It is not enough to cover the needs of the family. This negatively effects the living conditions of their home. Halima's house lacks food and makes all the family members feel inconvenienced. Halima doesn't have enough money to improve the living conditions of her family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase food materials as sugar, flour, salt and other materials to cover the necessary needs of the family.

In future, Halima hopes to build a second floor and rent it for a monthly salary.

loans.use: To purchase food materials such as sugar, flour and salt

loans.name: Wathu Group

texts.en:
Fatima is 27 years old and married to a bus driver. She has four children and looks after two orphans.  Fatima has a farm on which she grows Irish potatoes and cabbage. She depends on this farm produce as her main source of income. This business helps her to find funds for supporting her family by providing her children with basic needs, and paying their school fees. 

She will use the loan to expand her business, as she wants to buy more land, fertilizer, and a water canes. 

She plans on building a better house for her children, and hopes of having enough food throughout the year. Accessing loans have helped her to become self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 38 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SORON/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, du lait, du charbon de bois, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. MOLOBALY,  femme assise au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15Kgs d’oignon, 10Kgs de sel, 1 paquet de Cube Maggi, 10Litres d’huile, 10Kgs d’igname, 40Kgs de riz, 30Kgs de mil, 10Kgs de fonio, 20Kgs de patate douce et 2Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Benkadi group average 38 years of age with three children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Soron/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family links, and have small businesses buying and selling milk, charcoal, cereals, condiments and a variety of other products. The women of the Benkadi group are on their third group loan, having repaid their previous loans in full.

Molobaly, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 15 kilos of onions, 10 kilos of salt, a packet of Maggi stock cubes, 10 liters of oil, 10 kilos of yams, 40 kilos of rice, 30 kilos of millet, 10 kilos of fonio, 20 kilos of sweet potatoes and two kilos of chili peppers. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers and sells to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which will be used to cover health expenses, buy food and clothing and pay school fees; the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza was born in 1983 year. She is divorced, and has two children. Gulnoza always tries to earn a living because she is the only feed keeper for her children. 

Gulnoza is going to start a new business with animal husbandry, and in this way earn a living. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a woman's organization, and got a certificate. 

Gulnoza is asking for a loan of 15,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing a new business. 

She awaits your mercy, and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
HALIMA, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with three children; two of them are still in school and the other one is grown-up.  She has been running a gengeduka for seven years.  She works from 06am to 10pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be HALIMA's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy Irish potatoes, started a duka, and increase the genge stock.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, a TV set, a deck, a radio, a mattress and a bed, sofa set, and covered household expenses.  She is happy with the loan, and appreciates Kiva for their support.  

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her gengeduka. She dreams of taking her kids to good schools.  

HALIMA will share this loan with her loan group, "Kulangwa", which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her gengeduka.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.en:
Appolinaire is 30 years old. He is married with one child who is two years old. He has farmed for eight years, and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer to grow maize and then to sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize and then to sell maize.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 26 years. She is married to Paul, and together they have been blessed with children of ages between 6 and 3 years. Paul is a farmer, hence provides additional income for his family.

Ann is a farmer as well, a business she has done for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Ann has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 25,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings, and to pay her laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Ann will be able to buy plots of land as well as educate her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to prosper in everything she does.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Audard

texts.en:
Audard is 29 years old. He is married with one child who is one year old. He has farmed for 10 years, and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 69 years. He is married to Margaret, and together they have been blessed with five children who are all adults.

John is a tomato farmer, a business he has done for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

John has requested his firsst loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 50,000, which he will use to buy chemicals and sprays for his planted tomatoes.

With the anticipated profits, John will be able to repay his loan.

His hope and dream for the future is to be stress free with regard to business growth.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and sprays for tomatoes

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu applied for a first loan which was given by Kiva lenders to purchase some of the necessary spare parts for his taxi. He is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan, which helped him much in improving the work on the taxi after he purchased some of spare parts for it. 

In truth, Abdu hasn't yet completely returned the first loan, but is applying for a concuurent loan of 150,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase other spare parts to repair the taxi to let it work better. 

Abdu hopes this loan will be funded well.

loans.use: To purchase other spare parts to repair the taxi to let it work better

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a thirty-one-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and one small son in a small and simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Ali is also a student in a local university where he studies Business Administration. He want to complete his studies and find a better job to improve his family's living conditions.

Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fee installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to complete his studies faster and improve himself.

Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 25-year-old married lady from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a small, simple house. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Fidaa is a student in a local university, where she studies Business Administration. She want to complete her studies and find a job to improve her family living conditions.

Fidaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Fidaa will be able to do her home works and write the reports easily.

Fidaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en: Dorn is twenty-six years old and he is in his fourth year studying Marketing at university in a province of Cambodia. Dom's father is a construction worker and his mother is a rice farmer. Dorn lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Besides being a student, he also works as a customer service officer in a bank, making 5 USD per day. Now he would like to request a loan to pay his fourth-year tuition fees. This loan will help him earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. In future, Dorn is going to apply for another better position with decent salary in the bank so he will be able to help his family.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the costs of the pump maintenance.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is forty years old. He is married to Teresia and together they have been blessed with four children aged between four and fourteen years.Teresia is a farmer and provides additional income for her family.

Peter is a farmer as well, a business he has done for the last sixteen years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Peter has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of 70,000 KES, which he will use as working capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and to pay his laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Peter will be able to buy a plot of land as well as educate his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in life and business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and to pay his laborers.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is a forty-three-year-old married man with four children aged between three and fifteen. Two of his children attend school. He has farmed for fifteen years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize, which he will then sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizer

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is thirty-six years old and a single mother of three children. She is a dairy farmer in Kapsabet town and has been in the dairy farming business for three years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy dairy feed for her cows. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to educate her children, support her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed

loans.name: John

texts.en:
As a father to four children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills John with enthusiasm and inspiration. John is forty years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, he aspires to offer all of his children a university education. 

John learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to his parents. He has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support his family. John has developed the farm in the sloping, undulating terrain by successfully adopting suitable soil and water conservation methods such as stone pitched bench terracing and digging rain water storage pits. For over five years, his income source has been from selling milk, poultry, and vegetables. He supplements the meager income by doing other personal business. 

John passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village. Milk, poultry and vegetables are very perishable, and these products require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. 

Eldoret area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why John is kindly seeking a loan to buy another motorbike. Farmers like John will use the motorbike to transport passengers and farm goods to and from the market. They are suited for areas with poor road networks which are inaccessible by cars. They are also very cheap to acquire and maintain. John is full of hope.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Veronique

texts.en:
Veronique is twenty-four years old. She is married with one child who is seven months old. She has farmed for six years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize, which she will then sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her workers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her assets and purchase rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Kavugo Group

texts.fr:
J. Paul fait partie du groupe  Kavugo et  habite à  Cibitoke. Ila 29 ans et est marié à Francine ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 7mois à 3 ans. 

Il fait le commerce de  bière de bananes  depuis  5 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière à vendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une maison pour le commerce,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en: J. Paul is a member of the Kavugo group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 29 years old and married to Francine, a farmer. Together, they have two children ages 7 months and 3 years old. He has been invovled in the sale of beer made from bananas for the past 5 years. He is asking for his first loan from Turame. He plans to use the loan to increase his assets by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to turn into beer, in order to earn more income. In the coming years, he hopes to purchase a home and watch his students attend school.

loans.use: increase his assets by purchasing a large quantity of bananas to turn into beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: electric wire, a control box, power outlets, etc. in order to install electrical power in his house.

loans.name: Diego Alexander

texts.es:
Diego vive felizmente junto con su familia en zona rural del municipio de Bello.

En la actualidad ya cumplió 2 años de estar trabajando con la cría de cerdos de engorde, actividad con la que ha intentado sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia para que nunca les falte nada. 

Ha tenido dificultades económicas que han afectado su negocio y que lo han obligado a detener sus actividades en ciertas ocasiones. 

Sueña con mejorar el lugar para la cría de sus animales y también con tener una planta de engorde de cerdos, por esto pasa la solicitud de un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra cerdos de engorde los cuales tienen muy buena aceptación por la buena crianza y mantenimiento de los mismos. 

Su calidad de vida  y la de su familia se incrementará en la medida que aumentan las ventas de sus animales y alcance las metas establecidas para  un futuro no lejano.

Con el apoyo de este préstamo Diego podrá continuar trabajando y podrá darle a su familia todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Diego lives happily with his family in a rural zone of Bello municipality.

He currently has 2 years of experience working raising pigs to fatten, work with which he has tried to survive and get his family ahead so that they never lack anything.

He has had economic difficulties which have affected his business, and have forced him to stop his work at times. 

He dreams of improving the place were he raises his animals and also to have a fattening plant for the pigs. For this reason he submits the loan request, which he will invest in purchasing pigs to fatten, which have a good reputation for good raising and caring for themselves.

His quality of life and that of his family will improve as his animal sales increase and he can achieve his established goals in a not-so-distant future.

With the help of this loan, Diego will be able to continue working and will be able to give his family everything better.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y reside con una hija en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Hace 9 años decidió poner su propio negocio para obtener ingresos. ella vende churros, dulces, galletas, refrescos, pan, azúcar y otros de la canasta básica. Ha mantenido este pequeño negocio con la inversión de dos prestamos solicitados anteriormente, mas el actual que es por 11,000 lempiras que va invertir en la compra de productos como pan, churros, refrescos, dulces, galletas y otros, su objetivo es aumentar el inventario y sus ingresos. Piensa en ampliar su negocio, crecer como comerciante y mejorar su nivel de vida con la familia.
texts.en: María, 62, is a single mother with three children. She lives with one daughter in a village of the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Nine years ago, she decided to start her own business to earn an income. She sells churros, sweets, cookies, soft drinks, bread, sugar, and other basic items. She has maintained this small business with the investment of two previous loans. She will invest this current loan of 11,000 Honduran lempiras in the purchase of products such as bread, churros, soft drinks, sweets, cookies, and other items. Her goal is to increase her inventory and her earnings. She is planning to expand her business, grow as a merchant, and improve her standard of living along with her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with products such as bread, churros, soft drinks, sweets, cookies and other items to sell.

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Monica tiene 31 años de edad tiene 5 hijos, vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar con sus hijos, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Solicita el credito invertir en la compra de mercaderia de ropa ya que viene las festividades Navideñas y el negocio aumenta, Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos ya que es ella sola la que mantiene su hogar y mecesitan para el diario vivir. La compras realiza en Guayaquil y Quito ya que compra a los distribuidores para venderles a los clientes en un precio razonable y ganar un poco mas y asi aumentar su negocio.
En su tiempo libre le gusta pasear con sus hijos y trabajar mucho.
texts.en:
Monica is 31 years old, has 5 children, lives in Guaranda, Bolivar province, with her children, and belongs to the rural service Cooperative Mujeres Emprendedoras [Enterprising Women's Cooperative].

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of clothing since the Christmas holidays approach and her business increases. Her dream is to improve her children's quality of life since she alone sustains the household and their daily needs. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and Quito since she purchases from distributors to sell them to customers at a reasonable price and to earn a bit more and in this way expand her business.

In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children and work a lot.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise for plus-size women.

loans.name: Angela Constanza

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de almacén de variedades

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerá su esposo y su futuro hijo a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar una vitrina, estanterías y surtido de productos como ropa para bebe, pañales y productos.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Angela is a very enterprising and creative woman. For a long time, she has wanted to be independent and have her own business of a general store. 

She currently is able to make her dream come true thanks to her great capacity for work, to the support that she gets from the Interactuar corporation and the people who want her to get ahead with her business. 

Depending on this business will be her husband and future child, to whom she wants to teach the business and leave them an inheritance.  

She asks for a loan to purchase a display case, shelves and an assortment of products such as baby clothing, diapers and other products. 

With a loan you will be able to support a woman full of life and drive for her family!

loans.use: to purchase a display case, shelves, and an assortment of products such as baby clothing, diapers and other products.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 70 years old. He is married to Nancy, and together they have been blessed with children who are now all adults. Nancy is a farmer, and so she provides additional income for her family.

Eliud is a farmer as well, a business he has done for the last 40 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Eliud has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. He has requested 50,000 KES to use as working capital to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and to pay his laborers

With the anticipated profits, Eliud will be able to buy a plot of land.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and to pay his laborers.

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Carina es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 9 años y un bebe de 11 meses, y su negocio es la venta de refrescos gaseosas.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en ferias de la localidad del Torno de clima cálido con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 15 y 35 grados centígrados.
Carina es de tez morena, cabello negro, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español por el comercio (sentada en medio con su bebe en brazos con quien todos los días va a su venta), Vive en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Sus deseos de superación la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tapizado de vehículos, venta de zomo, venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de empanadas, venta de jugos, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ganado, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos gaseosas frías Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana y recorre las diferentes ferias de la localidad. “aprendí este negocio  muy niña porque le ayudaba a mi mamá, luego me independicé y actualmente tengo muchos clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Ella desea surtir su negocio mediante la compra de refrescos por mayor. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carina solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir sus productos.
texts.en:
Carina is 28 years old and married. She has two children, a nine-year-old and an eleven-month-old baby. She has a business selling soft drinks. She is a good mother and a generous, understanding, responsible, hardworking woman. She sells her products as a traveling saleswoman at markets in the area of Torno, which has a warm climate and a temperature which varies during the day between 15 and 35 degrees Celsius. 

Carina has tan skin and black hair. Her native language is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish for business. She is seated in the middle of the group with her baby in her arms, who goes with her to sell products every day. She lives in a rented house with running water, electricity, a sewage system and gas. Her desire to succeed led her to form a group of people with businesses such as vehicle upholstery, juice sales, cell phone cover sales, empanada sales, perfume sales, soft drinks sales, and livestock sales, to apply for a loan and expand their businesses. 

She works in her business selling cold soft drinks every day of the week, traveling to various markets in the area. She says, "I learned about this business as a very young girl because I helped my mother. Later, I became independent and now I have many clients." Her dream is to have her own house. She hopes to stock her business by buying wholesale soft drinks. This is her first loan with the institution in the eight years that she has had this business. For these reasons, Carina is applying for a loan to buy a variety of wholesale soft drinks to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel  reside en el municipio de Soledad, ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico, ella tiene 59 años de edad y se ha dedicado por más de 15 años a la modistería y el comercio, actividad que heredó de una tía quien fue la que la  impulso a continuar con este oficio.  Actualmente ella confecciona ropa por encargos, así mismo vende zapatos, bolsos, ropa, cosméticos, artículos para el hogar, y variedades.  Ella cuenta con una clientela fidelizada, quienes le han solicitado encargos de artículos, sin embargo esta necesitando inyectarle capital a su negocio, para lograr cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, es así como está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará mercancías varias según pedidos de sus clientes como ropa calzado, cosméticos, perfumes y detalles de ocasión. Ella ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes y sus compras las realiza de contado a almacenes ubicados en el centro.  Isabel es viuda, tiene cuatro hijas y un hijo,  ella trabaja ocho horas diarias, y su gran desafío es incrementar el escaso capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, su meta es continuar trabajando para mejorar los ingresos y con ello su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isabel lives in the municipality of Soledad in the Atlantic department. She is 59 years old and has worked for more than 15 years as a seamstress and in business, work she inherited from an aunt who was the one who pushed her to continue with this trade. Currently she makes clothing to order, and she also sells shoes, bags, clothing, cosmetics, household goods, and other things. She has a loyal customer base, who have ordered articles, however, she needs to inject some capital into her business to be able to meet her customers' needs. So she is applying for her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a variety of merchandise according to her customers' orders such as footwear, cosmetics, perfumes and decorations for special occasions.  She offers ease of payment to her customers and makes her purchases in cash at stores located in the city. Isabel is a widow, she has four daughters and a son, she works eight hours a day and her greatest challenge is to increase the scarce working capital that she has. Her goal is to improve her income and, with this, her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise according to the customers' orders such as footwear, cosmetics, perfumes and decorations for special occasions.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 13 years, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her workers.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Valeria Maritza

texts.es:
Valeria tiene 28 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de 7 años y vive con ellos  en el canton echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Ella es consultora Yambal y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos solicita el credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para vender y ampliar el negocio. Realiza las compras en Riobamba cada 15 dias. 
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio para asi aportar mas a su familia, su desafio es alcanzar sus metas y en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a su hogar.
texts.en:
Valeria, age 28, is married and has a seven year old son.  They live together in the Echeandia canton in the Bolivar province.  She belongs to the Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank.

She is a Yambal consultant, and she sells cosmetics.  She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to expand the business.  She makes her purchases in Riobamba every 15 days.

Her dream is to expand the business in order to contribute more to her family.  Her challenge is reaching her goals.  

She likes to devote her free time to her household.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is 32 years old and married. He has two children who are 1 and 3 years old; they do not yet go to school. He has farmed for 13 years and will use the loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow maize

loans.name: Jenny Adriana

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 18 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia (Edredones y Sabanas)ya que se dedica a la venta de estos articulos realiza las compras en Quito cada mes. su sueño es mejorar en el negocio y llegar a cumplir con las metas propuestas. En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar junto a sus padres.
texts.en:
Jenny is 18 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in the Echeandia Province of Bolivar. She's a member of the Cooperativa Mujeres Emprendedoras Solidarity Group. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise (quilts and sheets) because she makes a living selling these items. She goes shopping in Quito once a month. Her dream is to improve her business and reach her intended goals. In her free time she likes to spend time with her parents.

loans.use: to buy quilts.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza was born in 1994. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shahnoza is a student of the 3rd course at Tajikistan State University. She studies economy. Since childhood she has dreamed to get higher education and now little by little she is realizing her dream. 

Shahnoza is asking for a loan of 400 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks KIVA lenders for their help.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael and his wife have worked on their current farm, situated in the outskirts of the town of Eldoret, Kenya, since 2008. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise and also the maize and vegetables they grow. Michael has further invested in transportation services to reduce their transportation costs and to make money by offering the service to other farmers. Michael loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this, and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm successful. Michael is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk buyers in the market are really growing diverse in Kenya. Consuming milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass: we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. Today, milk consumers are spoiled for choice: in the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice, and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Michael to see these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that the qualities of their product adapt to the changes in consumer preference. Purchasing a pedigree cow shows how Michael is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and that the milk quality is second to none in the market. He anticipates that feeding will be his highest milk production cost. This, to him, is acceptable because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly. Your loan will make a significant difference to Michael’s farm profitability. The couple will use the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education, and then reinvest in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their family. They hope that their kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree cow

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero, tiene 2 hijos, y trabaja como soldador de construcción.
Él es buen padre, honesto, responsable, activo, constante, trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en construcciones en la localidad de ‘el Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola de; carne, verduras y granos. Productores campesinos y distribuidores de la ciudad se agrupan para comprar y vender. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Javier es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que todavía no están en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es el de soldador de construcción; desarrolla su actividad en numerosas obras y talleres que hacen soldaduras de estructuras metálicas, tuberías, depósitos, aparatos a presión y otros. “Aunque viviésemos dos vidas, nos harían falta varias más para llegar a conocer todo lo referente a las soldaduras. Si alguien dice que sabe todo de soldaduras. Es que no sabe nada de soldaduras…” comenta. La localidad donde vive y trabaja es una zona alejada, donde existe sólo un camino principal asfaltado que es recorrido por todas las personas a diario, para llegar a su trabajo debe caminar varios kilómetros desde el camino por sendas de tierra y piedras dónde solo se accede mediante moto o bicicleta. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio de soldadura. Él desea realizar la compra de una motocicleta para movilizarse de su casa a su fuente laboral. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta para transportarse desde su casa a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Javier is 23 years old, single and has two children. He works as a construction solderer. He is a good father, honest, responsible, active, consistent and hard-working. His work is done on site in the 'el Turno ' area, a rural area characterized by agricultural business; meat, vegetables and grains. Producing farmers and distributors of the city get together to buy and sell. It has a hot tropical and humid climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Javier is dark-skinned, short black hair, short in stature and with a slight build. His native language is Guarani and he speaks Spanish from the general culture and business. He lives his life with his children who are yet school-aged. He lives in a rented house made out of bricks that has electricity and well water.

His work is a construction solderer. he works in different sites and workshops that solder metal structures, pipes, tanks, pressure equipment and others. 'Even if we lived two lives we would never come to know everything to do with soldering. If someone says that they know everything about soldering, then they know nothing about soldering', he comments.

The place where he lives is an isolated area where there is only one paved road that everyone travels daily. To get to his work he has to a number of km. from the paved road on stone and earth paths which you can only access on bicycle or motorcycle. His dream is to have his own soldering business. He wants to buy a motorcycle to get from his house to where his work sites. This is his first loan with the institute in the two years he has doe this work. For these reasons Javier is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to transport himself from his home to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport from his house to his work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on clothes, shoes, lotions, and cosmetics in order to make the business grow and to have more customers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old. He is married to Peris, and together they have been blessed with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 9. Peris is a farmer, and so she provides additional income for her family.

Paul is a farmer as well, a business he has done for the last 8 years, earning a monthly income of 95,000 KES.

Paul has requested a loan of 70,000 KES. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he will use it to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and to pay his laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Paul will be able to buy an asset to enhance his farming: a tractor.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in everything he does.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings and to pay his laborers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30 years old and married, and together with his spouse he has been blessed with 3 children. He does dairy farming in the town of Kapsabet and has been in the farming business for close to 2 years. 

He plans to use this loan to buy a heifer dairy cow. He will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for his children. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to be successful in his businesses, to make more income, and to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SEWA ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SORON/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des graines d'arachide, de céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SEWA sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. KOROTIMI, 1ère femme assise à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Kgs de graine d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sewa group are, on average, 40 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional, extended families in Soron/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other from family ties and work buying and selling groundnuts, cereals, and condiments. 

After having reimbursed their previous loans correctly, the women of the Sewa group are now on their third group loan. 

Korotimi, the first woman sitting on the left of the photo, hopes to use her loan to buy 50 kilograms of groundnuts. She procures her goods where she lives and in surrounding villages. She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs, which will be used to help cover health, dietary, housing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her businesses.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolas de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa el se dedica a la venta de hotdog desde hace vario años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografia, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, hierro, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su esposa puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Nicolas is 61 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked selling hotdogs for a number of years. He wants to improve his house building a room in the place indicated in the photo. But with what he makes he can't manage it. So he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks and re-bar and to pay for labor. Then he and his wife can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, re-bar, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alberto Guadalupe

texts.es: alberto de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de doble propósito desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una vaca para engorde y así poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Alberto at 66 years of age lives with his wife and son. He has worked raising cattle for meat and milk for more than 20 years. He sells his product in the various markets. He is requesting a loan to buy a cow to fatten, so he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera tiene una hijita de tres años de edad,  su negocio es la venta de juguetes y regalos en su bazar y jugueteria
Ella es buena madre, responsable, constante, independiente y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur  de la ciudad de la Paz un lugar caracterizado por el creciente comercio en todas las áreas de clima cálido, con una temperatura constante entre 17-20 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Valeria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, habla español,  Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos y aprovechar las ventas de fin de año, solicito el préstamo para incrementar sus productos en su negocio que es la venta de juguetes infantiles, como: AngryBirds, Barbie, BeanieBallz, Caillou, Disney Aviones, Disney Figuras, Dora la Exploradora, Dragones, Educativos, Furby, Juegos de Cartas, peluches, Juguetes de Bebé, etc. en un puesto de venta fijo. Ella conoce por su experiencia que las ventas a fin de año de sus productos se duplican generando mejores ingresos para su familia. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable, y desea realizar la compra por mayor de juguetes surtidos para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Valeria solicita un préstamo para la compra de juguetes surtidos por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Valeria is 23, single and has a 3 year old daughter. her business is selling toys and gifts in her store.She is a good mother, responsible, constant, independent and hard-working. Her business is in the south area of the city of la Paz, characterized by a growing commerce in all areas. The climate is hot with a constant temperature between 17 and 20 degrees Celsius during the whole year. Valeria is dark-skinned with long lack hair and medium stature. She speaks Spanish. Due to the need to improve her income and take advantage of sales at the end of the year, she is requesting a loan to increase the products in her store. She sells toys like AngryBirds, Barbie, BeanieBallz, Caillou, Disney Airplanes, Disney Figures, Dora the Explorer, Dragons, Educativos, Furby, card games, stuffed toys, baby toys, etc. in a fixed sales location. She knows from experience that the sales of her products double at the end of the year generating greater income for her family. Her dream is to have a stable business and she wants to buy toys wholesale to take advantage of the end of year sales. This is her 3rd loan with the institution in the 8 years she has been in business. Foe these reasons Valeria is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of toys wholesale to take advantage of the end of the year sales and pay the expenses for her child.

loans.use: to buy a variety of toys wholesale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a milk-supply business in Kapsabet town and has been running this business for two years. She is 39 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with four children. 

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more stock of milk to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future, she hopes to expand her business and be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk to sell

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 30 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 9 years; three of them go to school. She has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her workers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize to resell.

loans.name: Magoza Group

texts.en:
Monica, who is in her mid 50s, is married with seven kids; all of them are grown up. She has been running a genge (small grocery store) business for six months now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Monica's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge. She dreams of owning a food shop.

Monica will share this loan with her loan group "Magoza," which consists of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge (small grocery store).

loans.name: Kaknika

texts.en:
Kaknika is a 20-year-old student who is studying management major in the third year at university in a city. She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nowadays, she also works in a company, making USD 6 a day. 

Due to a shortage of financial support, Kaknika has decided to get a loan to pay her third-year university fee. With the loan, she will be able to go through the third year successfully. 

For her plan after graduation, she is going to find another better job with a reasonable salary to improve her living.

loans.use: to pay her third-year university fee

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente du sucre, des habits et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. YABAKORO, 2ème  femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Kgs d’oignon, 25Kgs de sel, 4 paquets de Cube Maggi, 20Litres d’huile, 20Kgs de beurre de karité, 4 panier de choux et 20Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Ben group are, on average, 29 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional extended families in Koro/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling sugar, clothing, and condiments.

After having reimbursed their previous loans correctly, the Ben group is on their eighth group loan. 

Yabakoro, the second woman standing from the right of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 50 kilograms of onions, 25 kilograms of salt, four packets of Maggi cubes, 20 liters of oil, 20 liters of Shea butter, four trays of cabbage, and 20 kilograms of peppers. She procures her goods in her area and in surrounding villages. 

She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. She will reinvest the rest into her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Abiceal

texts.en:
Abiceal is 42 years. She is married to David, and together they have been blessed with seven children of ages between 20 and 4 years.

Abiceal sells energy saving charcoal stoves, a business she has done for the last year, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Abiceal has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 10,000, which she will use to buy energy saving charcoal stoves.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to prosper in everything she does.

loans.use: to buy energy saving charcoal stoves

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 30 years old and a single mother of four children. She buys green tea leaves and sells them to various tea processing companies. She has been in this business for two years. She also does poultry farming. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more green tea leaves to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future she hopes to grow this business, earn more income, improve her family's living standards, and be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Mayramby

texts.en:
Mayramby was born in 1985. She is widowed. Mayramby does not have any children. She is a seamstress and sews a variety of women's clothes. Mayramby has been busy with this business for more than two years. Mayramby offers her service in her house and has regular customers. Mayramby works hard every day for 10 hours. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy coal for the winter season because in the winter season the weather is cold and she needs coal. She awaits your mercy and really needs your financial support.

loans.use: to buy coal for the winter season

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 39 years old and a widow with four children. She sells cereals and has been in this business for four years now. She also does dairy farming.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of maize and beans to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her business and be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 26 years old. She is married without children. She has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her workers.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow maize to sell.

loans.name: Vuslat

texts.en:
Vuslat is married with three daughters. She began working with jewelry years ago when they needed money, and this year will continue working. Since winter began she has been making jewelry to order for her customers. When the weather is good she opens her stand and sells from there. 

With her third loan, she will buy materials to make jewelry. She’ll make pieces both to fill orders and to sell in the summer.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Vuslat hanım evli ,üç kız annesi.  Yıllar önce maddi sıkıntılar yüzünden başladığı takı işini bu senede devam ettiriyor.  Kış sezonu başladığından takılarını belirli müşterilerine sipariş üzerine satış yapıyor.  Güzel havalarda hafta sonunda tezgahını açarak satışını buradan da devam ettiriyor.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile tekrar takı malzemeleri alacak.  Hem siparişlerini karşılayacak hem de yaz sezonuna takı hazırlayacak.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make different types of jewelry

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 42 years old, single, and a trader who live in Osu-Accra. She is an elementary school leaver, has been with ID-Ghana for four years, and is in her seventh loan cycle. She has been selling assorted drinks for six years in Osu; she buys the drinks from the wholesalers and sells them to her customers.  She has a sample of the products in the photo. 

The drinks business in Ghana is very good, and Constance will use her loan request of GHS 2,000 to buy assorted drinks to sell to customers. 

She has been able to repay her previous loans successfully, so is happy to receive Kiva support.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks and sell to customers.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe LAIDOU ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente du savon, du soumbala et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur 8ème prêt solidaire. SITAN,  femme debout au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 cartons de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Laidou group are, on average, 35 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Koro/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling soap, soumbala, and condiments.

After having reimbursed their previous loans correctly, the women in the Laidou group are now on their eighth group loan. 

Sitan, the woman standing in the middle of the photo, plans to use her loan to buy six cartons of soap. She procures her goods in her area from wholesalers. She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des boissons, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire. KADIA, 1ère femme assise à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100Kgs de mil, 100Kgs de maïs, 50Kgs de fonio, 70Kgs de haricot et 50Kgs de graine d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Siguidia group are, on average, 37 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through families ties and work buying and selling various goods, drinks, cereals, and condiments. 

After having paid back their previous loans correctly, the women of the Siguidia group are on their fourth group loan.
