Kadia, the first woman seated on the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilograms of millet, 100 kilograms of corn, 50 kilograms of fonio, 70 kilograms of beans, and 50 kilograms of groundnuts. She procures her goods from her area and in surrounding villages. 

She makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural goods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicida, semillas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en: This young woman whose image has been blurred because she is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk zone, has worked growing corn and beans for many years. She lives in her own home with her partner in life and her son. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and to improve her land which is shown in the photograph, to continue with her farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and to improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oilcloth for her greenhouse, mineral fertilizers, and tomato, melon and cabbage seeds so she can grow organic crops

loans.name: Sabou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOU ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KORO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente du sucre, des habits et des condiments.
Les femmes du groupe SABOU sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. TATA, 2ème  femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20Kgs d’oignon, 25Kgs de sel, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi, 20Litres d’huile, 20Kgs de beure de karité et 20Kgs de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabou group are on average 40 years old with three children and all live in extended traditional families in Koro/Segou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
These women met through family links and work in the trade of sugar, clothing and condiments.
This is the first loan for the women of the Sabou group. Tata, the second woman from right to left in the photo; plans to use her loan to buy 20 kg of onions, 25 kg of salt, two packets of Maggi cubes, 20 litres of oil, 20 kg of shea butter and 20 kg of chili. She buys her supplies locally from wholesalers. She sells her goods to a mixed clientele for cash or for credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20'000 FCFA which she will use for expenses relative to health, food, clothing and school fees, and she will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old. She is married to Victor and together they have been blessed with 6 children aged between 10 and 7 years.

Esther sells energy saving charcoal stoves, a business she has done for the last year, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 1,500.

Esther has requested for her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 10,000, which she will use to buy to buy energy saving charcoal stoves 'jikos' for resale at a profit.

With her anticipated profits, Esther will be able to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy energy saving charcoal stoves 'jikos'

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et du boisson.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. BATOMA, 1ère femme à gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 carton de Spaghetti, 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton d’eau de javel, 1 carton de biscuit, 2 paquets de Cube Maggi, 20Kgs de farine de blé et 15Kgs de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group are, on average, 30 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the areas in San/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through family ties and work buying and selling various goods and drinks.

After having paid back their previous loan correctly, the women of the Sabaly group are on their third group loan. 

Batoma, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy one carton of spaghetti, two cartons of soap, one carton of bleach, one carton of cookies, two packets of Maggi cubes, 20 kilograms of flour, and 15 kilograms of sugar. She procures these goods in her area from wholesalers. 

Batoma makes her sales to male and female customers for cash and often for credit. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which will help to cover health, dietary, clothing, and school costs. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: "The start of a new year feels so momentous: 365 brand new days, with no mistakes in them. There's so much opportunity stretched out in front of us: opportunities to finally live up to our full potential at the farms." says Erick. At a time when many farmers in Kenya are abandoning dairy farming and agriculture owing to poor yield and low income, Erick, hailing from Litein, is scripting a success story with his dairy farming. He is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver. For the past five years, he has been involved in mixed farming, and his primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Erick has been able to provide nutritious food for his family. After he lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family has been overwhelming because of the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made him give up. “I have to do something for my family," he said. Erick is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that he plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase his business enterprise. Erick is very visionary, and he intends that in the near future, he will start adding value to his milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. He will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure his family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, he will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Erick believes that if smallholder farmers had the same access to resources as large scale farmers, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Ebru

texts.en:
Ebru is single. She first sold jewelry and gift items and now sells jeans. Since everyone sells jewelry on the shore, she wanted to do something different and happened to find cheap jeans she could sell. Her sales were good. She stopped selling jewelry and now only sells jeans. With her third loan she will once again buy jeans to sell. Since it’s winter she has been selling from her home, and when the weather it good she is thinking to reopen her stand.  

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Ebru Hanım bekar.  Takı ve hediyelik eşya satarak başladığı işine kot pantolon satarak devam etti.  Sahilde herkes takı satıyordu.  Biraz değişiklik yapmak istemiş ve tesadüfen ucuza bulduğu  kotları getirip satmaya başladı.  Satışları iyi gitti ve kot işi tutunca takı satmayı bırakıp kot işini  devam ettirdi.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile tekrardan kot alıp satacak.  Kış olduğundan satışlarını evden yapacak ve güzel havalarda tezgahını açmayı düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy jeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in paying for the right to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint, polish, acids and other supplies.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia ses iefgue dedicando al negocio de venta de picarones,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de picarones.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina y camote.

La socia esta feliz con el credito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is still selling picarones [a dessert that is prepared from a sweet potato dough and is eaten with honey]. She wants to get ahead with the help of her business, and dreams of expanding it.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour and sweet potatoes. This loan makes her feel happy, and she promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy flour and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Çiğdem has run a cafe on the shore for four years. She began with the advice of a friend who worked in accounting and likes this job very much. Her social circle has expanded, and she likes being around people all the time. This year she wants to expand her cafe to also serve food. Her third loan will help pay for the work on the kitchen. Her goal is to enclose the open part of her cafe in glass.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Çiğdem Hanım dört yıldır sahilde cafe  işletiyor.  Muhasebe de çalışırken bir arkadaşının önerisi ile başladığı bu işten çok memnun.  Sosyal çevresi genişlemiş.  Sürekli insanlarla bir arada olmaktan memnun.  Bu yıl cafeye mutfak ilave ederek yemek vermek istiyor.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile de mutfak yapımına katkı sağlayacak.  Hedefi daha çok kazanarak cafenin açık olan bölümünü cam bölme ile kapatmak.

loans.use: to pay for work on the kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make necessary renovations for her house.

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Shalom with the average age of 49 years. They are into the businesses of grocery and pedicure. 

Lydia is 59 years old and sells groceries at her residence in Chorkor. She buys the items (milk, Milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, rice, etc.) from the main market and sells to her customers. She has been a member of this group for five years and needs this loan to expand her business. In six successive loan cycles she has been able to do good savings deposit and has improved business tremendously. She attended school to the secondary level but decided to join her friend and learn how to trade. Lydia is standing in the right in the photo with the sample of her products in her palm.

She need GHS 3,000 to be able to purchase more milk, Milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, rice, etc. to sell to her customers.

Together with her colleague, they need a total of GHS 5,500 to be able to expand their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for the payment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, Milo, coffee, eggs, sugar, noodles, rice, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Silvia Cecilia

texts.es: Silvia de 26 años de edad es madre soltera y vive al lado de su hijo de 7 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace 4 años para poder darle lo mejor a su hijo que es su mayor alegría. Silvia desea construir un muro de piedra en su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, actualmente tiene una de bambús que es provisional, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: piedra, cemento y arena para construir un muro de piedra en su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo recibido anteriormente  para ala mejora de sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Silvia is 26 years old and is a single mother that has lived with her 7-year-old son in her own home for some time now. She is a very hard-working woman that has worked providing household services for 4 years to be able to give the best to her son, which is her greatest joy.

Silvia wants to build a rock wall at her home, since you can see in the photo, she currently has an interim wall made of bamboo. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy rocks, cement and sand to build a rock wall at her home. She is thankful for the support she received previously for the improving of her housing conditions.

loans.use: to buy rocks, cement and sand to build a rock wall at her home.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badegna  est composé uniquement de  femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce,  du charbon de bois, du miel et des feuilles communément appelé fagoï. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramata   (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du  charbon de bois. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du charbon de bois en gros dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Daoudabougou à une clientèle mixte. Madame Ramata   espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Badenga group is exclusively made up of polygamous women. They are on average 49 years old with five children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the districts of Bamako and met through neighbourhood links. The members of this group deal in small trade of charcoal, honey, and leaves commonly named fagoi. In the interests of increasing their business assets, the members of this group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Ramata (the second woman from the right to the left in the photo) has a good reputation for her sales of charcoal. She plans to use her loan to buy one wholesale load of charcoal in the villages neighbouring Bamako. She sells her goods retail in Daoudabougou to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Ramata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business. In this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a plot of land for lodgings.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: josé de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, laminas, polines, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
José, 34, lives in a house of his own together with his family. He works for a private company.

José wants to improve his house by building a room (the picture shows where he would build it). However, he does not earn enough, so he needed a loan.

José will buy cement, sand, bricks, metal sheets, beams, and iron bars, and will pay for the labor needed to build the room, which will result in a safer and more comfortable home for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, metal sheets, beams, and iron bars, and pay for the labor needed to build a room.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is from Tajikistan. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. She loves her country very much.

She is 40 years old. Nargis is divorced and has three children. To make a living, she sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns little money for these activities. Nargis works day by day in the local market. She works around 10 hours a day. She thinks her activity is going well because she is very kind and she always loves what she does.

She is requesting a loan of 3,500 Somoni, which will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital

loans.name: Rahmonaly

texts.en: Rahmonaly is a student. He is not married and lives with his parents. Rahmonaly studies at the Tajikistan Economy and Finance University. He is a student of the 4th course. Rahmonaly studies full time. He is one of the best students. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition of the university. He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails for construction of a hallway in his home and plastering the walls.

loans.name: Amelida

texts.es:
Amelida tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, vive con su familia en una zona rural el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores del distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una congeladora para su tienda. Con esto Amelida espera conservar en mejor estado los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, lo que le generará un mayor nivel de ingresos mejorando también su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amelida is 52 years old, married, and lives with her family in a rural area of the Oyotún district.  This is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Perú. The residents of the district are mainly engaged in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

She makes a living selling groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, beans, etc. Her business is located in her household. She has over 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area. 

The loan will be used to purchase a freezer for her store.  With this loan, Amelia expects to keep the products she offers her customers in better condition. As a result, she will earn a better living and also improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for her store.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 27 years old. She is married to Charles and together they have been blessed with four children of ages between 13 and 4 years respectively.

Ivy sells energy-saving charcoal stoves, a business she has done for the last one year, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Ivy has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 10,000 which she will use to buy energy saving charcoal stoves, "jikos," for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Ivy will be able to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to prosper in life as her children are catered for.

loans.use: to buy energy saving charcoal stoves-- "jikos"

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 31 years old. He is married with three children aged between two and eight years old, two of whom go to school. He has farmed for 11 years and will use this loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers to grow and sell maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow and sell maize.

loans.name: Marijha

texts.en:
Marijha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet café business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase computer supplies for her internet café business.

Marijha successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Marijha's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase computer supplies for her internet cafe.
